name: Aroha Restaurant&Bar
homepage_content: Aroha Restaurant and Bar – Asian Restaurant, Bar and Gaming Lounge “An absolute treasure! The best Asian Chinese cuisine I have had for years – our new favourite local restaurant. Exquisite food, cooked beautifully. We like clean, fresh tastes and this was perfect. “ Aroha Restaurant and Bar Welcome to Aroha Restaurant and Bar, where we bring you the exquisite flavors of Cantonese cuisine in a warm and inviting atmosphere. Located in Waitakere city, Auckland, Aroha is the perfect destination for a delightful dining experience, whether you’re here for a casual meal or a special occasion. “I’ve been coming here for years, and the quality never wavers. The Sizzling Beef and Salt and pepper chicken are my go-to dishes. Always a satisfying meal.” – Robert L. Our Specialty: Cantonese Cuisine At Aroha, we pride ourselves on serving authentic Cantonese dishes, prepared by our skilled chefs using the freshest ingredients. Our menu features a wide variety of traditional favourites, including: Dim Sum : Enjoy a selection of handcrafted dim sum, including Deep Fried Wontons, Pork Buns and Dumplings. Sizzling Plate: A must-try at Aroha. Served hot and full of flavour, including Sizzling soy sauce on beef/lamb/chicken and Sizzling pork chop with peking sauce. Seafood Delicacies : Savour our signature dishes like Steamed Fish, Salt and Pepper squid and Crispy garlic prawns. Roast Meats : Indulge in our succulent Roast Duck, BBQ pork and Soy Sauce Chicken Stir-Fried Delights : Try our popular stir-fried dishes, such as beef with black bean sauce, Kung pao chicken and mixed vegetables. “A very clean and tidy restaurant with great prices and friendly service. This restaurant has quickly become our favorite” – William T Fully Licensed Bar To complement our delicious food, Aroha also boasts a fully licensed bar. Our extensive drink menu features a variety of wines, beers, and spirits. We also take pride in offering a wide selection of refreshing bubble teas, perfect for pairing with our meals or enjoying on their own. Whether you’re celebrating a special occasion or just unwinding after a long day, our bar has the perfect drink for you. Visit Us Experience the best of Cantonese cuisine and exceptional service at Aroha Restaurant and Bar. We look forward to welcoming you soon. “ A hidden gem! The atmosphere is welcoming, and the food is consistently delicious. The staff goes above and beyond to make you feel at home.” – Jessica R.

name: Aroma India
homepage_content: Apache2 Ubuntu Default Page: It works Apache2 Ubuntu Default Page It works! This is the default welcome page used to test the correct operation of the Apache2 server after installation on Ubuntu systems. It is based on the equivalent page on Debian, from which the Ubuntu Apache packaging is derived. If you can read this page, it means that the Apache HTTP server installed at this site is working properly. You should replace this file (located at /var/www/html/index.html ) before continuing to operate your HTTP server. If you are a normal user of this web site and don't know what this page is about, this probably means that the site is currently unavailable due to maintenance. If the problem persists, please contact the site's administrator. Configuration Overview Ubuntu's Apache2 default configuration is different from the upstream default configuration, and split into several files optimized for interaction with Ubuntu tools. The configuration system is fully documented in /usr/share/doc/apache2/README.Debian.gz . Refer to this for the full documentation. Documentation for the web server itself can be found by accessing the manual if the apache2-doc package was installed on this server. The configuration layout for an Apache2 web server installation on Ubuntu systems is as follows: /etc/apache2/ |-- apache2.conf | `-- ports.conf |-- mods-enabled | |-- *.load | `-- *.conf |-- conf-enabled | `-- *.conf |-- sites-enabled | `-- *.conf apache2.conf is the main configuration file. It puts the pieces together by including all remaining configuration files when starting up the web server. ports.conf is always included from the main configuration file. It is used to determine the listening ports for incoming connections, and this file can be customized anytime. Configuration files in the mods-enabled/ , conf-enabled/ and sites-enabled/ directories contain particular configuration snippets which manage modules, global configuration fragments, or virtual host configurations, respectively. They are activated by symlinking available configuration files from their respective *-available/ counterparts. These should be managed by using our helpers a2enmod, a2dismod, a2ensite, a2dissite, and a2enconf, a2disconf . See their respective man pages for detailed information. The binary is called apache2. Due to the use of environment variables, in the default configuration, apache2 needs to be started/stopped with /etc/init.d/apache2 or apache2ctl . Calling /usr/bin/apache2 directly will not work with the default configuration. Document Roots By default, Ubuntu does not allow access through the web browser to any file apart of those located in /var/www , public_html directories (when enabled) and /usr/share (for web applications). If your site is using a web document root located elsewhere (such as in /srv ) you may need to whitelist your document root directory in /etc/apache2/apache2.conf . The default Ubuntu document root is /var/www/html . You can make your own virtual hosts under /var/www. This is different to previous releases which provides better security out of the box. Reporting Problems Please use the ubuntu-bug tool to report bugs in the Apache2 package with Ubuntu. However, check existing bug reports before reporting a new bug. Please report bugs specific to modules (such as PHP and others) to respective packages, not to the web server itself.

No wait for a table & little wait for our Kai to start coming. I loved that we could quickly scan & order and that the online menu had photos of the dishes & was available in English. We ordered 8 different dishes which cost in excess of eighty dollars. Service was efficient & friendly. Our table was clean & the restaurant was also clean. Phil N Unfortunately did not have the best experience, waited a long time for each meal to arrive. Each meal took about 15mins, it wasn’t a busy night but there were a couple of big families which could have caused the delay. By the time the next meal came our food became cold or we finished it because we were so hungry. Some dishes were tasty but definitely overpriced for the portion size. We ordered the sweet and sour pork regular $22 - as shown in the pictures, the bowl was bigger than the portion of food. It was tasty but so disappointing. Very deceiving!!! The spicy chicken had more chilli than chicken pieces and only skin parts. Again very small portion for the cost. The crab fried rice was $36 as you can tell from the image the bowl is deceiving. Maybe enough for 2 people. The dimsum was not as tasty as the other spots we have been too! Must say the sweet and sour was very nice. Other meals were average and pricey. Highly recommend the sweet sour and get the larger size even if it’s just 2 people. You’ll probably get about 8 good 8 good pieces with the regular 😂 Guttered we didn’t enjoy it because it’s so close to home and we’re hoping to make it our regular dimsum spot but maybe another time might be better experience? Nirmatha Arul (Travel Acc) Peking duck here is very nice very thin wrap also the lettuce second course is one of the best i ever tasted. it has perfect amount of flavors with no weird smell and the size of the meat and vege is perfect. Hyesun lee The front desk clerk with glasses was extremely rude, speaking loudly to customers and being impatient. I encountered this twice. She was also rude to other staff members, being loud and rude, glaring, lecturing them, and constantly nagging. Because of her, I won't be back. It was intimidating and unsettling, even though I loved the food. Kiki Conveniently located with plenty of parking in the vicinty of the restaurant. Nice and clean, new, modern looking restaurant. Friendly staff. Most of the food we ordered was good, especially the sesame balls, coriander + shrimp dumplings. The prawn rice rolls however, had an unusual taste & the prawn at the ends of the rice rolls were cold.. fancy looking desserts at the counter area. Overall a good dine in experience. We paid ~$85 for 3 people Christine

Probably the best Fish n Chips I have had in Palmerston North. Definitely recommend! I have reviewed the fish and chips from here before as they are amazing! So I have to share about their fish burgers too. They are so yummy... So much fish! And the buns are toasted! It's not drowned in tarter sauce, just enough to know its there. Incase you can't tell, I realllly like these burgers! Nice food, took a while to make however they were very busy both in shop and over the phone based on the amount of people that walked in after and collected. They had plenty of staff to try and cope. Good food, just be prepared to wait during peak times. name: Ahi.
homepage_content: Welcome to Our Home • Ahi. Restaurant Auckland Experience New Zealand food at its best Ahi. is open for lunch + dinner, every day. Ahi. delivers the finest, freshest New Zealand dining experience, right in the heart of Downtown Auckland . Chef Ben Bayly handpicks the best and freshest ingredients from across New Zealand, while our drink options boast a curated selection of the finest wines, spirits, and craft beers. Our organic vegetables come straight from the soil at Ahi Kitchen Garden in South Auckland, delivering the freshest flavours in every dish. Let us take you on a culinary journey through the very best of our beautiful country. Find us on level 2 of Commercial Bay, on the north-east corner. Make a booking… The Ahi. menu We created the Ahi. menu to celebrate authentic New Zealand food: fresh organic produce and ingredients with complex, intense flavours, grown by New Zealanders embracing regenerative agriculture. Our wine list has been carefully curated by Lucile and the team to offer a true representation of New Zealand’s unique wine regions and styles. Our menu The Ahi. Garden The rich, red volcanic soil of Patumāhoe, organic growing practices, and the shortest possible time from harvest to table all combine to create incredible flavours. Our Garden Reservations & Special Requests Make a reservation here , or to get in touch with Ahi. directly, text us on 0225 AHI AKL ( +64 225 244 255 ). Reservations Origine Bistro Visit our sister bistro Origine , a modern kiwi bistro with a spectacular view over Auckland harbour.

name: Cotto
homepage_content: Auckland's Food and Drink Hotspots – Eat, Sip, Repeat From Hidden Gems to Iconic Favorites for Food Lovers Welcome to Auckland’s ultimate restaurant guide , where we bring you the city’s best restaurants, from world-renowned establishments to local hotspots serving up unforgettable flavours. From waterfront brunches and innovative fine dining to craft cocktails in cosy bars, our handpicked selections will navigate you through the city’s burgeoning food scene. Let’s dive into Auckland’s most delicious hotspots ! Where to Eat: Auckland’s Must-Try Food Spots Auckland is a food lover’s paradise, offering a wide range of flavours, top-rated eateries, and hidden culinary gems. From fine dining to cosy neighbourhood favourites, the city serves everything from fusion dishes to authentic international cuisine, with endless lunch options and delicious breakfast choices to kickstart the day. For those with a sweet tooth, Auckland’s bakeries offer artisan bread, flaky croissants, and mouthwatering pastries for a perfect treat anytime. Where to Drink: Auckland’s Best Cafés and Bars Auckland’s drinking scene offers something for every occasion, whether you’re enjoying a relaxed afternoon tea or a night out with friends. Sports bars across the city provide the perfect setting for watching live games, indulging in pub-style food, and soaking up the lively atmosphere. For a more refined experience, high tea offers a selection of teas, finger sandwiches, and pastries, while expert bartenders mix top-quality cocktails with local ingredients and rooftop bars to let you enjoy stunning views of the city skyline. Savour the Local Taste: Auckland’s Real Food Experience New Zealand’s food culture is deeply rooted in tradition and local produce, with Auckland offering the perfect opportunity to experience it. Traditional Māori dishes, like hāngī, rewena bread, and seafood delicacies, highlight the country’s indigenous culinary heritage. For a taste of fresh, locally sourced ingredients, Auckland’s farmers’ markets are a must-visit, featuring everything from organic vegetables to artisanal cheeses, showcasing the best of the region’s farm-to-table flavours. Food and Drink Blog: Auckland’s Hottest Trends Be in the know about the newest tendencies and must-have experiences in New Zealand’s lively food and beverage landscape, from leading chefsexperimenting with new techniques to local products. Indulge in the depth of flavours of New Zealand, such as indigenous herbs and world-class seafood, and have fun during seasonal events such as strawberry picking in Auckland. Beer enthusiasts can discover the craft beer scene , and dog owners can look for dog-friendly cafés that serve great coffee and have a welcoming atmosphere for you and your dog. Start Your Auckland Food and Drink Adventure Internal information on secrets, near-future events, and seasonal specials. Uncover the ultimate food and drink experience in Auckland . Whether you’re craving haute cuisine, a bite on the run, or the perfect place to order a drink, Auckland has it all. Use this guide to find the city’s top food and drink spots and sample the fare that has made New Zealand the food destination of choice. For more insights, you can visit Heart of the City . Begin the culinary journey! With its thriving food scene, breathtaking places, and passionate foodie chefs who share your food obsession, Auckland will become an unmatchable food destination soon enough. From award-winning restaurants to late-night comfort food, the city food scene has it all and caters to all tastes. Whether you feel the urge for your favourite type of food or drink, Auckland’s multicultural and dynamic food scene has something for everyone.

name: Bombay Cuisine
homepage_content: Choice Cuisine Bombay | Order Indian Food Online For Takeaways - Order Meal Entree Kick Off Your Culinary Journey with Our Entrees Mains A Symphony of Tastes: Our Main Courses Are the Maestro's Choice Contact Us Reach Out and Connect - We Love Hearing from You! Bombay Cuisine Bombay Cuisine Restaurant, nestled at 216 Mill Road in Bombay, New Zealand, offers a tantalizing journey through the flavors of Indian cuisine. With a warm and inviting ambiance, this restaurant is a haven for food enthusiasts seeking an authentic taste of Bombay's culinary heritage. At Bombay Cuisine, every dish is meticulously crafted using traditional recipes and the finest ingredients, ensuring an explosion of flavors with every bite. From aromatic biryanis to creamy butter chicken, each dish showcases the rich diversity and vibrant spices of Indian cooking. The menu features a wide array of options to cater to every palate, including vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free selections. Whether you're craving the fiery heat of a vindaloo or the comforting warmth of a lentil curry, there's something to delight every taste bud. The restaurant's commitment to excellence extends beyond its delectable cuisine. The attentive staff members are dedicated to providing exceptional service, ensuring that every guest feels welcomed and cared for throughout their dining experience. Whether you're enjoying a meal with family, friends, or colleagues, Bombay Cuisine offers the perfect setting for any occasion. So, come indulge your senses and embark on a culinary journey to Bombay without leaving New Zealand. name: Gothenburg Restaurant
homepage_content: Gothenburg Restaurant – Exquisite Tapas Dining in Hamilton, NZ Skip to content We offer a delicious tapas dining experience in Hamilton – perfect for casual meals, special occasions, and afternoon drinks right next to the Waikato River. book a table Tapas Our tapas are plates designed to share, order a selection of them for the table and enjoy the variety. The bigger your group, the more flavours you will be able to sample. Food is best enjoyed freshly made, so our dishes are brought to your table as they are being prepared, some are fast and some take a little longer. Don’t miss out on our delicious desserts and cheese selection. If you are feeling adventurous, try a chef’s selection! Your server will be happy to help. see menu Venue Gothenburg is located on the lower floor of the ANZ Centre on 17 Grantham Street. Our stunning dining room has an airy feel with floor to ceiling windows and an amazing view of the Waikato River banks. Our outdoor terrace is a calm spot in the centre of the city where you can enjoy tapas or a drink on a sunny day. Gothenburg is just as suited for casual meals as special occasions, after work drinks or a coffee on the terrace, so come and enjoy our beautiful location by the river. Functions Location Our restaurant is situated right in the middle of central Hamilton, but tucked away in a very quiet spot by the river. We are a popular destination for riders on the Te Awa River Trail and a nice stop on the way for visitors to the Hamilton Gardens. We are located right next to the Hamilton Museum and soon not far from the new Waikato Regional Theatre which is due to open in 2025. We are very proud to take part in what Hamilton offers to locals and visitors to the Waikato region. book a table Gift Vouchers What better way to celebrate someone’s birthday or achievement than with a bit of luxury? Our giftcards can be purchased from the restaurant or conveniently purchased online. Electronic giftcards can be emailed to you or the intended recipient, or we can post out a physical gift card within New Zealand. Buy Now stay in the know Be the first to know when we release new dishes, have special announcements and events. Name Name Email NEWSLETTER SIGN UP

name: Kolachi Cafe & Eatery
homepage_content: Kolachi Cafe & Eatery About Us Welcome to Kolachi Cafe and Eatery, a stylish gem in the heart of Napier, the vibrant Art Deco city. Recently renovated, our cafe seamlessly blends history and modernity, offering breakfast and lunch delights seven days a week. At Kolachi, we believe that breakfast and lunch are not just meals but opportunities to create cherished memories. From the moment you step through our doors, you'll be greeted with the tantalizing aromas of freshly brewed coffee and the promise of delicious dishes crafted with love and care. Our diverse menu caters to all tastes, from hearty classics to innovative and wholesome options, served seven days a week. Whether you're seeking a delightful start to your day or a relaxing lunch with friends and family, Kolachi Cafe and Eatery welcomes you with open arms. Join us as we celebrate the rich flavors of Napier, where culinary excellence meets a vibrant cultural experience. Step into Kolachi, and let us take you on a gastronomic journey like no other. Menu Kolachi ☕ Connect with us on our social media platforms listed below. Stay tuned for exciting upcoming updates! Contact 147 Emerson Street, Napier South, Napier 4110 06 833 6508 © Ektaj Singh

name: Noodle Corner
homepage_content: Noodle Corner; Home Noodle corner welcome To Noodle Corner Authentic Taste Of Thailand Menu expErIence IT FOR YOURSELF VISIT US Open from 11-8 Monday-Saturday Location A cosy night in TAKE AWAY Pick up your food instore without the wait contact Flavour of the week Steamed Bok Choi With Oyster Sauce $9.00 Locally grown Bok Choi steamed, topped with crispy fried garlic and drizzled with Oyster Sauce. Dried Egg Noodle With BQQ Pork $13.00 Egg noodle served in red sauce, with locally grown steamed Bok Choi, and tender BQQ pork. Pad Thai $14.00 Traditional Thai noodles stir fried in an array of ingredients, sauce and vegetables A sizzling array of sweet, sour and spice. Every mouthful is a bite of Thailand Noodle Corner, a simple and modern takeaway shop which aims to provide customers with an authentic taste of the Thai culture. Our cuisine consist of the fundamental flavours of sweet, sour, spicy and salty with an aromatic tinge of kaffir. Vegetarian friendly we provide substitutes such as tofu to make your experience with us as enjoyable as possible. For meat lovers we have an array of chicken, pork, beef and seafood option to ensure we cater to your preference. Drop by or give us a call to taste Thailand for yourself. Reviews We drove all over looking for this place based on the great reviews, and are so glad we did! We had the most delicious Panang curry takeout for dinner. The restaurant itself is very simple; just 6 very basic tables for 4 people each, plus a brisk carryout business. The service is friendly, our order was ready in 20 minutes tops, it was well-packed to go, and absolutely delicious. Highly recommend!.Â Winkumsmom; Tripadvisor 9 april 2017 Food was lovely and highly recommend. Thai food at it's best. Everyone found something they wanted to eat and all enjoyed their meals. Left satisfied and would go back again.Â Shannon L; Tripadvisor 29 March 2017 Fast, fresh and tasty, reasonable prices, exactly what a restaurant like this should be. Simon Britten; Google review April 9 2017 As a fairly regular visitor to Noodle Corner I have to say thanks for make such delicious food. I don't tend to divert from my favourites - pork dumplings, panang curry and pad thai but I do intend to explore the whole menu... eventually! Keep up the good work! Brighton; Tripadvisor 29 march 2017

homepage_content: Peninsula Kitchen Peninsula Kitchen Te Atatu Peninsula Home Full menu Our location Peninsula Kitchen, Te Atatu Peninsula Kitchen Welcome to Peninsula Kitchen. we are an independent, family-owned business. We have chosen the name Peninsula Kitchen as we think that’s what describes us best – offering wholesome, home-cooked food to traditional recipes and serving the Te Atatu community. eat plenty of fresh and tasty food and the warm welcome you’ve always had. So come along and see us – we’re open 6 days a week Tuesday to Sunday, and you can still place your orders over the phone on (09) 834 7111. The Kebab is a very healthy food choice. It is low in fat and ideal for people who are watching their carbohydrate and/or cholesterol levels. Kebabs are filling without being too heavy on the stomach. Fresh vegetables and meats make for high quality food at very reasonable prices. As well as kebabs, Peninsula Kitchen also offers an extensive and delicious pizza and pasta menu which includes all of your favourites, plus more! Let them become your one stop shop for quick and easy take home food for all of the family! Thanks! The team at Peninsula Kitchen Opening hours Open 6 Days Tuesday to Sunday 11:30AM to 8:30PM Ordering by phone Save time by ordering by phone. name: Petit Bocal
homepage_content: PetBiLocal – My Blog Skip to content Home 26 Sep The Timeless Appeal of Shoes: More Than Just Footwear admin Business No Comments Shoes are far more than something we slip on our feet each morning. They tell stories about who we are, where we’re going, and how we choose to present ourselves to the world. From the earliest leather sandals worn thousands of years ago to today’s designer sneakers that double as status symbols, shoes have always played a vital role in culture, style, and self-expression. The Function and Evolution of Shoes At their core, shoes serve a practical purpose: to protect our feet from the ground, weather, and injury. But over the centuries, they’ve evolved into symbols of identity and markers of social status. In ancient Egypt, the wealthy wore elaborate sandals, while commoners often went barefoot. In medieval Europe, pointed shoes signified nobility. By the 20th century, shoes were a booming industry, blending fashion and function to keep up with rapidly changing lifestyles. Today, shoes are designed with incredible versatility. There are high-performance athletic sneakers engineered with advanced cushioning, sturdy boots crafted to withstand rugged terrains, and elegant heels designed to turn heads at formal events. The choices are endless, and for many people, picking the right pair is both an art and a personal statement. Shoes as an Expression of Style Few fashion items have as much power to transform an outfit as shoes. A simple change from sneakers to loafers, or flats to stilettos, can completely shift the tone of what you’re wearing. Sneakers : Once reserved for sports, sneakers are now a global fashion staple. They’ve crossed cultural lines, pairing as easily with jeans as with dresses or suits. Boots : From rugged hiking boots to sleek ankle boots, this category is versatile enough to work across seasons and styles. Sandals : The ultimate in warm-weather footwear, sandals balance comfort and breathability with casual flair. Heels : Love them or hate them, high heels remain iconic for their ability to elongate the legs and add sophistication to an outfit. Flats : Timeless and practical, flats offer everyday comfort without sacrificing polish. This adaptability makes shoes one of the most expressive accessories in anyone’s wardrobe. The Psychology of Shoes Interestingly, shoes can also reveal quite a bit about personality. Psychologists have noted that the type of shoes someone wears often correlates with aspects of their character or lifestyle. Well-kept, polished shoes : Suggest conscientiousness and attention to detail. Colorful, bold footwear : Often associated with openness and creativity. Worn-out, practical shoes : Reflect practicality and comfort-driven priorities. In many ways, the shoes we choose act as silent introductions before we’ve said a word. Comfort Meets Technology Modern footwear isn’t just about aesthetics. Comfort and performance are now just as important as style. Sports brands invest millions into research and development, creating shoes with shock absorption, breathable fabrics, and ergonomic designs that support long-term foot health. The rise of technology has also introduced smart shoes — footwear with built-in sensors that can track steps, monitor posture, and even connect with apps for fitness tracking. These innovations show just how far shoes have come from their humble beginnings as simple coverings. The Sustainability Shift In recent years, sustainability has become a central topic in fashion, and footwear is no exception. The production of shoes often requires significant resources, from leather tanning to synthetic materials. Many companies are now rethinking their processes, focusing on eco-friendly materials and ethical production methods. Brands are experimenting with recycled plastics, plant-based leathers, and biodegradable fabrics. Consumers, too, are becoming more mindful, looking for shoes that don’t just look good but also align with their values. This shift is not only reshaping the footwear industry but also encouraging shoppers to consider longevity over fast fashion — investing in shoes that last, rather than chasing disposable trends. Collecting Shoes: A Cultural Phenomenon For some, shoes are more than functional or fashionable — they’re collectibles. Sneaker culture, in particular, has exploded worldwide. Limited-edition releases from brands like Nike or Adidas often sell out in minutes, with resellers flipping them at multiples of the retail price. High-fashion brands also contribute to this culture with exclusive drops, collaborations, and statement designs. In many ways, shoes have become cultural currency, representing not just style but also belonging to a community of enthusiasts. The Role of Shoes in Everyday Life While celebrity collaborations and high-fashion designs grab headlines, most people value shoes for how they fit into their everyday lives. The right shoes can make commutes more bearable, workouts more effective, and social occasions more enjoyable. They can also provide confidence — there’s something powerful about stepping out in footwear that feels just right for the occasion. For parents, children’s shoes are a constant consideration as kids grow quickly and need supportive, durable pairs. For professionals, quality dress shoes or heels can play a role in how they are perceived in the workplace. For travelers, lightweight and versatile shoes can mean the difference between an easy trip and sore feet. Buying Shoes in the Digital Age The way we shop for shoes has also transformed. Online platforms have revolutionized accessibility, giving shoppers the ability to browse thousands of styles without leaving home. Detailed product images, size guides, and customer reviews have made it easier than ever to buy confidently online. Retailers like Styletread in Australia have thrived by offering a wide selection of brands, fast delivery, and flexible return options, showing just how much convenience matters to today’s shoppers. The rise of e-commerce has made finding the perfect pair of shoes a process that can take minutes, not hours spent at the mall. Why Shoes Will Always Matter At the end of the day, shoes are far more than objects we wear out of necessity. They are companions on life’s journey, quietly supporting us through milestones both big and small. The pair you wore to your first job interview, the sneakers that carried you through a marathon, or the heels you danced in at a wedding — shoes become part of our personal stories. Fashion trends will continue to evolve, technology will keep advancing, and sustainability will drive new innovations. Yet the essence of shoes — as protectors, statement-makers, and storytellers — will always remain. Final Thoughts Shoes are one of the few items in our lives that balance function and fashion so seamlessly. They carry the weight of our daily lives while offering endless opportunities for self-expression. Whether chosen for comfort, style, or symbolism, shoes remain a universal constant across cultures and generations. As we move into a future shaped by technology and sustainability, our footwear will continue to adapt while retaining its timeless significance. And for shoppers who want choice, convenience, and a touch of style, modern retailers make the process easier than ever — proof that the humble shoe still has plenty of steps left in its journey. 24 Apr The State of Insurance in Australia: Challenges, Trends, and Future Outlook admin Business No Comments Insurance plays a crucial role in Australia’s economy, providing financial protection to individuals, businesses, and communities against unforeseen risks. From home and car insurance to life and health coverage, the industry is a cornerstone of financial security. However, the sector faces significant challenges, including rising premiums, climate change impacts, regulatory changes, and technological disruptions. This article explores the current state of insurance in Australia, key trends shaping the industry, and what the future may hold. The Current Landscape of Insurance in Australia 1. Market Overview Australia’s insurance industry is one of the most developed in the Asia-Pacific region, with a market size exceeding $60 billion annually. The sector is dominated by major players such as: IAG (Insurance Australia Group) – Owners of brands like NRMA, CGU, and RACV. Suncorp – Includes AAMI, GIO, and Apia. QBE – A global insurer with a strong Australian presence. Allianz and Zurich – Major international insurers operating in Australia. The industry is divided into several key segments: General Insurance (home, car, travel) Life Insurance (income protection, death cover) Health Insurance (private health coverage) Specialty Insurance (cyber, business interruption) 2. Rising Premiums and Affordability Concerns One of the biggest challenges facing Australian consumers is the rising cost of insurance premiums. Several factors contribute to this trend: Increased Natural Disasters – Bushfires, floods, and cyclones have led to higher claims, forcing insurers to raise premiums. Inflation and Supply Chain Issues – Rising costs of repairs and replacements impact claims payouts. Reinsurance Costs – Australian insurers rely on global reinsurance markets, which have become more expensive due to global climate risks. A 2023 report by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) found that home insurance premiums rose by an average of 12% in the past year, with some high-risk areas seeing increases of over 50%. 3. Climate Change and Its Impact Australia is one of the most climate-vulnerable developed nations, with insurers paying out billions in claims due to extreme weather events. Key concerns include: Bushfire Risks – The 2019-2020 Black Summer fires cost insurers over $2.3 billion. Flooding – The 2022 Eastern Australia floods resulted in $5.6 billion in insured losses, making them the costliest disaster in Australian history. Cyclone Exposure – Northern Australia faces frequent cyclones, leading to higher premiums in regions like Queensland. Insurers are now reassessing risk models, with some refusing to cover high-risk properties or imposing steep excesses. The government has introduced schemes like Cyclone Reinsurance Pools to help stabilize premiums in disaster-prone areas. 4. Regulatory Changes and Consumer Protections The Australian insurance market is heavily regulated to ensure fairness and solvency. Recent regulatory developments include: The Financial Accountability Regime (FAR) – Strengthens accountability for insurers and executives. The Design and Distribution Obligations (DDO) – Requires insurers to ensure products meet consumer needs. The General Insurance Code of Practice – Sets standards for claims handling and transparency. Additionally, the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) monitors pricing practices, particularly in home and car insurance, to prevent unfair pricing. Emerging Trends in the Insurance Sector 1. Digital Transformation and InsurTech Technology is reshaping how insurance is sold and managed in Australia. Key innovations include: AI and Machine Learning – Used for risk assessment, fraud detection, and personalized pricing. Telematics in Car Insurance – Usage-based policies (e.g., pay-as-you-drive) are growing in popularity. Digital Claims Processing – AI-driven chatbots and automated claims systems speed up payouts. Australian InsurTech startups like Cover Genius, Huddle Insurance, and Honey Insurance are disrupting traditional models with digital-first solutions. 2. Cyber Insurance Boom With the rise of cyberattacks, businesses are increasingly seeking cyber insurance. The market is expected to grow by 20% annually, driven by: Increased ransomware attacks. Regulatory requirements for data protection. SME demand for coverage against digital risks. 3. Shift Towards Parametric Insurance Unlike traditional insurance (which pays based on assessed losses), parametric insurance pays out when predefined triggers (e.g., flood levels) are met. This model is gaining traction for agriculture and disaster coverage, offering faster payouts. 4. Health Insurance Challenges Australia’s private health insurance sector is under pressure due to: Rising costs leading to younger people dropping coverage. Government reforms to make policies more affordable. Increased demand for mental health coverage post-pandemic. The Future of Insurance in Australia 1. Greater Focus on Prevention Insurers are investing in predictive analytics and IoT devices (e.g., water leak sensors, fire alarms) to prevent losses rather than just paying claims. 2. Sustainable and ESG-Linked Insurance Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) factors are becoming critical. Insurers are: Offering discounts for eco-friendly homes. Divesting from fossil fuel-related underwriting. Supporting climate resilience projects. 3. Potential for More Government Intervention As premiums rise, the government may step in with: Subsidies for high-risk areas. Mandatory coverage requirements (e.g., flood insurance). National disaster insurance schemes. To save on your premium with Everyday Insurance, use an Everyday insurance coupon to get a discount on your policy. 4. Customer-Centric Innovations Future trends include: On-demand insurance (e.g., temporary coverage for gadgets or travel). Personalized pricing based on real-time data. Blockchain for transparent claims processing. Conclusion The Australian insurance industry is at a crossroads, balancing rising risks with innovation. While climate change and affordability remain major challenges, digital transformation and new insurance models offer hope for a more resilient future. Consumers should stay informed, compare policies, and consider risk mitigation strategies to navigate this evolving landscape. As the market adapts, collaboration between insurers, regulators, and consumers will be key to ensuring that insurance remains accessible and effective in protecting Australians against an uncertain future. 20 Dec Discover Glassons: A Leading Fashion Destination admin Business No Comments Glassons , a well-known name in the fashion world, has become synonymous with trendy, affordable clothing and accessories. Originating in New Zealand, the brand has expanded its reach to Australia and beyond, cementing its reputation as a go-to retailer for contemporary fashion. Known for its vibrant collections, Glassons caters to the needs of young, fashion-forward individuals seeking a mix of style, comfort, and value. A Brief History of Glassons Glassons was founded in 1908 and has since grown to become a major player in the Australasian fashion market. Its success lies in its ability to keep up with ever-changing fashion trends while maintaining affordability. The brand offers a wide range of products, including women’s clothing, activewear, swimwear, and accessories, ensuring there’s something for everyone. The brand’s commitment to inclusivity is also evident in its size range, catering to diverse body types and styles. Whether you’re looking for the perfect summer dress, a chic blazer for work, or casual weekend wear, Glassons has options that suit all occasions. Sustainability at Glassons In recent years, Glassons has taken steps toward becoming a more sustainable brand. They’ve introduced initiatives like recycled fabrics, eco-friendly packaging, and transparency in their supply chain. This move aligns with the growing demand from consumers for brands to prioritize sustainability and ethical practices. Glassons also engages with its customer base through its active social media presence, offering styling tips, showcasing new arrivals, and fostering a sense of community among fashion lovers. Their physical stores, combined with an easy-to-navigate online shopping platform, make it convenient for customers to access their latest collections. Ways to Save Money While Shopping at Glassons While Glassons is already known for its affordable pricing, savvy shoppers can find additional ways to maximize their savings. Here are some tips to help you shop smart: 1. Sign Up for the Glassons Newsletter Joining the Glassons mailing list is an excellent way to stay updated on their latest promotions and new arrivals. Subscribers often receive exclusive discounts, early access to sales, and special offers, making it a valuable resource for regular shoppers. 2. Shop During Seasonal Sales Glassons frequently hosts sales during key seasons, including end-of-season clearances and holiday events. These sales offer significant discounts on popular items, allowing you to snag your favorite pieces at a fraction of the original price. 3. Use Promo Codes and Coupons Look for a Glassons discount code available online. Websites like NZGG regularly feature deals for Glassons, offering additional savings on your purchase. Keep an eye out for free shipping codes, percentage discounts, or buy-one-get-one-free offers. 4. Check the Sale Section Glassons’ website and stores have dedicated sale sections featuring discounted items. You can often find hidden gems from previous collections at reduced prices. 5. Take Advantage of Free Shipping Thresholds Glassons frequently offers free shipping on orders over a certain amount. If you’re close to the threshold, consider adding a small item to your cart to qualify for free delivery, effectively saving on shipping costs. 6. Join Glassons Rewards Programs Some stores have loyalty or rewards programs that allow you to earn points with every purchase. While Glassons doesn’t currently have a specific rewards program, keeping an eye out for any future initiatives could help you save even more. Glassons continues to be a favorite among fashion enthusiasts for its trendy offerings and commitment to affordability. By using these tips, you can enjoy the latest styles without breaking the bank. Happy shopping! 04 May Hallenstein’s growth continues admin Business No Comments Founded in New Zealand in 1870, Hallensteins is known for its distinctive and high-quality men’s fashion. The company has continued to evolve over the years and adapt to the changing market conditions and consumer preferences. In order to cater to different consumer groups, Hallensteins has expanded its product range. Besides its core business of making trousers, shirts, and suits, the company has also introduced various casual wear items, such as t-shirts and jeans. These products have helped the company appeal to a younger crowd, as they are more likely to be wearing casual clothes on a regular basis. Hallensteins has made significant progress in its online presence, as it has invested heavily in an e-commerce platform that enables customers to shop for its products online and get a wider range of options than can be purchased in-store. The company has also used various digital channels to build its brand and connect with its customers. In the past few years, Hallensteins has faced various challenges in the retail industry. One of these was the emergence of the COVID-19 pandemic, which affected the company’s sales. To address these issues, the company shifted its focus from traditional retail to e-commerce. It also invested in new technology to improve its online shopping experience. You can get great deals when you shop at Hallensteins when you use a Hallensteins promo code . With a strong brand and loyal following, Hallensteins can continue to grow and compete in the future. The company’s focus on customer service and innovation will help it maintain its competitive edge. As the world begins to emerge from the pandemic, the company may also be able to expand its physical presence and reach out to new customers through its brick-and mortar outlets. 23 Dec Kogan acquires BROSA Furniture admin Business No Comments Online retailer Kogan has purchased the assets of furniture retailer Brosa for about $1.5 million. Brosa had reportedly posted annual sales of over $50 million before it went into administration last week. In addition to its stock and intellectual property, which it will now own, Kogan will also provide support to Brosa’s customers. Founded in 2014, Brosa was able to build a following among high-end consumers. It offers a wide range of home goods, including three-seater white couch and vintage rugs. It was backed by venture capital firms which helped fund the marketing and brand building of Brosa. The valuation of Brosa increased by 49 percent in the past few months due to its solid trading performance. Due to the pandemic, the demand for home goods retailers started to decline. As a result, Brosa was placed in administration. Brosa is in a relatively mature online furniture market that includes similar reatilers such as LivingStyles . You can save at Livingstyles with a LivingStyles coupon . In its filings with the Australian Securities Exchange, online retailer Kogan noted that Brosa was valued at about $60 million. It had also experienced strong revenue growth during the previous financial year. The administrator of Brosa said that the company received over 30 expressions of interest. After considering the various bids, it was decided that the online retailer would purchase the business. It’s a small acquisition for the Kogan, which has a market capitalization of around $350 million. During the September quarter, its gross sales were $202.3 million, which was 38.8 percent lower than the previous year. The acquisition of Brosa was relatively low-risk for both parties. It also allows Kogan to expand their online furniture offerings. 17 Oct Retailers failing to reach their sales goals admin Business No Comments Most retailers failed to meet their sales targets during the first quarter of the year, and more than a third were uncertain if their businesses would survive the next 12 months. The latest Retail Radar report shows that almost half of New Zealand retailers failed to meet their sales targets in Q3. The retail sector was hit by the resurgence of Covid-19 and lockdown in Auckland, which caused sales to fall in August and September. A survey conducted by PricewaterhouseCoopers revealed that almost half of retailers expected sales to fall in the run-up to Christmas. Many of them were also not sure if they would be able to survive another year. Due to government lockdowns and changes in the alert level, many retailers have experienced a significant impact on their operations. Many businesses are complaining about a change in rules that limit what they can sell on level 4. This is leaving them hurting and unable to offer their usual services. Retailers were facing various issues such as a lack of stock and the ability to make rent payments, said Michael Jacobson, head of retail at PricewaterhouseCoopers. Almost half of retailers expect to raise their prices in the next quarter. Retailers wanted the Government to pay them a financial payment for their rent, according to a survey conducted by PricewaterhouseCoopers. According to Retail Radar, the number of retailers who are satisfied with the government’s handling of Covid-19 has plummeted. Almost 70 per cent of retailers were dissatisfied or very dissatisfied with the government’s response to the Covid-19 report, according to a survey conducted by PricewaterhouseCoopers. Retail NZ asked for measures to help retailers in the next few months, such as establishing a clear date for the Auckland road map, issuing saliva testing for Covid-19 and relieving rent relief. The motion also called for a halt to measures that would increase costs, such as the minimum wage and a moratorium on further increases. Stores like Glassons have continued to perform well with strong sales during Covid. If you’re looking to save on the Glassons Sale , use a Glassons coupon with your purchase. 05 Apr Coronavirus induced closures hit retail admin Business No Comments Coronavirus has caused a lot of store closure around the country, some by force and some voluntarily. Places that had a higher risk of transferring the Corona Virus including restaurants, gyms and pubs were forced to shut down. Other stores have chosen to voluntarily shut down due a complete drop in the traffic to these stores. Those employees of these chains that have temporarily shut down versus going out of business have had to look for other means of an income such as the newstart allowance. Two major chains that have recently closed all it’s retail stores are Adairs and Kathmandu . Adairs announced that it would shut all it’s bricks and mortar stores for six weeks to ensure the safety of their customers and staff. Adairs’ New Zealand stores have already closed due to the level 4 restrictions. Kathmandu has also closed all its Australian and New Zealand stores which number 170. They also own Rip Curl stores of which they have closed all 100 of them. They have over 2000 staff in Australia and all will be told that they will be stood down without pay for 4 weeks. They will however be able to use their leave entitlements over this time. Shareholders will also be affected by the virus with a suspension of dividends. If you want to continue shopping at Adairs , visit their online store which is still open. Use an Adairs promo code with your purchase to get a great deal. 05 Nov The top things to see or do in New Zealand’s South Island admin Travel No Comments New Zealand is known as one of the most beautiful countries in the world and there is an amazing amount of sites to see all around the country. The South Island however has the most beautiful scenery in the country and the world. It is a huge place to explore so here are some of the top things to see in New Zealand. The first is Abel Tasman National Park in Nelson. Abel Tasman National Park has a huge variety of sheltered bays and this environment is perfectly suited for water activities such as sailing and kayaking. These activites done at a slow pace will allow you take in the beautiful surrounds of the bays. You will see marine life such as dolphins and seals nine out of ten times you’re there. If water is not your thing then you walk the trails along the coastline and experience the beauty of the area from the land. Another beautiful place to visit is Central Otago . Central Otago is hope to a huge variety of landscapes and scenery including snow capped mountains, rivers, hills and is also a thriving wine region known for it’s Pinot Noir. Mt Aspiring National Park in Wanaka is another breathtaking place to visit in the South Island. The location is the place to go with high mountains that have flowing rivers of clear and icey water. Lakes are a beautiful and turqois colour. Activites such as water sports and scenic flights are available for those that really want to take in the beauty of the area. For a great selection of Hotels in these areas visit Hotels.com with a Hotels.com coupon . name: Shahi Dawat
homepage_content: SHAHI DAWAT INDIAN RESTAURANT Experience the Rich & Authentic Taste of India At Shashi Dawat, we serve authentic Indian flavors crafted with the finest ingredients and traditional recipes. TAKEAWAY NOW ABOUT US Welcome to Shahi Dawat â A Royal Feast of Indian Tandoori Cuisine. Fully Licensed & B.Y.O (Wine Only) Since 2001, Shahi Dawat has been serving authentic Indian cuisine with a rich blend of traditional spices and flavors. Known for our legendary Butter Chicken and mouthwatering Chicken Tikka Masala, we bring you the true taste of India in every bite. At Shahi Dawat, we believe in offering a royal dining experience, where every dish is crafted with passion and perfection. Whether you're craving aromatic curries, sizzling tandoori delights, or freshly baked naan, our menu is designed to satisfy your cravings. Join us for an unforgettable culinary journey and experience the essence of Indian hospitality. Indulge in the finest flavors, only at Shahi Dawat â where every meal is a celebration! CHECK OUT OUR MENU ENTREE Start your meal with our authentic Indian entrÃ©es, featuring flavorful tandoori dishes, crispy samosas, and succulent kebabs. Prepared with aromatic spices, each bite offers a taste of Indiaâs rich culinary heritage. VIEW MENU MAINS Enjoy a variety of traditional Indian main courses, from creamy butter chicken to slow-cooked lamb rogan josh and fragrant biryani. Our dishes are crafted with authentic spices for a truly flavorful dining experience. VIEW MENU SIDE DISHES Complete your meal with our delicious Indian side dishes, including freshly baked garlic naan, fluffy basmati rice, tangy chutneys, and crispy papadums. The perfect complement to your favorite curry or tandoori dish. VIEW MENU Enjoy exclusive offers on our delicious Indian cuisine. Chicken, Lamb, Beef & Veg Curry Lunch Special Tue - Fri: 12pm to 2:30pm Takeaway: $18.00 View More Chicken, Lamb, Beef & Veg Curry Lunch Special + Can Drink Tue - Fri: 12pm to 2:30pm Takeaway: $20.00 View More $8.00 for delivery in Te Atatu Peninsula Any Order Out of Te Atatu Peninsula $10 Order Now What Are They Saying About Us I am obsessed with their butter chicken and cheese garlic naan bread itâs so good this is my go to takeaway meal comes with rice and itâs perfect for dinner and an amazing lunch the next day if you can stop yourself from eating it all in one sitting which is really hard to do. Andrea Ramsay Overall really good. Plenty of flavour and some individual herb tastes can come through instead of it being so singular in taste. An easy choice to make when I am traveling past Te Atatu on the motorway. Hopped Zombie This is without doubt the best Authenic food in West Auckland - for takeaway, or for dining in. This is nothing short of wonderful food. Emmett King We really like this place. Food is very high quality and service was with a smile. They've looked after us well through my partners pregnancy, ensuring the food was ultra safe and also making recommendations. It was very quiet when we went but a lot of locals use this place for takeaway due to food quality. David Shaw Great restaurant out in Te Atatu. Taste is premium ð. Can be pricey but worth it! Somewhat generous servings. ENKI'S FUN TECHNO STUFF (EnkiTrillionaire) As a picky eater, trying somewhere new is always overwhelming. But Shahi Dawat has very quickly become our choice for a great Indian meal. The chicken tikka is by far my favourite, and one of the best in Auckland (I recently even had this meal at Cassia, and it was extremely average compared to Shahiâs). The only critique Iâd have about this place is that the naan bread could be improved (I have the garlic naan), but honestly, this place deserves a lot of praise. Well done. Dora Ioana Always good. Reasonably priced. They are happy to use coconut milk to make dishes vegan or dairy free. Lovely family business. We would love to see the veganizable options clearly labeled in the menu. Thank you! Melissa P I eat at Shahi Dawat regularly and they never fail to impress me. The curries, naans, service and speed are always great here. Support local and head to Shahi Dawat, DON'T waste your time going to Shamiana next door it really isn't worth it. They also offer a delivery service with paywave available at your door and are always very friendly. Sutty Sutcliffe Find Us Light Dark

name: Shubh Restaurant and Takeaways
homepage_content: Home - SHUBH Skip to content View Menu The Shubh Tiffin Fresh Punjabi Curries, Made Daily At Shubh, we prepare 20-25 varieties of fresh Punjabi curries every single day, cooked each morning using authentic recipes passed down through generations. Perfect for your homestyle dinners, weekly meal prep, or a quick wholesome lunch, every curry is carefully packed in boxes, ready for you to pick and choose from our counter – that’s what we call The Shubh Tiffin. Mix and match your favourites with our range of rotis and parathas, or pair them with our comforting rice dishes for a complete, nourishing meal that feels just like home. The Shubh Tiffin is all about fresh, healthy, and flavourful food – made daily with love and care. WELCOME TO SHUBH Heritage on a plate, crafted with love since 2010 ABOUT US SHUBH offers fresh Punjabi Indian food that tastes authentic with original spices used in recipes that date back many years ago, that tastes exactly how it is supposed to be back in the motherland. Our motto is quality over quantity with fresh produce. We pride on carefully selected fresh veggies from our Punjabi farmers. Enjoy the blend of our hand-roasted spices Shubh specializes in the unique flavours of Vegetarian Punjabi cuisine. Come and taste the all time favorites of our delicious cuisine! UNVEIL OUR STORY WHERE FAMILY FAITH FLAVORS MEET STARTERS & STREET EATS Begin your journey with the vibrant flavors of Punjabi street food — from crisp pakoras and spiced chaats to tangy chutneys that awaken the senses. Each bite carries the joy of roadside favorites, lovingly recreated for the table. EXPLORE OUR MENU Curries & Classics Our curries celebrate tradition, blending hand-roasted spices with fresh vegetables and paneer to create dishes rich in comfort and culture. From homely dals to festive gravies, each bowl is a reflection of heritage and heart. EXPLORE OUR MENU Fresh Breads & Rice Our curries celebrate tradition, blending hand-roasted spices with fresh vegetables and paneer to create dishes rich in comfort and culture. From homely dals to festive gravies, each bowl is a reflection of heritage and heart. EXPLORE OUR MENU Sweets & Desserts End on a sweet note with traditional Punjabi desserts. From syrup-soaked gulab jamun to festive ladoos and creamy kheer, these timeless indulgences bring nostalgia and celebration to every meal. EXPLORE OUR MENU CUSTOMER APPRECIATIONS Cizhyi “ My partner and I have been going to this place to get takeout for years and we love it! The food is amazing, portions very generous and affordable, the staff are always super friendly, and it’s definitely the most value for money takeout you can get pretty much anywhere! The takeout is cold so you have to heat it yourself, but its 1000% worth it. “ balakrishna p “ Great value for money! The food was delicious and the prices were surprisingly reasonable. I particularly appreciated the attentive and friendly service from Mr.Deepak , making our meal even more enjoyable.. Budget friendly food outlet.. “ Ray Eagle “ Super Yummy, My first visit today, takeaways only, so I took away 2 semosas, and 1 fried paneer square, all were delicious, many freshly made curries to choose from, all Vegetarian, all Home made fresh daily 😊 “ HOURS & LOCATION EVERY DAY 10AM – 9PM 520 – 524 SANDRIGHAM ROAD, SANDRIGHAM, AUCKLAND

name: Sunday Roast
homepage_content: Home Skip to main content Est. 2003 Tasty Catering Spit Roast & Catering Welcome to Tasty Catering Catering for the Manawatu and surrounding provinces Looking for a experienced caterer in the Manawatu region to help your function to go successfully ? Do you want your guests to remember the delicious meal and friendly service ? Relax - let us handle it for you. We simply deliver premium, locally sourced spit-roast meats, fresh salads, and vegetables direct to your function in the Palmerston North and outlying areas. We can also provide both delivery and onsite catering for your function. We have cost effective solutions for your catering requirements. Have a look through our menus and services to find out more, or contact us directly to talk over your event. Tasty Spit Roast in Palmerston North - great catering since 2005. Our Meats Prime Rump Roast Beef Marinated with garlic and oil. Tasty and juicy. Rolled Roast Pork Rubbed and salted with for crackling, succulent and juicy. Supreme Ham Quality smoked champagne ham. Golden Roasted Chicken Fresh chicken rolled with stuffing then spit roasted. Rolled lamb leg Marinated with garlic and oil. Tasty and juicy. All menus served with: Gourmet potatoes (new) garnished with mint or parsley and mixed herb table spread. French stick sliced and spread with table spread. All meals served with condiments of salt ’n’ pepper, hot gravy, honey mustard and applesauce. Please Allow and extra $3 per person for Rolled Lamb Leg and $1.00 per person for Rolled Leg of Pork Delivery Service Our delivery service has been designed to offer a generous banquet meal that suits larger dining numbers( minimum of 25 diners), including varied taste preferences while allowing for dietary requirements in a location of their choosing. A cost-effective solution with a minimum effort required by the host, that lends itself to a successful event. Delivery Service Details - Click Here The meal will be delivered to your venue approximately 15 minutes prior to your dining time. - You will need to provide suitable table space to accommodate the numbers attending (this information will be sent to you with the final details sheet). - We will provide disposable tablecloths for the buffet table. We will lay the table cloth, set out your dishes and open your meal ready for dining. - The meats, salads and hot vegetables are delivered in tinfoil trays. The French bread is sliced, spread with margarine and set in tinfoil trays. - Quality compostable crockery and cutlery contained within baskets are provided. (Baskets to be returned) - Plates are separated with napkins. Satcheted Salt n pepper and condiments are in pop top resealable containers. - Stainless steel serving tongs and spoons are provided for all dishes along with plastic gravy jugs (these need to be returned to us). - Once the meal is set and ready for dining, my staff will depart and leave you to your meal. My staff and I provide a friendly, flexible and efficient service; the meals are generous by design with many familiar tastes to suit a wide range of people. Delivery Pricing Over 50 Adults $32.50 per person Under 50 Adults $36.50 per person Dessert (additional cost) $6.00 per person Fresh creamed Pavlova; Chocolate Brownie; Peach Passion Fruit Cheesecake or Strawberry Cheesecake. All desserts served with Tropical Fruit Salad. All meals are served with quality disposable plates, cutlery, and napkin and table clothes for the buffet table. Delivery Fee A delivery cost applies, please enquire Delivery Downloads Onsite Service With our on-site service we provide crockery and cutlery and all necessary table condiments ie quality paper napkins, salt and pepper. The meal will be served through a carvery and self-help buffet with dishes cleared between courses. Dessert is served in the same fashion. Onsite Service - Click here for info With our on-site service we provide crockery and cutlery and all necessary table condiments i.e. quality paper napkins, salt and pepper. The meal will be served through a carvery and self-help buffet with dishes cleared between courses. And the dessert served in the same fashion. Buffet Table Buffet table set with attractive stainless chafer dishes for hot foods. Salads presented in smart white show bowls and cane baskets, condiments, sauces also in white show bowls. Carvery Carvery set with wooden carving boards, gravy served through stainless steel chafer dish. Meats are carved and served directly to the guests. Wedding Table Wedding table service inclusive (top table only). Platter service so that the wedding party may help themselves. Staff attired in black and white uniforms. Hot Drinks Tea/ coffee service, teabags and specialist teas. Hireage Linen tablecloths ( White trestle clothes) can be supplied at $12.50 each. Onsite Pricing Minumum 60 Adults - Main only $42.00 per person Canapes & Main or Main & Dessert $63.00 per person You can choose two desserts from the following list: We are currently offering traditional desserts such as Creamed Pavlova, Chocolate Brownie, various flavored cheese cakes and Apple Crumble. Click the "Canapes Mix and Mingle" button below for our starters options. Canapes/starters served as guests mix and mingle after the ceremony with pre –dinner drinks. name: Smash Palace
homepage_content: Smash Palace | Bar & Burger Joint | High Street, Christchurch SMASH PALACE is a bar in a bus, a burger joint and the home of Bodgie Beer. Emerging from the rubble of the Christchurch earthquakes, this once-temporary boozer has become a permanent part of the city’s drinking culture. It’s a courtyard bar where the beer is cold and sold in real pints while the burgers are hot and cooked fresh. Thursday night is motorbike night and if you look carefully you might see Greg working on a motorbike. On the weekend the DJs spin vinyl from the workshop container. Pub dog Graham is on site four days a week. Graham says: “Dogs are welcome.” On a Friday afternoon in summer, we reckon this place is about as good as it gets in this ol’ town. Location 172 High Street Christchurch Hours Open from midday Tuesday through Sunday Basic Beef, chutney, gherkin, mayo $14 Cheeseburger Beef, cheese, gherkin, chutney, mayo $15 BlueCheeseburger Beef, caramelised onions, blue cheese, lettuce, chutney, mayo $18 BBQ Bacon Beef, bacon, onion ring, cheese, bbq sauce, mayo $19 Hotburger Beef, harissa, jalapeno, cheese, lettuce, mayo $17 Noah’s Arc Beef, chicken, bacon, chutney, mayo, lettuce $22 Hawaiian Chicken Fried chicken, pineapple, bacon, lettuce, mayo $18 Chicken Boo Fried chicken, cheese, ‘slaw, harissa, mayo, gherkin $18 BBQ Chicken Fried chicken, bacon, cheese, bbq sauce, mayo, lettuce $18 Vegematarian Falafel, cheese, mayo, kimchi, lettuce $15 Vegan Spice tofu patty, Kimchi, BBQ Sauce, lettuce $15 Smash fried chicken Local-famous chicken thigh with bbq mayo $18 Japapeno Poppers A wee bit spicy $15 Chook ‘n’ Chips Lil’ chook, lil’ chups $14 Chips Potatoes chopped up and cooked for your pleasure $10 Add Aioli $2 Add Gravy $2 Cheerios And tom sauce $6 Kentucky Fried Tofu With bbq sauce $12 Pierogi Polish potato dumplings. From our friends down at the Pierogi Joint. Six for $15 Add sour cream $2 Bodgie Beer Our specialty house beer — made by us, just for you. It’s fresh, it’s local and it’s pouring all the time at Smash Palace. There’s a full range of Bodgie drinks, you can get a sampler tray if you want. We love the stuff and drink far too much of it ourselves. Other Tap Drinks We change these out more than the rear rubber on the old Cortina. But you’ll find boozy lemonade, sours, cider, boozy gingerbeer… Go on — get some. Bottles and Cans There’s a few bottles and cans for those not catered to by the taps. Speights Big Bots. $14 Heineken $10 SOL $10 Pals $10 Wine List All the wines are from Waipara. All are from family owned and run vineyards. We like to support our friends. Boneline Sauvignon Blanc $13 Main Divide Chardonnay $12 Main Divide Riesling $12 Black Estate Pinot Gris $13 Georges Rd Rose $12 Boneline Rose $15 Boneline Pinot Noir $14 Main Divide Cabernet Merlot $12 Non Alcoholic Juice, Coke, Sprite, Ginger Ale, L&P, Coke Zero $5 Karma Drinks Range $10 Garage Project Tiny (zero percent) $10 Heineken Zero $10 CONTACT Due to being at the mercy of the weather we don't take reservations. But there's heaps of space - just show up and we will do our best to fit you in. ADDRESS Find us at: 172 High Street, Christchurch. New Zealand CONTACT FORM Cart ( 0 )

homepage_content: The Refreshment Room - Food and atmosphere at its finest - The refreshment room Skip to content Waterproofing your deck and roof is an important step to protect your property from water damage, but maintenance is equally essential to ensure the waterproofing lasts and continues to perform effectively. Regular upkeep can prevent minor issues from becoming costly repairs and extend the life of your waterproofed surfaces. Here’s how to properly maintain your waterproofed deck and roof: Regular Inspections Schedule routine inspections, ideally twice a year and after severe weather events. Look for signs such as cracks, peeling, blistering, or pooling water. Early detection of damage allows timely repairs before problems worsen. Clean the Surfaces Keep your deck and roof clean by removing leaves, dirt, moss, and other debris. These can trap moisture and degrade waterproofing materials. Use gentle cleaning methods recommended by waterproofing professionals to avoid damaging the protective layers. Check and Clear Drainage Systems Ensure gutters, downpipes, and drainage channels are free from blockages. Proper drainage prevents water buildup that can strain waterproof membranes and cause leaks. Repair Minor Damage Promptly Small cracks or worn areas in the waterproofing layer should be repaired immediately using appropriate sealants or coatings. Ignoring these can allow water to penetrate and damage underlying structures. Avoid Heavy Foot Traffic Limit foot traffic on your waterproofed roof and deck, especially when surfaces are wet or curing. Excessive weight or abrasion can weaken the waterproof membrane. Reapply Waterproofing Coatings as Needed Waterproofing materials degrade over time due to UV exposure and weathering. Depending on the product used, reapplication may be necessary every few years. Consult with your waterproofing provider for recommended schedules. Professional Maintenance with NZ Water Proofing Specialist For thorough inspections, maintenance advice, and professional repairs, rely on NZ Water Proofing Specialist . Their team understands New Zealand’s climate challenges and offers expert services to keep your waterproofing in top condition. If you want trusted quality deck waterproofing services and roof maintenance, NZ Water Proofing Specialist provides tailored solutions to prolong the life of your waterproofed surfaces. Conclusion Maintaining your waterproofed deck and roof is essential to protect your investment and prevent water damage. Regular inspections, cleaning, prompt repairs, and professional guidance ensure your waterproofing system continues to perform well for years.
