Plant stands are a staple of home and garden decor, seamlessly blending functionality and design. While today they serve as both practical supports and aesthetic highlights, their origins tell a rich story of cultural, artistic, and functional evolution. This article explores the fascinating history of plant stands, charting their journey from simple practicality to sophisticated artistry. 1. The Early Beginnings: Practicality and Functionality The concept of elevating plants dates back thousands of years. Early plant stands were purely functional, designed to: Protect Plants : By elevating pots, plant stands prevented pests and rodents from damaging crops and decorative plants. Enhance Sunlight Access : Early civilizations understood the importance of sunlight for plant health, using stands to position plants in optimal light. Manage Drainage : Elevation allowed water to flow freely, preventing root rot and maintaining plant health. Examples from Ancient Cultures Egyptians : In ancient Egypt, terracotta and stone platforms were used to elevate potted plants in royal gardens. Romans : The Romans popularized garden aesthetics, using ornate marble stands to display decorative plants in courtyards. Chinese Dynasties : In ancient China, intricately carved wooden plant stands were integral to indoor gardens, reflecting harmony with nature. 2. The Renaissance Era: Plant Stands as Decorative Pieces During the Renaissance (14th to 17th centuries), the focus shifted from mere functionality to aesthetic enhancement. With a growing appreciation for botany and art, plant stands became an integral part of home decor. Ornate Designs : Renaissance plant stands featured intricate carvings, gilded finishes, and classical motifs, blending art and function. Symbol of Status : Owning elaborate plant stands indicated wealth and sophistication, as only affluent families could afford such luxuries. Integration with Art : Plant stands often served as pedestals for sculptures and vases, emphasizing their decorative role. 3. The Victorian Age: The Golden Era of Plant Stands The Victorian period (19th century) marked a golden age for plant stands . During this time, indoor gardening became a popular hobby, fueled by advancements in glasshouse technology and a fascination with exotic plants. Wrought Iron and Cast Iron Stands : Sturdy and ornate, these stands were used both indoors and outdoors. They often featured floral or scrollwork designs. Tiered Designs : Multi-tiered plant stands gained popularity, allowing Victorian plant enthusiasts to showcase large collections. Exotic Influences : Global trade introduced bamboo and rattan stands, reflecting colonial influences. Art Nouveau Style : The late Victorian era saw the rise of Art Nouveau, characterized by organic, flowing designs inspired by nature. 4. The Modernist Movement: Simplicity and Functionality The 20th century brought a shift towards modernism, prioritizing simplicity, clean lines, and practicality. Plant stands evolved to reflect these ideals: Mid-Century Modern : Wooden stands with sleek, tapered legs became a hallmark of mid-century design, focusing on minimalism and functionality. Industrial Influence : Metal stands with minimalist frames gained traction, especially in urban settings. Mass Production : Advances in manufacturing allowed for affordable and accessible plant stands, making them a household staple. 5. Contemporary Plant Stands: Artistry Meets Sustainability Today, plant stands have become a versatile decor element, offering endless possibilities for personal expression and artistry: Eco-Friendly Designs : Sustainable materials like bamboo, reclaimed wood, and recycled metal are popular choices for environmentally conscious consumers. Customizable Options : Modular and adjustable stands cater to individual preferences and spatial needs. Bold and Artistic Styles : Contemporary designs feature geometric patterns, bright colors, and mixed materials, blending functionality with artistic expression. Smart Integration : Tech-friendly stands with built-in grow lights or irrigation systems reflect modern innovation. At Metro Elegance , we offer plant stands that embody both timeless elegance and contemporary innovation, catering to a variety of tastes and preferences. 6. The Cultural Significance of Plant Stands Throughout history, plant stands have served as cultural symbols, representing: Harmony with Nature : In Chinese and Japanese traditions, plant stands are central to creating tranquil indoor gardens. Wealth and Prestige : Ornate stands in European palaces showcased wealth and artistic appreciation. Creativity and Expression : Modern plant stands highlight individuality and artistic flair, reflecting personal style. 7. Tips for Choosing the Perfect Plant Stand When selecting a plant stand, consider the following: Material : Choose materials that complement your decor and suit the environment (e.g., metal for durability, wood for warmth). Size and Scale : Ensure the stand is proportionate to the pot and space. Style : Select a design that aligns with your aesthetic—classic, modern, rustic, or eclectic. Functionality : Look for features like multi-tiered levels, adjustable heights, or mobility for added convenience. 8. Why Choose Metro Elegance for Your Plant Stand Needs? At Metro Elegance , we honor the legacy of plant stands by offering: Diverse Styles : From classic wooden designs to modern geometric stands, we have something for every decor theme. Premium Materials : Our stands are crafted from high-quality materials, ensuring durability and longevity. Eco-Friendly Options : Explore our sustainable plant stands made from bamboo and reclaimed wood. Customizable Choices : Whether you need a compact stand or a statement piece, our collection has it all. 9. Conclusion: A Legacy of Art and Functionality The history and evolution of plant stands reflect their enduring appeal and versatility. From ancient practicality to modern artistry, these timeless pieces continue to enhance our living spaces. Explore the rich heritage of plant stands with our curated collection at Metro Elegance and add a touch of history and style to your home today. For watch collectors, keeping your timepieces safe, organized, and ready to wear requires more than just placing them in a drawer. Watch winders and watch boxes are the perfect pair for maintaining your collection, ensuring your watches stay in optimal condition while also providing a stylish display. At LUX Watch Care , we offer a range of watch winders and boxes that work together to protect your collection. Here’s why this combination is essential for any serious collector. 1. Watch Winders: Keeping Your Automatic Watches Running Automatic watches rely on motion to keep their movements wound and running. A watch winder is a must-have for collectors of automatic watches, as it mimics the natural movement of the wrist, keeping your watch fully wound even when it’s not being worn. Why You Need It : A watch winder eliminates the need to manually wind your watch, ensuring that it’s always ready to wear and preventing wear on the movement from constant resetting. 2. Watch Boxes: Protecting and Displaying Your Collection A watch box provides a safe, cushioned environment for your watches when they’re not in use. Watch boxes come with individual compartments, protecting your watches from scratches, dust, and accidental damage while offering an elegant way to display your collection. Why You Need It : A watch box is essential for organizing your collection, making it easy to access and display your watches while keeping them secure. 3. The Benefits of Using Both When used together, watch winders and watch boxes offer the ultimate solution for watch storage and maintenance. Use a watch winder for your automatic watches, ensuring they stay wound and ready to wear. At the same time, store your other timepieces in a watch box, keeping them organized and protected from damage. Pro Tip : Look for multi-watch winders with built-in storage compartments. These combination units provide both winding and storage in one sleek design, perfect for collectors with larger collections. Conclusion Watch winders and watch boxes are the perfect pair for keeping your watches safe, organized, and always ready to wear. At LUX Watch Care , we offer premium watch winders and boxes that combine style with function, making them essential tools for every collector. Explore our collection today and give your watches the care they deserve. Regular building inspections are a critical component of maintaining any property, whether residential or commercial. These inspections provide valuable insights into the condition of a building, ensuring its safety, compliance with regulations, and long-term value. In this blog post, we’ll explore the importance of regular building inspections and how they can benefit property owners. We’ll also highlight how F Home Solutions can help you maintain your property’s integrity and value. Ensuring Safety Identifying Structural Issues: One of the primary purposes of regular building inspections is to identify structural issues that could pose safety hazards. Inspectors check for signs of foundation problems, cracks in walls, and other structural deficiencies that, if left unaddressed, could lead to significant damage or even collapse. Detecting Electrical and Plumbing Problems: Building inspections also cover electrical and plumbing systems. Faulty wiring, outdated electrical panels, and plumbing leaks can create serious safety risks, including fires, water damage, and mold growth. Regular inspections ensure these systems are functioning correctly and meet current safety standards. Preventing Health Hazards: Inspectors look for potential health hazards such as mold, asbestos, and lead paint. These substances can have severe health impacts, especially on children and the elderly. Identifying and mitigating these hazards during regular inspections helps protect the health and well-being of occupants. Preserving Property Value Maintaining Structural Integrity: A well-maintained building retains its structural integrity over time. Regular inspections help identify and address issues before they become major problems, ensuring the building remains in good condition. This proactive approach prevents costly repairs and preserves the property’s value. Enhancing Marketability: Properties that undergo regular inspections and maintenance are more attractive to potential buyers and tenants. A building with a documented history of inspections demonstrates to prospective buyers that the property has been well cared for, making it a more appealing investment. Avoiding Costly Repairs: Regular inspections can uncover minor issues before they escalate into significant problems requiring expensive repairs. Addressing small leaks, cracks, or electrical issues early on can save property owners a substantial amount of money in the long run. Ensuring Compliance Adhering to Local Building Codes: Building codes and regulations are in place to ensure the safety and integrity of structures. Regular inspections help property owners stay compliant with these codes, avoiding fines and legal issues. Inspectors are familiar with local regulations and can identify areas where the building may not meet current standards. Facilitating Insurance Claims: In the event of damage or disaster, having a record of regular inspections can facilitate insurance claims. Insurers are more likely to process claims smoothly if there is evidence that the property has been well maintained and inspected regularly. F Home Solutions: Your Partner in Building Inspections At F Home Solutions, we understand the importance of maintaining your property’s safety, compliance, and value. Our comprehensive building inspection services are designed to give you peace of mind and protect your investment. Here’s how we can help: Experienced Inspectors: Our team of experienced inspectors is trained to identify potential issues and provide detailed reports. We use the latest technology and tools to ensure thorough and accurate inspections. Customized Inspection Plans: We offer customized inspection plans tailored to your property’s specific needs. Whether you own a residential home, commercial building, or rental property, we have the expertise to address your unique requirements. Detailed Reports: After each inspection, we provide a detailed report outlining our findings and recommendations. These reports are easy to understand and include photographs and explanations of any issues identified. We also offer follow-up consultations to discuss the report and answer any questions you may have. Preventative Maintenance: In addition to inspections, F Home Solutions offers preventative maintenance services to address any issues identified during inspections. Our goal is to help you maintain your property in top condition and avoid costly repairs. Conclusion Regular building inspections are essential for ensuring the safety, compliance, and value of your property. By identifying and addressing issues early, you can prevent costly repairs, protect the health and safety of occupants, and enhance the marketability of your property. F Home Solutions is your trusted partner in maintaining your property’s integrity and value. Contact us today to schedule an inspection and take the first step toward safeguarding your investment. Creating a cozy and stimulating environment for your baby is one of the most enjoyable parts of preparing for their arrival. A baby mobile is a delightful addition to any nursery, providing visual stimulation and soothing sounds to help your little one drift off to sleep. But with so many options available, how do you choose the best baby mobile for your nursery? Here are some tips to guide you in making the perfect choice for your little one. 1. Consider the Design and Theme Match Your Nursery Theme: When choosing a baby mobile, consider the overall theme and design of your nursery. Whether you have a jungle-themed nursery or a minimalist, modern design, there’s a mobile to match. Selecting a mobile that complements your nursery decor creates a cohesive and visually appealing space. Versatile Designs: If you plan to use the mobile for multiple children or in different settings, opt for a versatile design with neutral colors and timeless patterns. This ensures the mobile can be easily integrated into any nursery theme in the future. 2. Focus on Developmental Benefits Visual Stimulation: Babies love to look at moving objects, and a mobile with high-contrast colors and patterns can help stimulate their visual development. Black and white designs are especially beneficial for newborns, as their vision is still developing. Cognitive Development: Choose a mobile with a variety of shapes, colors, and textures to engage your baby’s curiosity and promote cognitive development. Mobiles that allow you to change the hanging elements or adjust their positions can keep your baby interested as they grow. 3. Music and Sound Features Soothing Sounds: Many baby mobiles come with built-in music or sound features. Lullabies, classical music, and nature sounds can help soothe your baby to sleep. Look for mobiles with a variety of sound options to find what works best for your little one. Volume Control: Ensure the mobile has adjustable volume settings so you can control the sound level. This allows you to find the perfect balance between soothing and overstimulating. 4. Safety First Secure Attachment: Ensure the mobile can be securely attached to the crib or cot. A well-secured mobile reduces the risk of it falling into the crib and posing a hazard to your baby. Non-Toxic Materials: Choose a mobile made from non-toxic, baby-safe materials. This is particularly important if your baby is teething and may reach out to touch or chew on the mobile. Age-Appropriate Design: Some mobiles have small parts that could be a choking hazard for young babies. Ensure the mobile is age-appropriate and follow the manufacturer’s guidelines for safe use. 5. Ease of Use and Maintenance Easy to Clean: Babies can be messy, so choose a mobile that’s easy to clean. Removable and washable elements are a big plus, as they allow you to keep the mobile fresh and hygienic. Simple Operation: Look for a mobile that’s easy to operate, with intuitive controls for music, movement, and light settings. Some mobiles come with remote controls, making it convenient to adjust settings without disturbing your baby. 6. Consider Longevity Convertible Features: Some mobiles can be converted into other useful items, such as a nightlight or a projector, as your baby grows. These multi-functional designs provide longer use and better value for money. Durability: Choose a mobile made from high-quality materials that can withstand regular use. A durable mobile will last longer and can be used for future siblings or passed down to friends and family. Conclusion Choosing the best baby mobile for your nursery involves considering factors such as design, developmental benefits, safety, ease of use, and longevity. By keeping these tips in mind, you can select a mobile that not only complements your nursery decor but also provides a safe and stimulating environment for your baby. Whether you opt for a mobile with soothing sounds, engaging visuals, or versatile features, the right choice will bring joy and comfort to your little one, helping them drift off to sleep and explore the world around them. When renovating your bathroom or simply upgrading your mirror, an LED mirror is a fantastic choice that combines aesthetics with functionality. LED mirrors provide excellent lighting for grooming while adding a modern touch to your bathroom décor. Choosing the right LED mirror, however, involves considering several factors. Here’s a detailed guide to help you make the best choice. Understand the Basics of LED Mirrors Before diving into the selection process, it’s essential to understand what an LED mirror is. LED mirrors are equipped with light-emitting diodes (LEDs) that surround the mirror or are embedded behind it. These mirrors provide clear, efficient lighting, which is perfect for tasks like shaving or applying makeup. Additionally, LED lights are known for their long lifespan and energy efficiency, making them a cost-effective choice. Size and Placement The size of the LED mirror you choose should be proportionate to your bathroom space and vanity. A large mirror can make a small bathroom feel bigger, while a mirror that is too small might not be very functional. Measure the area above your vanity where the mirror will be placed to ensure a perfect fit. Also, consider the mirror’s placement in relation to other elements like windows or doors to optimize the lighting and convenience. Shape and Style LED mirrors come in various shapes—rectangular, square, round, and more bespoke designs. The shape you choose should complement the overall design theme of your bathroom. For instance, a round or oval mirror tends to soften a bathroom that has lots of straight lines and angles, while a square or rectangular mirror might match a more modern or minimalist décor. Lighting and Features One of the most significant benefits of LED mirrors is the quality of light they provide. Decide whether you want cool or warm lighting. Cool lighting is great for tasks because it provides a bright, white light, while warm lighting creates a more inviting atmosphere. Additionally, some LED mirrors come with extra features such as touch sensors, anti-fog systems, and dimming capabilities. These features can enhance functionality and user experience but may also affect the price. Installation Requirements Check the installation requirements for the LED mirror . Some mirrors can be heavier than traditional mirrors and might require additional support. Ensure that your bathroom wall is capable of supporting the mirror’s weight. Also, consider the electrical requirements for connecting the LED lights. Hiring a professional for installation might be a good idea to ensure safety and functionality. Budget LED mirrors can vary significantly in price, depending on size, shape, features, and brand. Set a budget beforehand, but be prepared to invest a bit more for a mirror that offers quality lighting and durability. Remember, an LED mirror is not just a purchase; it’s an investment in the functionality and style of your bathroom. Reviews and Brand Reputation Finally, do your homework by reading product reviews and researching brands. Reviews can provide insights into the mirror’s performance and durability. Opting for a reputable brand can also ensure that you get a quality product with good customer support. Choosing the right LED mirror is about balancing functionality, style, and budget. By considering these factors, you can select a mirror that not only looks great but also enhances your daily grooming routine, making your bathroom a more inviting space. Whether you’re looking for high-tech features or simple elegance, there’s an LED mirror out there that’s perfect for your bathroom. While you probably take great care of your interiors and mow the lawn regularly, you may neglect to clean the exteriors of your property. This can make your home look dull and unappealing. A dirty roof can be the source of other problems such as moss and mold. The wrong pressure cleaning method can damage the shingles. The right soft wash cleaning can help you prevent such issues. Algae From painting your walls to mowing the lawn, you put a lot of time into making your home look its best. But a dirty roof can steal the spotlight from even the most stunning of homes. Often mistaken for mold or mildew, the black staining and streaks on roofs across the United States are actually algae, specifically gloeocapsa magma. This type of algae forms where there is moisture on roof surfaces, and our coastal and humid weather makes conditions ideal for it to grow. Lichen, moss and algae not only create unsightly stains on your roof, but they can also weaken the structure of your home and lead to leaks and other serious problems. A regular clean with a no pressure roof wash Wellington will eliminate these pesky invaders and help extend the life of your asphalt shingles. It’s important to spray all growths and allow them to dry fully before applying a second heavier application of the Bio-Shield solution. Dirt When it comes to your home’s exterior, there are many ways that you can improve its appearance. You can paint your house a new color, add some landscaping, and even mow the lawn a few times a month. However, one area that often gets overlooked is the roof. Without a clean roof, even the most stunning home can look dull. Dirt, mildew, and algae can leave behind stains that can diminish the overall appearance of your property. No-pressure roof cleaning is the safest and most effective way to remove these stains. This method uses plain water that is sometimes heated to 50-60 degrees for a more effective wash. PROS Instant and effective, Chemical-free, gutters can be washed out at the same time. CONS Slower process, complete fall arrest systems usually needed, noisy – more disruption to building occupants, higher pressure potentially exposes leaks. Mold The climate of Wellington makes it a great place for mold growth. Exposure to mold spores can trigger allergies, itchy eyes and skin, sneezing, and asthma attacks. These symptoms can become severe and even life-threatening in some cases. The attic space of a home often remains damp and dark for long periods, providing the perfect environment for the development of mold. A musty smell is one of the most common signs that a home is infested with mold. If a mold infestation is detected, it is recommended to contact a Wellington mould inspection service immediately. Preventing mold growth is the best way to protect your family and your property. This can be done by ensuring proper ventilation, addressing water leaks promptly, and using dehumidifiers. A regular cleaning of surfaces with a power washer, bleach or mildewcide is also helpful. In addition to these methods, it is important to regularly clean the gutters and downpipes of a home to remove any stagnant water that can encourage mold growth. Sun Damage From painting your home’s interior to mowing the lawn every week, you probably do a lot of work at your property in order to keep it looking its best. However, when it comes to the roof, many homeowners aren’t aware that the sun can cause serious damage. That black staining on your roof is actually algae (Gloeocapsa Magma). Our coastal and humid weather conditions are the perfect environment for its growth, which can eat away at your shingles. This not only affects the curb appeal of your home but also reduces its lifespan. Getting your shingles regularly cleaned helps to prevent broken and damaged shingles, which can lead to leaking and expensive repairs in the future. The best way to keep your shingles clean is by using the soft-wash method. This is an eco-friendly, effective alternative to scraping or applying biocide to the surface of your roof. Our professional cleaning will leave your shingles looking like new and extending their lifespan.

Nicknamed “The Adventure Capital of the World,” New Zealand is a haven for thrill-seekers, and bungy jumping is practically a national pastime here. In this guide, we’ll take you on a jump (virtually, for now) through some of New Zealand’s most unforgettable bungy jumping locations. In this comprehensive guide, we’ll help you make an informed decision by comparing the two cities based on various factors, including attractions, climate, culture, and more. Let’s dive in! While the world-renowned “The Lord of the Rings” and “The Hobbit” trilogies showcased the country’s natural wonders, New Zealand has also been the backdrop for other captivating films, like hentai . In this article, we embark on an immersive journey to uncover the fascinating details of these iconic film locations, discovering the magic that has made New Zealand a beloved destination for filmmakers and movie enthusiasts alike. From strip clubs, camdirect live shows, and brothels to escort services, there are plenty of options for travelers who are interested in exploring this side of New Zealand! However, with its stunning mountain ranges and world-class ski resorts, New Zealand has become an increasingly popular winter destination for snow sports enthusiasts from around the globe. In this blog post, we’ll take a closer… Continue reading After the release of The Lord of the Rings trilogy and The Hobbit trilogy in 2001 and 2012 respectively, Hobbiton became New Zealandâs largest tourist attraction. The hyper-realistiÂ­cally constructed movie set built by the Lord of the Rings directorâs crew makes visitors feel like theyâve traveled to a land far beyond our land. It truly… Continue reading New Zealand is one of those places that really gets people excited. An exotic land of mystery, Maori culture, and magical landscapes. A place where you can ski and ride waves on the same day, walk on a glacier before diving into a natural hot spring, or sail across a lake filled with glowworms before… Continue reading A gateway to some of New Zealandâs most spectacular wilderness scenery and outdoor adventure, the country town of Tuatapere is 88km west of Invercargill. name: Orange Cafe & Bistro
homepage_content: The Orange Cafe Whanganui | Order Cafe Food Online - Order Meal About Us The Orange Cafe Whanganui Orange Cafe & Bistro is a renowned cafe and bar located in the historic post office building in Wanganui. This iconic landmark building adds to the charm and character of the cafe. One of the unique features of Orange Cafe & Bistro is its outdoor seating area, allowing customers to enjoy their meals in the fresh air. The inside decor is adorned with beautiful flowers, creating a pleasant and inviting atmosphere. When it comes to food, Orange Cafe & Bistro offers a wide variety of options. They have a large food cabinet filled with delicious treats, catering to different tastes and preferences. Additionally, they serve Kiwi favorites, ensuring that customers can enjoy their beloved dishes. In the evening, Orange Cafe & Bistro transforms into a European-style bistro. They offer a diverse menu featuring European cuisine, providing a unique dining experience for their patrons. To complement the meals, they also serve locally crafted beers on tap, allowing customers to enjoy a refreshing beverage with their food. Overall, Orange Cafe & Bistro is a popular destination in Wanganui, known for its beautiful setting, diverse menu, and friendly atmosphere. Whether you're looking for a casual meal or a more sophisticated dining experience, Orange Cafe & Bistro has something to offer for everyone. Today, Ajisen Ramen over 750 branches all over the world namely Japan, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, Malaysia, Cambodia, Mongolia, Australia, Canada, Italy, Finland, Columbia, Panama, Guam and New Zealand Since 1968 Our Story Ajisen Ramen was founded in 1968 in Kumamoto, Japan by Mr Takaharu Shigemitsu. In 1997, Katsuaki Shigemitsu took over as the president of Ajisen ramen after Mr Takaharu Shigemitsu passed away. In 1996 Ajisen Ramen expanded internationally. Today, Ajisen Ramen totals over 750 branches all over the world, namely Japan, Hong Kong, Taiwan, China, Thailand, Singapore, Indonesia, Korea, Philippines, Australia, Canada and the U.S.A. Ajisen Ramen brings over 50 years of ramen-making expertise to New Zealand, offering fresh, house-crafted noodles made daily. Rooted in the tradition of Japanese ramen. 50 years of ramen making experience House Crafted Fresh Ramen Ajisen Ramen takes pride in its house-crafted fresh ramen, made daily to ensure exceptional quality and taste. Each strand is crafted to achieve the perfect balance of chewiness and tenderness, serving as the ideal foundation for their rich, flavorful broths. Paired with premium toppings like slow-cooked pork and savoury miso, every bowl showcases the art of Japanese ramen-making. Ajisen Ramen’s fresh noodles bring tradition and flavour together for an unforgettable dining experience. Over 700 stores worldwide! Company Domain Oracle *.globalfoodsoft.com, *.restaurantlogin.com Accept all Reject all Confirm selection Ajisen Ramen (Takapuna) Restaurant Open navigation Close navigation Ajisen Ramen (Takapuna) Restaurant Takeaway & Dine-in at Takapuna Auckland - Asian Japanese Ramen We offer Pick-up See MENU & Order About Ajisen Ramen (Takapuna) Restaurant Ajisen Ramen specialises in tonkotsu pork bone broth and wheat flour noodles. The addition of Shigemitsu's roast garlic and onion flavouring or "the secret recipe," in the tonkotsu soup is apparently responsible for the chain's booming international success. The Kumamoto-style broth comes complete with an egg, chashu pork and kikirage mushrooms. Also on the extensive noodle menu are soy, miso and spicy sesame-based broths and the soup-less dry ramen which comes topped with minced pork, chashu and onion oil. name: Braaihut
homepage_content: Peri Peri Chicken | Braaihut | New Zealand top of page Download Menu 00794210392417941322 Order Online The Love of Braai South African . Flame Grilled Peri Peri Restaurant . •It's Lekker Man• Braai Read More Here > Braai's are places of great social events of casualness, of friends and families, of lovers, of professionals, of young and old, meeting and relaxing over great food cooked on the braai. Braaihut continues this great tradition for you and let's you enjoy your precious time. The Braai was born in South Africa, a place of rich cultural heritage, translated it means "Grill" but it is far, far more than that. It has been adopted in countries throughout Africa, spreading around the world with people of very diverse ethnic backgrounds and languages, it is the nature of simply great food, it is the BRAAI. Every DAY is a BRAAiHUT Day! Any reason will do, any day or time will suffice, any celebration whether it is big or small, any occasion, be it a few people or the whole country. Peri Peri, The Birds Eye Chilli Braaihut has the famous African ingredient called periperi which imparts a flavour like no other, it is the taste of life and gives Braaihut food it's great flavour. bottom of page

name: Brazooka - BBQ Brazil
homepage_content: googleef434ff060a6a64e.html Brazooka | Brazilian Bbq Restaurant | New Zealand top of page All-you-can-eat Brazilian BBQ. We keep dishing it up! Authentic Brazilian BBQ, Cocktails and desserts. Live the life, colour and flavour of Brazil! past main image Enjoy the BBQ without limit Given we describe what we do as "The Full Brazilian BBQ" you'd be right in thinking we're just a little bit different to other restaurants. Brazooka is an all-you-can-eat BBQ restaurant which captures the FLAVOUR of BRAZIL along with its vibrant, relaxed lifestyle and a fun, slightly cheeky attitude. Live, laugh and eat life in FULL COLOUR just like a BRAZILIAN! ​ THE BBQ FULL BRAZILIAN Experience the colour and flavour of Brazilian Churrasco... CHURRASCO is the centuries old Brazilian art of barbeque where delicious cuts of skewered meat are grilled over an open flame charcoal rotisserie to achieve unbelievable succulence. CHURRASCO AUTENTICO ^ The most authentic Brazilian BBQ outside of Rio!! Experience your hot Brazilian! All-you-can-eat delicious Brazilian BBQ... ' RODIZIO STYLE! ' Brazooka food is served in the traditional "RODIZIO" style (or espeto corrido) where we continuously serve all-you-can-eat-beef, pork, chicken, lamb and vegetarian skewers of pure succulence at your table. Flip to Green and get as much as you like! Unlike other restaurants, there's no need to order your food at Brazooka; just sit back, relax, and flip the wooden SINO to green as "The Passadores" (meat carvers) dish up your FULL BRAZILIAN BBQ! SIT BACK & RELAX bottom of page

name: Bayview Motel
homepage_content: Bayview Motel - Waterfront Motel Accommodation in Paihia Welcome to Paradise Waterfront Motel and Apartments in Paihia Book Now Waterfront Location 0 Minute walk from Paihia 0 Rooms WiFi Fibre Internet The Bayview Motel offers unobstructed views over Paihia Beach and the beautiful Bay of Islands. Situated on Paihia's central waterfront, your accommodation is only a 1-minute flat walk to the wharf, shops, cafés and amenities. Sit out on your private deck and take advantage of the spectacular views from our waterfront suites. At the Bayview Motel you have all your holiday needs at your doorstep, with the added advantage of a fantastic waterfront location at reasonable prices. The many exciting activities offered in the Bay of Islands are easily accessible from your accommodation. Try cruising on the bay, swimming with dolphins or sailing in a tall ship. Or get your adrenalin flowing with fast boat trips to the Hole in the Rock, parasailing or a visit to the nearby Adventure Park. The Waitangi Treaty Grounds, historic Russell or bus tours to Cape Reinga and Ninety Mile Beach are all great day trips. The motel accommodation at the Bayview Motel consists of 11 self-contained waterfront apartments and family units (sleeping 2-7). All rooms are serviced daily and have full kitchens, WiFi, Sky TV and queen-size beds. Book Online Make a Booking

homepage_content: Brewers Apprentice â Monteiths Craft Bar and Restaurant | Palmerston North | Manawatu - Home Home Our Story Menus Dine-in/Takeaway Ordering Dining & Cocktails Vouchers What's On Blind Date Palmy Idol Beervana & Long Lunch Functions Our Beer VIP Book Now Contact Loyalty Cards Est. 2006 Brewers Apprentice Restaurant & Bar BOOK A SUMMER LONG LUNCH FROM 12PM! BOOK NOW! Menus Book a table What's on Book a Function Welcome to Brewers Apprentice Palmerston North We are a member of the exciting Monteith's Concept Bar family and putting the ideas together and making it happen has been a vision of the owners with clarity better than 20/20 for the last 14 years. Come in and join us for a crafted Monteith's, maybe a platter with friends or how does a gastronomique dining experience sound. Brisbane's Outdoor Adventures: Sunshine and Scenery Brisbane, the sun-soaked capital of Queensland, offers a bounty of outdoor experiences that take full advantage of its warm climate and stunning natural landscapes. From the sparkling waters of Moreton Bay to the lush greenery of the hinterland, Brisbane serves as a gateway to diverse adventures in the great outdoors. Whether you're seeking thrills, looking to connect with nature, or simply want to enjoy the city's scenic beauty, Brisbane has something for every outdoor enthusiast. Island Escapes and Water Sports Moreton Island, a short ferry ride from Brisbane, is a paradise for nature lovers and adventure seekers alike. The island is renowned for its crystal-clear waters, sandy beaches, and the iconic Tangalooma Wrecks, which offer some of the best snorkeling and diving experiences in Queensland. Visitors and Perth escorts can explore the underwater world teeming with marine life or engage in a range of water sports, from kayaking to stand-up paddleboarding. For those looking for a unique adventure, sandboarding down the towering dunes of the island provides an exhilarating experience. Moreton Island's natural beauty and array of activities make it an ideal destination for a day trip or a longer stay, offering a perfect blend of relaxation and adventure amidst stunning surroundings. Exploring Brisbane's Lush Parks and Gardens Brisbane is dotted with beautiful parks and gardens that provide serene escapes from the urban hustle. The Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mount Coot-tha is a highlight, featuring a collection of native and exotic plants, a tropical dome, and a Japanese garden. It's a place where visitors can enjoy leisurely walks, have a picnic, or simply sit and soak in the peaceful atmosphere. For those seeking more active pursuits, the nearby Mount Coot-tha Reserve offers hiking and mountain biking trails with panoramic views of the city at the summit. Similarly, the South Bank Parklands, with its riverside paths, lush gardens, and sandy beach, is a popular spot for both locals and visitors looking to enjoy the outdoors in the heart of the city. Wildlife Encounters and Hinterland Treks Just a short drive from Brisbane, the hinterland offers a wealth of outdoor experiences, from hiking in the dense rainforests to wildlife encounters. The D'Aguilar National Park, with its extensive network of walking trails, provides a serene setting for nature walks and bird watching, offering a chance to disconnect and immerse oneself in the tranquility of the natural world. For a unique wildlife experience, the Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary allows visitors to get up close with Australia's native animals, including koalas, kangaroos, and wombats. It's an opportunity to learn about the country's unique fauna and the conservation efforts to protect these species. The hinterland also boasts charming mountain villages like Mount Tamborine, where visitors can explore local artisan shops, enjoy gourmet food, and partake in wine tasting, all set against the backdrop of stunning mountain scenery. Conclusion Brisbane's outdoor experiences showcase the city's diverse natural landscapes, from its idyllic islands and waterways to its lush parks and rugged hinterland. Whether you're drawn to the thrill of water sports, the serenity of nature walks, or the joy of wildlife encounters, Brisbane offers an array of adventures that celebrate the great outdoors. These experiences not only provide an escape from the everyday but also a deeper appreciation for the beauty and diversity of Queensland's capital. Keep up to date with the latest specials at The Brewers Apprentice Restaurant and Bar. Drop in for brunch, lunch, dinner, or live music. name: Carriages Cafe
homepage_content: The Vineyards And Wineries Of New Zealand's Kumeu District - Carriagescafe.co.nz The Vineyards And Wineries Of New Zealand's Kumeu District Carriagescafe.co.nz is no longer available here. Please visit cafecarriages.co.nz instead. Visiting Kumeu: Auckland’s Premiere Winemaking District For visitors to New Zealand’s affluent Kumeu district, there’s no shortage of things to both do and see. On this website, readers can discover the many attractions to be found in Kumeu, a quaint rural winemaking community located roughly 25 kilometres northwest of the city of Auckland. Vineyards and Wineries The residents of Kumeu are descended from settlers who originally migrated from Croatia’s Dalmatian Coast in the mid-19th century. They brought the art of winemaking with them from the old country. For this reason, Kumeu now enjoys a reputation for its excellent vineyards and top-notch wines. In fact, winemaking represents the primary industry in Kumeu and in the nearby settlements of Waimauku and Huapai as well. Several local wine labels are recognised internationally for their excellent Chardonnays, including Cooper’s Creek, Kumeu River and Solijans Estate Winery. Visitors to Kumeu can stop by and enjoy the district’s impressive range of boutique wineries, along with its many highly-rated cafes and restaurants. Other Activities Kumeu has much more to offer than just vineyards and wineries. For example, vacationers can also visit the Riverhead, New Zealand’s oldest riverside tavern (located just a short ferry ride away). They can also drop in at the nearby Hallertau Restaurant and enjoy a wide range of freshly-brewed craft beers. Anyone planning a trip to Kumeu should thoroughly familiarise themselves with this site, where they can read about all the district’s most popular attractions, along with its best-rated hotels and B&Bs.

Private Dining Bloody Mary’s is a unique venue in the heart of Christchurch, featuring some of Canterbury’s best produce. A steakhouse, brasserie and bar, are complemented by a secluded whisky library and private dining hall. Bloody Mary’s captures the spirit of conviviality, celebration and companionship. Expert staff and a beautifully appointed interior welcome guests and ensure your experience is comfortable and memorable wherever you choose to enjoy your visit. Revel in the intimate and distinctive interior, or enjoy the sun on the sheltered, airy terrace: The choice is yours. Seasonal, local ingredients are used whenever possible and they’re accompanied by a drinks menu that is among the city’s best and most extensive. Our famous buffet breakfast is available from 6am – 10am Monday-Friday and 6am – 10.30am weekends and public holidays. Fuel-up on scrumptious hot or cold dishes, and try out our super popular hash browns! From 10am there’s a popular bar menu, while from 5.30pm till late the restaurant offers a steakhouse and grill menu – all with a full bar. Bloody Mary’s meats are sourced from the finest farms (being surrounded by them in Canterbury gives us a bit of a head-start). We know you’ll taste the difference, so check our menu for details. Our wine and drinks list is one of the most carefully chosen you’ll find. So, we hope you’ll find yourself here very soon. Maybe for the Happy Hours, or with friends for the famous Friday Shouts! The meat was grilled well, with good sized pieces and lots of crispy bits, and the kebab was wrapped so that you don't have to fight the tinfoil away before you can eat it. I also had the baklava, which at $8 is on the pricier side, but it was a good portion with plenty of syrup nuts and crunchy pastry. Today was my 3rd time here, and it will be my go-to kebab shop from now on. Alex Karl Food was delicious and hot. Took a wee while to get our food but was worth the wait. Service was great. The staff were really friendly Taryn Holmes When we passed the shop, the food smell was amazing, so we wanted to try! Today was my first visit and it was amazing! Reasonable price with decent amount of food! Kebab was massive and I really satisfied with my menu. It was my first time to eat Iskender Staff was very friendly 😁 안녕하세요~ Definitely come back soon! AnnA

name: Crayfest Kaikoura
homepage_content: Crayfest Kaikoura | Crayfish | Kaikōura, New Zealand top of page CONTACT Kaikoura On Hold NZ's Best Provincial Food Celebration CRAYFEST -on hold Crayfest Kaikōura celebrates the sustainability and seasonality of our precious taonga species, Crayfish. Over the past months, it has been come noticeable that following the 2016 Kaikōura Earthquake damage may have occurred in the early stages of the crayfish lifecycle. This is only being seen now due to crayfish reaching adulthood between 7-10 years and we are witnessing a generational gap, through reduced number of crayfish of legal size this season. ​ The Kaikōura community has the privilege of being kaitiaki of our Marine area, and we have a responsibility to ensure that we look after our precious taonga species. For this reason, we will not be hosting Crayfest Kaikōura 2025. ​ Crayfest Kaikōura strongly holds sustainability and abundance for future generations as a key value to our celebration. To do this, we need to allow our marine environment to have time to relax and breathe with undue pressure. We are working with Kaikōura Marine Guardians to continue to research and monitor the fishery and looking at ways as a community that can continue to ensure abundance within our fishery and for the event returning in coming years. ​ We apologise to many who were excited about this year’s event, and we encourage you to visit Kaikōura and take a well rest break and rejuvenate like our crayfish. We invite you to discover the magic of our region — a place that stirs curiosity at every turn. Slow down, take your time, surf, swim, hike, cycle and enjoy our hospitality, or simply tune into the rhythms of nature. SUBSCRIBE FOR UPDATES THE CRAYFEST NUMBERS Days 9 30+ Crayfish DIshes Venues 100 Legends 20 Crayfest Kaikoura it's in our name Kai = "to eat food" Koura = "crayfish" Crayfest Kaikōura is a 9 Day Culinary Festival that celebrates Kaikōura’s most famous kaimoana, the Crayfish. Held within hospitality businesses across Kaikōura, the aim of Crayfest is to make crayfish affordable, accessible and available to every taste and budget, while celebrating crayfish seasonality and to encourage sustainability through enjoying just a taste of crayfish, and sharing a cray amongst friends and family. Events In 2025 we will have a great line up of fantastic e vents such as, long lunches, supper clubs, cooking classes, live music, crays and cocktails and even a wine walk and much more! Find out more EVENTS & TICKETS Menu & Crayfest Vendors Crayfest 2023 had a fantastic range of participating hospitality venues from food trucks to diners to fine dining with everything from Spring Rolls, Souvlaki, Eggs Benedict, Pizza, Pasta, Rolls, Wonton Soup, Craycakes, Bisque, Fritters, Omelettes and more! Find out more CRAYFEST MENU 2023 2023 SPONSORS Crayfest Kaikōura 2023 could not have been achieved without the incredible support from our sponsors bottom of page

name: Curry Pot Indian Restaurant
homepage_content: Curry Pot – The Best Indian Restaurant In Wellington | Best SouthIndian Restaurant In Wellington | Catering | Special Events Restaurant Welcome to Curry Pot The place you want to be with your friends Order online Place your order anytime and enjoy doorstep delivery before 9 PM Call us now at 04 389 7575 to place your order. Our restaurant is totally closed on Mondays. Fine indian Our Story About us You have reached the right destination, where you can enjoy delicious south Indian cuisine. We are pleased that you have visited our web portal. Browse through our website and visit our restaurant. As someone who's spent only a month in NZ I gave Curry Pot a shot as I was missing Indian food. I tried the masala dosa and felt it was not only filling but also tasty. The tomato chutney was delicious and I couldn't help taking a second helping. A bit pricy overall but if you consider how rare it is to find masala dosa in NZ then it's definitely worth it. Will visit again. Satish Google Review I love this place. Right across the street from work and a great lunch special. I've tried a handful of the different curries and I would say that the Chicken Tikka Masala is so yummy. The dinner time Naan breads are pretty massive too. They usually come out cut into thirds to make it more manageable. The staff are friendly and always happy to see me. I'm always happy to see them cause it means I'm gonna eat good in a minute 😁 Dave M Google Review The Curry Pot team were amazing on Saturday night - helping to feed around 60 guests at my home. They came and looked at the venue prior, provided table cloths, bain maries, serving spoons and labels for the curries. And - unexpectedly, two staff stayed on to serve up before packing everything down again once the feeding frenzy was over. The curries themselves were top notch! They always are. My friends and family were really impressed with everything and I was delighted with the whole experience - they made my night! Ella Bee Google Review Authentic Cooking Style It's all about Tradition,Flavour and Taste The chefs are born and brought up in India and have over 10 years of experience in this traditional way of Indian cooking. We offer traditional Indian cuisine with a contemporary Kiwi twist. name: Empress Garden Restaurant
homepage_content: Welcome to Empress Garden Restaurant Home Menu Wine List Takeaway Map Welcome to Empress Garden Chinese Restaurant Located in Herne Bay, Empress Garden Restaurant has been at the forefront of the Auckland dining scene for many years. Winner of several accolades and awards over the years, it has been consistently delivering its signature dish of Peking Duck to fellow foodies who enjoy biting into the crisp skin and succulent flesh of this dish. Incidentally, it is also one of the few Chinese dining establishments that actually make you feel like you're in Chinatown. With hanging red lanterns adorning the ceiling throughout the restaurant, the decor is minimalist and clean, with bright bursts of rich red and dark green leading up to the entrance of the villa, adding to the oriental feel of the place. The restaurant is also divided into various sections and rooms, which can make new comers a little disoriented. But treat it as if you're dining at a beloved relative's home, and you'll fit right in. Openning Hours Open 7 DAYS Lunch 12.00noon - 2:30pm Dinner 5:00pm - 9:30pm BYO Wine Only/Fully Licensed Contact Us 227 Jervois Road, Herne Bay, Auckland Ph:09 376 5550 © Copyright Empress Garden Restaurant 2010-2024

Enjoy traditional family recipes, fine wines, and warm hospitality in a historic setting. More About Etrusco Etruscan Menus Enjoy a wide range of tasty pasta dishes and pizzas or complement your meal with delicious Italian-style breads, antipasto and salads. Top it off with Italy’s famous sweets: tiramisu, gelato and more. VIEW MENU Wines From the menu of traditional Tuscan favourites, your meals are accompanied by a well-matched wine list. BYO Licensed with an extensive cellar wine list, let us share our knowledge and love for Italian wine and dine. View Our Takeaway and Dine in Menu Our restaurants are fully licensed, plus BYO wine only. Entree Mains Desserts Drinks Welcome to Chand Indian Restaurant in North Shore Auckland ~ Nameste ~ Indian Cuisine is as varied as its terrain. From the rich meat dishes to the simple vegetarian cuisine, the art of eating Indian food is to sample several dishes sharing the different tastes with your guests. Our chefs use traditional Indian herbs and spices, which makes our food tastier. Chand was conceived as a 'non-destinational' dining experience, drawing upon the varied range of Indian cuisine which has evolved over many years. Our customers do not have to make any special plans to visit but we are always there when they feel hungry. We provide a clean environment and do not permit smoking anywhere in the premises. Both of our restaurants hold an 'A' grade certificate from North Shore City Council. Dining. Our restaurant is open for dinner daily from 5 pm. We can open for lunch on special request for groups of 15 or more people. Closing times may differ subject to how busy the restaurant is. Our restaurants are fully licensed, plus BYO wine only. Gift vouchers for both of our restaurants are available at the counter. Food delivery is available for Browns Bay, Campbells Bay, Castor Bay, Fairview Heights, Forrest Hill, Long Bay, Mairangi Bay, Murrays Bay, Northcross, Oteha, Pinehill, Rosedale, Rothesay Bay, Torbay, Unsworth Heights and Waiake in North Shore Auckland. name: Gantley's Restaurant
homepage_content: ﻿ Kiwi Vino; the Inimitable Wine of New Zealand - Gantleys.co.nz A Guide To New Zealand's Wines, Vineyards And Wineries A Guide To New Zealand's Wines, Vineyards And Wineries Gantleys.co.nz is no longer available here. Please visit cargobrewery.co.nz/gantleys instead. Kiwi Vino; the Inimitable Wine of New Zealand According to popular perceptions, fine wine is typically associated with France, Italy and the US state of California. But many of the most highly-regarded wine labels today hail from the South Pacific island nation of New Zealand. This website is concerned entirely with the inimitable wine of New Zealand, where to find it, how to drink it, and why it has become so popular over the last two decades. Old Country Winemaking New Zealand boasts several distinct geographical regions known for their impressive vineyards and wineries. These include Northland, Auckland, Gisborne, Nelson, Marlborough and the Waitaki Valley. Winemaking in New Zealand began in earnest in the mid-20th century, with the arrival of settlers from Croatia’s lush Dalmatian Coast. They brought the art of the vine with them from the old country. Since then, local winemaking has flourished, thanks mainly to New Zealand’s unique maritime climate. What’s more, the country’s elongated north-to-south shape allows for considerable variation between its different winemaking regions. A Growth Industry New Zealand is internationally recognised for its excellent Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Noir wines, especially those from the fertile Marlborough region. Since the turn of the millennium, in fact, the country’s domestic winemaking industry has grown by an average of 17 per cent each year. This website provides a host of relevant facts and figures for anyone with interest in New Zealand’s thriving wine sector. And one doesn’t have to be a wine connoisseur to appreciate all the interesting articles written by people passionate about the subject presented herein. © 2025 Gantleys.co.nz. All Rights Reserved.

homepage_content: Green Bamboo Vietnamese Restaurant - Home Home Menu Reservations About us Home Menu Reservations About us GREEN BAMBOO ​VIETNAMESE RESTAURANT WE HAVE LIVED IN NELSON FOR 27 YEARS AND STARTED THE RESTAURANT WITH THE HOPE TO BRING VIETNAMESE CUISINE TO NELSON'S COMMUNITY. WE WERE AWARE THAT THERE WERE NO VIETNAMESE RESTAURANTS IN NELSON, A ND THAT NELSON DID NOT KNOW MUCH ABOUT THE VIETNAMESE CULTURE AND FOOD. WE WANTED TO PRESENT THE VIETNAMESE FOOD IN A WAY THAT MADE PEOPLE INTERESTED IN VIETNAM AS A PLACE TO VISIT ONE DAY. OUR CHEF THE ANH PHAN HAD 20 YEARS' EXPERIENCE WITH VIETNAMESE CUISINE, AND WAS ALSO FROM VIETNAM. THE NAME THE "THE GREEN BAMBOO" STEMS FROM THEIR CULTURE AND INTEREST IN BAMBOO. VIETNAMESE PEOPLE ARE SURROUNDED BY BAMBOO, AND IT BECOMES AN IMPORTANT PART OF THE LIVES. IT HAD BEEN A SIGNIFICANT PART OF THEIR HERITAGE FOR THOUSANDS OF YEARS. homepage_content: Boulevard Orewa | Exquisite Dining and Takeaway in Orewa, Auckland â 326 Hibiscus Coast Highway Welcome To Boulevard Orewa Order Online Welcome To Boulevard Orewa Order Online About us Boulevard Orewa Boulevard Orewa is a vibrant, coastal-inspired restaurant and bar located in the heart of Orewa, just steps from the stunning beach. With a stylish yet relaxed atmosphere, Boulevard offers the perfect setting for casual catch-ups, family gatherings, or lively evenings out. The menu celebrates bold flavors with a strong Middle Eastern influence, featuring a wide range of small plates and hearty mains. Popular dishes include their succulent kebabs, spiced lamb, fresh seafood, and a colorful assortment of tapas designed for sharing. Recently rebranded (formerly known as Lale), Boulevard now operates under the renowned DOWNBEAT hospitality group, bringing a refreshed energy to the Orewa dining scene. Inside, the dÃ©cor is modern with coastal touchesâlight woods, soft lighting, and a welcoming vibe that encourages guests to linger. Outdoor seating is also available, ideal for enjoying Orewa's beautiful seaside air. Guests appreciate the generous portion sizes, lively ambiance, and attentive service. While some have noted occasional wait times during busy periods, most find the overall experience well worth it, especially given the restaurant's prime location and flavorful offerings. name: Bombay Palace
homepage_content: Bombay Palace Wanaka Indian Restaurant Monday to Sunday - 12.00 P.M. to 10.00 P.M Welcome to Bombay Palace Indian Restaurant Wanaka We create a melting pot of Indian Cuisine, with the fantastic spices, full flavored curries and Kebabs & Breads that melt in your mouth Learn more The Gateway to India The journey awaits you Bombay originally was made up of seven islands of lush, fertile land. The earliest inhabitants were the Kolis or sherfolk, which named the islands as Mumbai after a patron deity Mumba Devi. The sultan of Gujarat acquired much of these lands by the 14th Century but it fell to the Portuguese in 1534. The Portuguese later gave MumbaDevi (Bombay) to England as part of a dowry upon the marriage of Catherine of Braganza to Charles II. By the middle of the 17th Century, England held control over the seven islands. Not until the 18th Century following land reclamation were the seven islands joined together again. Bombay derives its unique character from its varied heritage and is still considered a patchwork quilt of Indian culture and faith. Modern Bombay or Mumbai, the nancial and commercial nucleus of India has always been a magnet city attracting the young & elderly, scholars, engineers, artists and entrepreneurs, administrators and the actors from across the length and breadth of the vast and magni cent country of India. Everyone of them in search of fame and fortunes, with their talent, skills and tradition have lent Bombay it’s unparalleled character. With it’s Islamic-Gothic architecture surrounded by modern day Skyscrapers, with temples and mosques, synagogues and churches standing beside ve star hotels & discotheques. Here at Bombay palace, We have aspired to bring to your table a menu that re ects the cosmopolitan culture & culinary specialities of Bombay, the gateway to India. Our Location in Wanaka Bombay Palace Wanaka We invite you to visit Bombay Palace Wanaka for its incessant courteous service, for it's affordable prices but most of all its enlightening experience upon your palate. Our cozy Italian restaurant was born from a simple love of good food and warm company. We serve up classic pizzas with perfectly crisp crusts, rich pastas made from time-honored recipes, and a dash of Italian hospitality in every dish. Whether you're here for a quick lunch, a romantic dinner, or a big family gathering, we want you to feel right at home. Our kitchen uses only fresh ingredientsâlocally sourced when possibleâand each plate is crafted with care, just like Nonna used to make. name: GINGER Remuera
homepage_content: Ginger Restaurant | Thai Restaurant in Remuera Takeaway and Delivery OUR PASSION FOR AUTHENTIC THAI CUISINE ABOUT US “Ginger ( Khing ) is a flowering plant whose rhizome, ginger root or ginger, is widely used as a spice and a folk medicine “ Ginger Remuera delivers real Thai food with a contemporary twist, offering a range of signature dishes that change frequently with seasonality and market availability. Our tables are not adorned with mass produced bottles of ‘Sriracha sauce’ as our meals, accompanying sauces and curry pastes are all hand crafted in the traditional way. You won’t find Asian fusion or confusion dishes where various cultures and cuisines are mashed together. Our food is authentic and pure, designed and prepared by award winning Thai chefs. Offering full vegetarian and vegan options we pride ourselves on delicious food for all tastes. We invite you to nourish yourself with us. homepage_content: Hokonui Bed & Breakfast - Luxury Accommodation on a secluded lifestyle property Luxury Accommodation on a secluded lifestyle property Our Accommodation Looking for some great southern hospitality in a private and rural setting? Come and enjoy stunning panoramic views of the Hokonui Hills and farmland from every room of our modern and warm home. Hokonui Bed & Breakfast is located on the outskirts of Gore, New Zealand only five minutes drive from the town centre.... read more » Your Hosts Brian & Shona are committed to offering their guests a truly genuine Southland hospitality experience. Our personal service and in depth local knowledge of activities and events within the region ensure that guests make the most of their stay in our beautiful part of the country... read more » Guest Comments We booked with Shona and Brian for only one night and wish we could have stayed longer to get to know them better. So friendly and accommodating that we longed to spend more time at their beautiful home. The house is spectacular with beautiful views across the Southland countryside.... read more » Local Activities Gore is the gateway to the picturesque rural province of Eastern Southland. It is an angler’s paradise boasting some of the premier brown trout fly fishing rivers in the world, one of which, the Mataura, can be seen from Hokonui Bed and Breakfast... read more »

Owned and operated by Richard and Li, House of Li is a family orientated and family run business. In 2009 Richard went on a backpacking trip through China - this is where he and Li met. Richard asked Li to come to New Zealand. On their travels they mostly ate street food, which is exactly what they offer you at the House of Li in Motueka. The team at the House of Li is, Li Yiung Qim ( Chairman Li), her son Ming Ming Ma (Leo), Jai Hui Li (Judy) and Richard Hurst. For generations Li and her family have been handing down recipes and cooking authentic food. Available daily from 9am House of Li create spectacular authentic Chinese food using free range eggs,chicken and pork in their dishes. So come to 170 High Street for some genuine street food of China.
