name: The Resurgence Luxury Eco Lodge
homepage_content: Apache2 Ubuntu Default Page: It works Apache2 Default Page It works! This is the default welcome page used to test the correct operation of the Apache2 server after installation on Ubuntu systems. It is based on the equivalent page on Debian, from which the Ubuntu Apache packaging is derived. If you can read this page, it means that the Apache HTTP server installed at this site is working properly. You should replace this file (located at /var/www/html/index.html ) before continuing to operate your HTTP server. If you are a normal user of this web site and don't know what this page is about, this probably means that the site is currently unavailable due to maintenance. If the problem persists, please contact the site's administrator. Configuration Overview Ubuntu's Apache2 default configuration is different from the upstream default configuration, and split into several files optimized for interaction with Ubuntu tools. The configuration system is fully documented in /usr/share/doc/apache2/README.Debian.gz . Refer to this for the full documentation. Documentation for the web server itself can be found by accessing the manual if the apache2-doc package was installed on this server. The configuration layout for an Apache2 web server installation on Ubuntu systems is as follows: /etc/apache2/ |-- apache2.conf | `-- ports.conf |-- mods-enabled | |-- *.load | `-- *.conf |-- conf-enabled | `-- *.conf |-- sites-enabled | `-- *.conf apache2.conf is the main configuration file. It puts the pieces together by including all remaining configuration files when starting up the web server. ports.conf is always included from the main configuration file. It is used to determine the listening ports for incoming connections, and this file can be customized anytime. Configuration files in the mods-enabled/ , conf-enabled/ and sites-enabled/ directories contain particular configuration snippets which manage modules, global configuration fragments, or virtual host configurations, respectively. They are activated by symlinking available configuration files from their respective *-available/ counterparts. These should be managed by using our helpers a2enmod, a2dismod, a2ensite, a2dissite, and a2enconf, a2disconf . See their respective man pages for detailed information. The binary is called apache2 and is managed using systemd, so to start/stop the service use systemctl start apache2 and systemctl stop apache2 , and use systemctl status apache2 and journalctl -u apache2 to check status. system and apache2ctl can also be used for service management if desired. Calling /usr/bin/apache2 directly will not work with the default configuration. Document Roots By default, Ubuntu does not allow access through the web browser to any file outside of those located in /var/www , public_html directories (when enabled) and /usr/share (for web applications). If your site is using a web document root located elsewhere (such as in /srv ) you may need to whitelist your document root directory in /etc/apache2/apache2.conf . The default Ubuntu document root is /var/www/html . You can make your own virtual hosts under /var/www. Reporting Problems Please use the ubuntu-bug tool to report bugs in the Apache2 package with Ubuntu. However, check existing bug reports before reporting a new bug. Please report bugs specific to modules (such as PHP and others) to their respective packages, not to the web server itself.

homepage_content: New Slow Cuts Home - Slow Cuts Skip to content Slow-Cooked Flavour, Fast Favourites We are pretty sure one of the best things in the world is slow cooked food. Especially slow cooked meats, the way we grew up eating. It’s the kind of food you could eat just about every single day, whether you are an Arrowtown local or just passing though. Fri – Tues: 12pm til late Wed & Thurs: 4pm til late Order via Phone: 03 442 0066 For bookings call: 03 442 0066 Order Now Book a Table Get Ready to Indulge Elevated comfort food in a cozy, convivial setting. From fried chicken and burgers to seasonal salads and rotating cheese boards, we make honest food sourced as carefully as possible. Our Menu We love a good party At Slow Cuts, we don’t just serve amazing food – we know how to have a good time too! With a fully stocked bar offering local craft beers, fine wines, and signature cocktails, we’re ready to keep the good times flowing. We often host functions, gigs, and private events – Slow Cuts is the perfect spot to enjoy live music, celebrate with friends, or simply unwind with great food and drinks. Our Place Book a Table THE FOOD CHAIN WE HAVE A GREAT CREW IN ARROWTOWN Our suppliers are one of the keys to our happiness. We strive to use the most local ingredients from passionate farmers, producers, growers and friends. BEEF – We currently source our beef from Silver Fern Farms. This beef is raised naturally and strives on its grass fed pastures. www.silverfernfarms.com FISH – This family owned and operated business that is based in Dunedin supplies us with the freshest fish with daily deliveries to Arrowtown. The fish is caught between Timaru and Bluff, so straight out of that deep cold Southern water. www.harbourfish.co.nz CHICKEN – All our chicken comes from the rolling hills of the Waikato. These happy chickens all have the SPCA Blue Tick of quality and we are super proud to be serving them www.waitoafreerange.co.nz Our Menu Learn more THIS IS WHERE THE LOCALS EAT - SO GOOD! We were told about this incredible eatery by our hotel manager who lives in Arrowtown and said this was a "must do" as he and lots of the locals eat here at least once a week. Its is incredibly inviting with both indoor/outdoor seating, heating and relaxed feel. We turned up without a reservation and happily was seated right away. The service was prompt, friendly and genuine.... The menu is a great variety of flavoursome homestyle favourites with a modern twist. Burgers, fresh and healthy salads, slow roasted/braised meats, interesting juices and gourmet coffee options. Great place for a laid back lunch or dinner with the family and friends. Thanks Slow Cuts we will be back. - HOMENOWXOXO SYDNEY, AUSTRALIA JAMES'S SERVICE IS UNBEATABLE Came here for a lunch date with my boyfriend, being a vegan and healthy eater in a meat house is not ideal for any waiters, but this didn't stop James and his team from providing 5 star service! By far the friendliest kindest service I've received this year in New Zealand. We shall definitely recommend and be back. The food was amazing too! Thank you Slow Cuts and the team. - MICHAELALAYLA SLOW AND STEADY WINS THE RACE Dropped into this funky place for lunch. We ordered the cheese burger, colourful burger, mac and cheese and kids beef burger.Being a burger lover I appreciated how delicious and light the buns were. I also sampled some of the slow roast lamb shoulder. All the food was amazing and the service was fantastic. - ELIACREVAR GREAT FOOD, A1 SERVICE (HUGE BURGERS AND GOOD PRICE) Ducked in this week for a light lunch, but left very happy and with expectations surpassed. I had the buttermilk chicken burger and my partner the fish burger. Both were perfect, tasty and satusfying! Service was a real highlight - would recommend to anyone looking for a good hearty lunch that will leave you happy. - lmb_612 BRISBANE, AUSTRALIA JUST GREAT FOOD!! Didn't know what to expect but the menu looked inviting and we could sit outside in the courtyard on a sunny evening. Service was prompt and friendly and orders taken after drinks served (perfect). Braised steak off the specials board and burgers off the menu were ordered with some additional side dishes. Didn't have to wait long and were presented with 4 fantastic dishes. Good portions, great tasting and a well deserved 5 stars from us. - lmb_612 BRISBANE, AUSTRALIA Our Place Contact Our People Book a Table Order & Pickup Facebook Instagram Our Food Our Brew Functions Live Events Book a Table Order & Pickup Functions Live Events Our Place Our Food Our People Our Brew Contact Facebook Instagram © 2024 A PEOPLE LIKE US COMPANY | Made with ❤︎ by Nicely Book a Table Buy a Gift Voucher 50 Buckingham St, Arrowtown 9302 Ph. 03-442 0066 OPEN WED-THUR 4PM TILL LATE, AND FRI-TUES 12PM TILL LATE. After McDonald’s, Irish pubs are the largest export of food and drink in the world. It is not just the food and drink that they export, though. They sell the drinking culture entirely, although not as effectively as its home town, Dublin. The Irish are known internationally for their drinking habit. Every Irish pub in the world has almost the same aesthetic: dark wood panels running all over the floor, ceiling and walls, a string music soundtrack with bagpipes obviously, maybe a Gaelic sign here and there, a framed picture of James Joyce and Guinness running from a tap. The last bit of detail, the Guinness, was the actual reason why Irish pubs got sold so fast and so wide. However, it was not just because of the drink; it was because of the drinking habit. The Irish Pub Concept was developed by an architect from Dublin who went by the name of Mel McNally. He founded the Irish Pub Company in 1990 to expand the Irish pub business worldwide. He reasoned, logically and correctly, that the tourism to Ireland that had increased considerably during that time would make people want the Irish pub experience elsewhere as well. Right around that time, Diageo, the parent company of Guinness, got wind of this massive idea, and struck an unofficial partnership with them. Together, the two were unstoppable. The Irish loved Guinness, and the Irish Pub Company sold the drinking habit on the drink. Ever since their first Irish pub at Moscow airport (Shannon’s) they went on to build 2000 odd culturally and commercially successful pubs all over the world. It is, however, interesting to note that even though Guinness, which garnered so much attention because of the Irish Pub Company, was asked about it, they completely denied there was any formal relationship between the two companies. Bill Grantham, a visiting professor at Loughborough University , thinks otherwise. He went to explain that there were a lot of underlying clues that stated that Guinness and the Irish Pub Company are still working together, even though they openly deny it. The Irish Pub Concept belongs to the drinks conglomerate and parent company of Guinness, Diageo. The Irish Pub Concept even has an Overview section on its website where the market analysis of the Concept was being done by Guinness. The harp logo of Guinness is practically everywhere on the Irish Pub Concept website, and Grantham agrees that they have no intention of hiding this connection even though they deny it. McNally’s success formula for a good Irish pub were authentic design, authentic Irish food and beverage, Irish music and entertainment, and employees and management trained in the ways of the Irish. There is nothing like it, and is definitely a unique experience to try out. Ireland, on the 29th of March 2004, became the first country in the world to ban smoking in all workplaces, including bars and restaurants. People however, both local and international, were shocked to the fullest when the legislation included bars. The people who were opposing this move stated that it would be ludicrous to even assume that Irish bars, known globally for smoking and drinking, were the last places on the planet where smoking should be banned. However, this was not met with massive uprising and revolt, but rather with acceptance. Within the next few months, seven states in the United States of America and 9 provinces in Canada went smoke free completely, which included bars and restaurants. Other countries that followed suit with the Irish model of smoke free legislation were New Zealand, Uganda, Norway, bhutan and Italy. All these countries banned smoking not just for the customers, but also the staff who worked at these workplaces too. Scotland and Sweden brought about a smoke free legislation in 2005, while it took Australia 2 more years, finally banning it in 2007. After Ireland’s bold decision, several countries have come up with legislation to prevent smoking and protect their citizens from the epidemic of passive smoke. Even though the legislation was met with welcome arms in workplaces like public transport, the cinema and work offices, the hospitality sector, the bars and restaurants, raised their voices against the smoke free legislation. Most of those who were opposing the move were bar owners and their representatives, and the same resistance was felt in the United States and Canada where bars were a social focal point in everyone’s lives. There was a rhetoric of gloom and dread that washed over the place. The protestors argued that the legislation was unnecessary, unworkable and unjustified, and that it was not the job of the publicans and staff to enforce the law on the customers. However what really happened was a completely different story. The people of Ireland, as it turns out, were extremely compliant. In fact, they were so compliant that six months after the legislation was passed a survey conducted by the Office of Tobacco Control , which included a total of twenty six thousand six hundred and twenty seven inspections, concluded that the compliance rate clocked in a whopping 94 percent. The government also set up a free phone compliance line to report any breaches in the legislation, which peaked at 1524 calls in the first month, and declined rapidly to 145 in the next month and so on. Only 11 out of the 700 odd bars faced legal action for failing to comply with the legislation. When you think of the Irish, the first two things that come to mind are men in kilts playing bagpipes and drunk Irish men. The Irish pub is sort of like a watering hole for the Irish where everyone meets and shares a drink or two. The general idea of an Irish Pub is dark wood paneling, a string music soundtrack with bagpipes obviously, maybe a Gaelic sign here and there, a framed picture of James Joyce and Guinness running from a tap. However, the last item on the list, the Guiness, wasn’t really an Irish thing till 1990. 1990 was the year a Dublin architect who went by the name of Mel McNally made the Irish Pub Company. It was a first of a kind company in Ireland, created to build Irish style drinking establishments all over the world. Diageo, parent company of Guinness, saw this as a golden opportunity and decided to partner up with them. Since their first Irish pub in the Moscow airport called Shannon’s, Guinness has been associated with the Irish people since then. However, it wasn’t just a mere coincidence that Guinness partnered with the Irish Pub Company. There were two other companies, Love Irish Pubs and Ol Irish Pubs Ltd. which were popular at the time as well. However, the people of Ireland fancied Guinness over other drinks which made the Irish Pub Company famous: the other companies barely stood a chance. They still operate within Ireland suite proficiently, with Love Irish Pubs website providing offers like sports memorabilia, musical instruments and whiskey jogs among other bar related stuff. However, quite a lot of Irish people and people who have lived in Dublin argue that the Guinness gets worse outside of Ireland. In fact, according to them, the quality of Guinness gets worse the further away the pub is from Ireland. Bill Barich, author of A Pint of Plain, says that bottled Guinness is much thicker than the on tap Guinness that you are served at an Irish pub in the United States or the United Kingdom. The main reason why these Irish pubs in other countries are not as good as the Irish pubs back home in Dublin is the same reason why people practically live in Irish pubs in Dublin: the social factor. Irish pubs are much more than just pubs for them, it is a place of social gathering where people get together to have a good time in the evening after a hard day’s work and celebrate life. However today, Irish pubs are more or less like any other sports bar, with 15 flat screen LED TVs and no longer a community center. All that remains today of an Irish bar is the wood panelling and the Guinness. If you want the true Irish pub experience, it is better to visit Ireland itself. Ireland is famous for two things: bagpipes and drinking. Every major city has at least a few Irish pubs. They exist all over the United States of America and in most metropolitan cities in the world, almost like a McDonald’s or Coca Cola. There are Irish pubs all over the place from Seamus McCaffey’s at Phoenix, Arizona to The Grand Khan Irish Pub at Ulan Bator, Mongolia. Some of the common features in Irish pubs are dark wood panels running around every inch of the place, a string music soundtrack with bagpipes obviously, maybe a Gaelic sign here and there, a framed picture of James Joyce and Guinness running from a tap. However, the Irish don’t exactly fancy Guinness they just want to drink. So this whole stereotyping of the Irish with Guiness is actually due to a partnership between the Irish Pub Company and Guiness. The Irish Pub company is a construction company that specializes in building Irish pubs all over the world. It was quite the clever partnership, because it provides the place with an Irish pub, with a lot of business to Guiness; establishing that the Irish in fact are one for Guiness. This ruled out competition like Ol Irish Pubs Ltd. and Love Irish Pubs; which is a shame because Love Irish Pubs offers sports memorabilia, musical instruments and whiskey jogs among other bar related stuff. The mastermind behind the Irish Pub Company was a Dublin architect by the name of Mel McNally. He started the Irish Pub Company in 1990 after studying the basic structural elements of bars in his hometown, assuming that the spike in tourism at that time in Ireland would increase the popularity of Irish style drinking establishments in other places as well. Guinness parent company Diageo, seeing the opportunity as the golden egg laying goose as it is, decided to partner with them to sell what they referred to as “The Irish Pub Concept”. Building their first Irish Pub in Moscow under the name Shannon’s, they went on to build at least 2000 pubs in Europe alone between 1992 and 1999. They kept expanding, reaching 53 countries, everywhere from Canada to Mexico to even Iraq. McNally listed the major ingredients of an Irish Pub as authentic design, authentic Irish food, authentic Irish beverages, Irish music and entertainment , and employees and management trained in the ways of the Irish. They are also compelled to employ Irish people as the staff to make the people feel like they are in Ireland. The Irish pubs that are open now are mostly just like McDonald’s, all the good stuff has just been siphoned off, leaving behind a skeleton of the experience. If you’re planning to visit Ireland for your next vacation, then you ought not to leave the land without digging into these traditional Irish foods that are prepared in its most authentic styles. From fish in the summer to lambs in springs and soups and stews in winter, their food options changes every other season. Make sure your appetite is well maintained when you visit Ireland, to try out some of the most delicious cuisine and recipes in the world. Shellfish When you visit Ireland outside summer, the chances of witnessing the sun is very slim. However, on the plus side, you will be exposed to the opportunity of trying various delicacies from the west coasts’ native oysters. The best season to try them is in September when you visit the Galway Oyster Festival that takes place in that month. When compared to the other sea creatures, shellfish is the one that stands on top of the list. The Dublin Bay Prawns , cockles and mussels also have their own festival in Howth. Colcannon and champ Potatoes are the staple vegetables in the Irish cuisine that has transformed their food choices and recipes from the 16th century. It is one of the staple crops that is grown in the regions and also adds to the list of foods and vegetables that are cheaper in the region. However, the potato harvests hit the light only in the 19th century, which is now a part of the staple meal in Ireland. Colcannon is a famous Irish dish that is a classic form of comforting mash potatoes. It includes Potatoes Cabbage or kale Cream or butter Spring onions Colcannnon and champ follow similarly recopies but with a lot of milk and butter. It tastes the best when it is topped with scrambled or fried eggs. Boxty Boxty is a short form of all the potato-based recipes that includes potato pancakes, potato bread and potato dumplings. It directly translates to ‘Poor house bread ‘in English. All these recipes make use of grated potato shavings or are mixed with mashed potato and fried to dumplings. This mixture is then added to pancake mix to convert it into a pancake or is also integrated into a bread mixture to baking a potato break. Boxty can be teamed with anything, and whatever you choose, it teams up well to form a great mixture. It is also a great combination with smoked salmon or eggs. Boiled Bacon and Cabbage Although boiled bacon, boiled potatoes and boiled cabbage might not sound appetizing on paper, it still is an excellent combination for the tastebuds. A mixture of these three is also a family favourite. Traditionally a back of the pork is cut into thin slices (sometimes even from the shoulders). The meat is soaked overnight depending on the amount of desalting require and is boiled along with cabbage for ten minutes. The best accompaniment for this recipe is silky parsley sauce that is also a homemade recipe in Irish households. Irish pub or bar is not just a destination where people drink and have fun, but it’s a distinctive culture in itself. Although the number of pubs in the Irish land is decreasing dramatically, considering the ban of smoking and other lifestyle changes, the tradition in itself remains a vital part of the Irish tradition . In this article, you will enlighten yourself about the Irish Pub culture and the etiquettes of these pub cultures. An introduction to the Irish pub culture The social aspect is one of the major attractions of the country’s pub culture. The rural areas of the country comprised of three primary sources of recreation: The church Football club Irish pubs for drinking Until recent years, people of the land rarely drank at home, as social culture and social life was a crucial part of their lifestyle. The pubs in Ireland are known for their welcoming ambience, atmosphere and the quality of alcohol they serve. The warmth and friendliness of these cultures have spread to the entire world. In today’s world, it is impossible to find a country that does not boast an Irish pub/bar. Pint Drinking in Ireland If you visit and Irish pub or bar and order for a pint, then the bartender is either going to serve you with their finest black beer called the Guinness or a pint of stout. Murphys or Beamish are the most common names for these Stouts, and they’re much more frequent than the Guinness. While in England and other regions, you ask for a glass of beer, which is half a pint in Ireland. One of the essential tips served by professionals is that the drink can only be enjoyed after it settles till the end unless you want to look like a novice Guinness drinker if you did not allow for it to settle. If you wish to take the Guinness, then better to visit Ireland and taste it as they maintain their authenticity. Ordering a pint Unless you’re ordering food along with your drinks, the barmen generally expect you to pay after the drink is served and for him to be tipped after every drink or every round of drink, to stay on his right side. Also, Irish people are reluctant to people showing off, so probably keep it a little subtle. Pub culture experience in Irish pubs People in Ireland are not reluctant to chat with a stranger, and hence you can begin talking to the barman or the person right next to you. Slagging is also a vital part of their pub culture. This, in layman terms, means, making fun of someone which can turn out to be too hilarious. If you’re a victim, then remember the intention is only to have fun and nothing personal. If someone offers you a drink and you wish to decline, then say ‘Ah, no’, even if you’re dying to accept it. So, you may have to be offered the drink at least 3-4 times before buying. Strangely this is part of their drinking culture. The essence of adding Irish seasonings to the authentic Irish Recipes imparts the exact authentic taste of the land. Whether it’s a festive event or a family dinner, authentic Irish food, over a couple of pints brings the extra addition of Irish land to the table. The top recipes mentioned in this article, along with their authentic spice mixture, is what you need to celebrate your next St. Patrick’s day – the Irish style . If you wish to know more about the recipes, follow the article till the end. Bread Making It is no brainer that bread making is one of the most crucial parts of any traditional Irish home. The people of Ireland also believe that it is also a meaningful part of any of the Irish households. In ancient times, a traditional Irish cottage kitchen baked this Irish bread on a daily basis. This recipe followed a conventional process of baking on large Girdles or on massive kettles that were generally baked directly on the fire. One of the main ingredients for their seasoning was the caraway seed, which is still used in most parts of the world and majority in Ireland. It is a vegetal, spicy-green flavoured seed that is added to the bread. They’re added to provide a toothsome texture with the hint of savoury flavour. Vegetarian Irish Potato Stew According to the traditional Irish people, St. Patricks’ day is incomplete without serving the guests with a hot potato stew. In addition to the traditional stew, the potatoes are also one of the most significant additions to the traditional Irish foods. Potatoes were introduced to the land in the 1500s, and pretty soon, it became one of the main components of the country’s agricultural produce. A traditional Irish potato stew is known for its rich, creamy flavour which blends well with the minimal seasonings like salt and pepper. But did you also know that there goes a ton of other seasonings that adds to its rich flavours. Some of the most important ones include: Dill Thyme Parsley Fennel Seeds The nuttiness from the dill seeds and the herbal flavour from the thyme add to the creaminess and starchiness from the potatoes. This is also another excellent option for all the non-meat eaters. Beer mustard Any kind of meat in Irish is accompanied by good quality mustard, which is mostly in the homemade genre. The tangy flavoured spicy residue is the best combination with corned beef. The intensity of the flavours from mustard seeds, prepared from scratch elevates the density of the meant. Mustard is also otherwise called a poor man’s pepper. Since they’re grown in Ireland, it is highly affordable for the natives of the region. It can be used in dry form to preserve liquids like wine, fine ale. It is one of the most Irish versions of storing drinks. Ireland is famous for its pub and bar culture if not for their drinking addiction. While it is easy to order a drink and have a casual chat with your friends at the ambience, this simple task to comprise of some of the unspoken rules that nobody tells you about. If you wish to know what they are, then stick till the end of the article and find out for yourself! Buying a round This is one of the most important rules, but when not followed, can leave you with a wrong impression in the minds of the locals and the barmen. Since the entire crowd of Ireland is fun-loving and lovely, there is a good enough chance that you might sit with the locals for a drink or two. Whenever the group finishes their drink, each person goes up to the counter and orders for everyone. You should not miss your turn of ordering or buying everyone a drink, lest you should lose your new Irish friends that you just made. Also, another pro tip to add here is that the couples do not count as one. Since each one is having a drink, they ought to order. Patience is the key for Guinness The drink is poured in two different stages, and it needs to settle down ultimately, which takes about a minute or two. So, if you order a pint of this drink in the bar , then the barman will fill your glass until half full and move on to something else. Don’t gulp your drink but wait for him to return and complete the drink. Once finished filling your glass, please wait for a minute so that it amalgams with the first drink and then begin to savour it. Getting a bartender’s attention Irish pubs and bars are generally crowded considering the fun and alcohol friendly people that they are. Hence, you have to wait for a couple of minutes for the bartender to process your order. Get started from getting close to the barman as much as possible. If you still don’t get his attention, lift your pointing finger. Sticking money in the air to get his attention is the last thing you want to do, as it is considered disrespectful. Drinking isn’t a race In countries like North America, drinking and getting high is considered a race- especially among young teens. However, the opposite is followed in Irish pubs – it isn’t a race, and it is imperative to drink slowly. Social drinking is one of the critical skills that ought to be maintained in the place. Key Takeaway Irish pubs fall under the destination experience the most fun and excitement, but this can be experienced and enhanced if you follow the right etiquettes of the destination. These unspoken rules are the key to better your drinking experience. When in Ireland, be an Irish! Daily beverages might differ from one country to another. However, one of the most common options is coffee. Since people have become more health-conscious in the past two decades, many consumers have shifted to healthier alternatives like soy milk and fresh juice. Coffee is no more considered a healthy drink because caffeine is said to have side effects. With such disadvantages being spread, not everyone will be enthusiastic about switching back to coffee. But it is only small communities that have avoided coffee, while many others still love the taste of the crushed beans. Brewing a cup of coffee for the morning refreshment is still the idea millions of people stick to. Irish coffee is just another type of coffee that has alcohol mixed in it. People who think coffee and alcohol are unhealthy shouldn’t simply skip this article; you are likely to fall in love with coffee all over again. Irish coffee can be easily made using some coffee powder, whiskey, thick cream, and sugar. All these ingredients will contribute to better health. Let us look at some of the benefits of drinking Irish coffee . 1. Reduced Heart Diseases The risk of heart diseases can be reduced significantly by consuming Irish coffee regularly. Alcohol can also lend you a safer path in life when consumed in healthy amounts. General blood circulation and flow to the heart improve with the consumption of alcohol. A daily dose of Irish coffee will make your heart stronger, but you don’t necessarily have to take it every day because it can turn out to be addictive. Two or three a week can help you fight all heart-related risks. When you are taking Irish coffee, make sure not to consume more alcohol than is recommended for your weight and age. 2. Reduced Risk of Diabetes Type II diabetes can also be reduced by taking Irish coffee. This may come as a surprise to most readers because the drink primarily consists of sugar and cream. When you drink it in moderation, biological responses that can cause diabetes will be inhibited with an increase in the plasma levels. Diabetes can also arise from overeating, which can also be reduced by taking Irish coffee since it cuts your appetite. Taking Irish coffee on a semi-regular basis will surely help you stay away from the risks of type II diabetes. 3. Lesser Chances for a Stroke Stroke is one of the biggest health risks that can even lead to paralysis. Many people fear it because it can become debilitating as soon as one encounters it. If you enjoy a cup of Irish coffee, this health risk can be reduced. The arteries will be unblocked due to the impact of caffeine and alcohol. Reduced blood flow is one of the major reasons for artery blockage, which can be brought down to negligible levels by drinking this potent beverage made of caffeine and alcohol. It can have great effects on the body to reduce the risks of a stroke. In this guide, I will be talking about some Irish recipes that you should get in a pub or a bar. They are extremely delicious. The sweet island is a gorgeous country that has produced some of the most amazing cuisines in the world, and it is unquestionable. The delicacies have been unforgettable. Ireland is also famous for giving us a lot of delicious food. We have to forget the Americanised pub food , and we should try some Irish delicacies in some decent pubs in Ireland, as soon as possible. Well, since there are two vaccines in the works, we can expect life to get back to normal anytime soon. We should actually support the local pubs in Ireland, because they have been affected by the coronavirus pandemic. Anyway, in this guide, I will be listing out some delicious Irish food that you have to try in sound their most famous local pubs and bars. The Irish stew happens to be the stable of Irish cuisine, but it does not have a standard recipe. But, it definitely is a favourite of the Irish people. It dates back to the 1800s, and it was often made with meat of sheep, because of the economic importance of milk and wool. After wool and milk were harvested from the sheep, they would go to get slaughtered. The recipe of this stew makes use of root vegetables and some tender meat of mutton. You can consume this as an appetiser or a decent meal itself. I am sure you have heard of Shepard’s pie. I have had the vegetarian version of Shepard’s pie, but the real version has meat and vegetables in it. They make use of beef and some mashed potatoes with some seasoned vegetables. It is the ultimate comfort food. If you are going to stick to a traditional recipe, you should choose beef or lamb. Coddle is the next one that I would like to talk about. It is essentially a wonderfully comforting creamy broth-based concoction which is completely made of bacon, pork sausage, onion and potatoes. It can be consumed in a cup or a bowl. It is a great choice as a starter. It is an amazing choice if you are hungry on a Sunday afternoon in bed. You can just whip it up in a couple of minutes, or if you want to put more time into it, you can invest and concentrate and make a really delicious bowl in an hour. It is perfect to go with your favourite comedy. I am sure you have heard of soda bread. It is a very popular side dish which is also a traditional Irish bread which is made without the help of yeast.

name: Te Puka Tavern
homepage_content: Te Puka Tavern top of page 1/16 TE PUKA TAVERN 'Hosting the Coast since 1873' The Te Puka Tavern is an east coast icon situated 90km from Gisborne along the picturesque SH35, an easy and pleasant drive northeast of the Gisborne city. Sitting on the water’s edge of the Pacific Ocean, looking over beautiful Tokomaru Bay, it is the ideal place to stop and rest awhile and meet the friendly people of the East Coast. The Te Puka Tavern has provided hospitality to travelers and locals alike since it was established in 1873. It was rebuilt in 1988 after Cyclone Bola swept the original pub off its foundations. Te Puka Tavern now offers travelers cafe and pub food, accommodation is available in modern units, we also have powered parking for self-contained camper vans and of course a well-stocked and welcoming bar. The staff is always happy to advise you on things to see and do in the area and take pride in serving our valued guests. Nau mai...Haere Mai! bottom of page

name: Peppers Beachfront
homepage_content: Peppers Beachfront // Bar & Cafe Welcome to Peppers Restaurant Positioned absolute beachfront overlooking the beautiful Gisborne beaches and Young Nicks Head, Peppers Beachfront is a must see. Take in the spectacular views while enjoying breakfast or watch the sun go down over dinner, which ever way you enjoy it the passion for food here is evident in this local inspired Cuisine. This relaxed light filled space is perfect for a large function, wedding or co-operate event. The young couple, Dan & Bridget French saw a diamond in the rough and took on the challenge to bring it back to life!. name: Stables on Alpha
homepage_content: Stables on Alpha – Restaurant, Bar & Venue Skip to content Stables on Alpha At Stables on Alpha we offer delicious, locally sourced food and drinks in a casual and relaxed setting. We proudly champion the finest local produce. Make a Reservation Secure your table in just a few clicks and enjoy an unforgettable dining experience with us. Our Menu Explore our delectable dishes crafted with the freshest ingredients. There’s something for every palate! Order Online Craving our food at home? Order online now for quick delivery or convenient pickup. Welcome to Stables on Alpha Experience the perfect blend of cool, relaxed, and friendly at Stables on Alpha. Welcome to The Londoner A great place to meet & chat with friends and enjoy our tasty English food and beverages. Arguably the best English Pub in the City, we are situated in one of Hamilton's magnificent historical buildings. Enjoy an English beer served by the pint or one of our craft beers brewed here in NZ and don't worry we also stock an excellent range of premium and imported beers. Make a Reservation Call VINO Today Order Takeaway Order Delivery Vino Gift Voucher Find Vino Orewa Welcome to Vino Restaurant & Wine Bar – Ōrewa ' ’s own authentic mediterranean escape. At Vino Ōrewa , we bring the sun-drenched flavours of Italy, Turkey, and Greece to your table. Every dish—from our authentic Greak pizzas and handmade pastas to slow-cooked moussaka and afreshing seafood marinara—a tribute to authentic mediterranean tradition. Sip, Savor, Relax Our locally handpainted Santorini mural is absolutely enchanting. The vibrant blues and whites of the island’s iconic scenery brings a slice of Greek paradise to Orewa, coupled with beautiful m editerranean background music what an amazing way to celebrate with Vino! ​ Enhance your meal with a glass from our handpicked selection of imported and local wines, all enjoyed in our intimate, music-filled ambiance—perfect for long lunches, family dinners, or romantic evenings. name: Tinwald Motels
homepage_content: Ashburton Motel Accommodation | Tinwald Motel | Affordable Luxury Home Welcome Location Accommodation Overview Deluxe Full Kitchen Studio Deluxe Kitchenette Studio Facilities Motel Facilities Alluvial Restaurant Tinwald Tavern Bar Tinwald Liquorland Book Now Image Gallery Area Information Ashburton South Island Things to see & do Events Contact Us Welcome TO TINWALD MOTEL WELCOME TO TINWALD MOTEL TINWALD MOTEL IS A 13 UNIT MOTEL COMPLEX ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF ASHBURTON AND JUST 3KM TO THE TOWN CENTRE. Our Qualmark 4+ self contained and serviced affordable quality motel accommodation offers luxury units, with high quality beds in every unit with the option of a full kitchen or kitchenette. Tinwald Motel accommodation is perfect for families, couples or those requiring an access unit. We are also ideally suited for corporate business travellers, with business facilities and wireless internet available. Our Tinwald Motel is also adjacent to Alluvial Restaurant , Tinwald Tavern Bar and Tinwald Liquorland . Enjoy a delicious meal and a drink, without leaving the motel complex! Explore Ashburton There is plenty to see and do in Ashburton, from trains, planes and automobile museums to gardens, markets and seven great golf courses. Tinwald Motel is also within close proximity to all popular café and restaurants in Ashburton's town centre. For those that love Skiing and Snowboarding, Tinwald Motel is only an hours drive from Mt Hutt ski field. Just 4km from Tinwald Motel is Lake Hood. Lake Hood is Ashburton’s top attraction for water sports, including water skiing, rowing, swimming, kayaking and much more! Our luxury accommodation at Tinwald Motel provides the perfect base for your holiday in the Ashburton area. name: Walters Tavern
homepage_content: Walter’s Tavern | Local Pub in Queenstown Skip to: Home Content Footer navigation NZVC are hiring across our venues - view available positions - Cromwell Cup | Sunday 30th November Off to the races? Start your day the right way at Walt’s! See more or book your spot! See more or book your spot! Walter’s Tavern Welcome to Walt’s Blending old-school charm with a fresh, contemporary feel, Walt’s is where familiar faces, hearty food, and good times come together. Whether you’re dropping in for a cold pint after work, gathering the crew for a laid-back dinner, or catching the big game in the main bar, there’s always a seat waiting. Upstairs, enjoy a relaxed dining experience with elevated pub classics, regional wines, and welcoming vibes that feel like home. Downstairs brings the buzz with high tables, live sport, and classic Kiwi hospitality. Walt’s is proudly local – made for Queenstown, by Queenstown – and we’re all about keeping things simple, social, and seriously good. Come for the food, stay for the banter. We’ll see you soon. Take a virtual tour! Weekly Specials Burger Special Happy Hour Parmy Special Steak Special Sunday Roast Express Lunch $10 Guinness All Day, Every Day Just One More Previous Slide Next Slide Eat & Drink At Walt’s, we serve up classic Kiwi pub fare with a local twist. From hearty lamb shanks, chargrilled steaks, or classic fish n chips, our menu is straightforward, nourishing, and full of flavour. Our drinks list keeps things easy with cold Kiwi beers, crisp regional wines, and a few go-to cocktails for good measure. Whether you’re after a casual bite, a round with mates, or a relaxed dinner upstairs, Walt’s has you covered. See menu Live Sport Catch every match, game, and race LIVE at Walt’s, where sport takes centre stage and every win feels like a team victory. With big screens, cold beers, and a buzzing pub atmosphere, it’s the ultimate spot to cheer on your favourites, home or away. Whether you’re all in for the season or just here for the vibe, Walt’s brings the energy every game day. Rally your mates, grab a pint, and get amongst it. See sports schedule Private Events & Functions Host your next event at Walt’s! Whether you’re planning a casual catch-up, a milestone celebration, or a team gathering, we’ve got a space to suit. Choose from cosy corners inside the tavern, our spacious upstairs dining room, or the inviting heated terrace – perfect for any season. Let’s make your next event one to remember. name: The Waters
homepage_content: WATERS – Luxury B&B Suites KIA ORA Welcome to A unique Destination Book your stay with a pristine beachfront setting We welcome you to the Waters at the edge of our olive grove, just meters from the beach, and perfectly located to explore Nelson to the East, Abel Tasman and Kahurangi National Parks to the North, and the Vineyards of the Moutere to the West. Location The Waters is a luxurious boutique Bed & Breakfast dramatically set above the turquoise Tasman Bay in the heart of the Nelson Wine region on the South Island of New Zealand. This region and especially the Kina Peninsula where The Waters is located, is lucky to receive on average the most sunshine hours of the South Island and is called the ‚Provence of the Southern Hemisphere’. Vineyards and olive groves like the one at The Waters are conveying a mediterranean feeling. The Suites are slightly elevated and only a few meters from the beach, which guarantees fantastic views of the Abel Tasman National Park – easily accessed for hiking or more adventurous trips. Boutique Suites ARIA* ORIWA MOANA TAHUNA The three Suites ARIA*, ORIWA and MOANA Each of our three 40m2 Suites feature the same level of comfort and furnishings. Entertainment is top notch too, with a flat-screen TV and DVD, as well as an MP3 player system. Super King sized beds ensure your nights sleep is deep and restful. Double glazed windows and well insulated walls ensure your privacy and warmth. Two terraces, one with beautiful sea view and one facing Mount Arthur Mountain Range, cantilevered over a pond, are appointed with a table and two chairs each. *Disabled accessible The Suite TAHUNA is the one offering both, a bathtub and a shower. The view towards Abel Tasman National Park is just amazing. Airconditioning & Reverse Heating in all Suites, bathrobes & all natural toiletries supplied. Our Suites have been individually decorated and have their own style and charm. We have added lots of luxurious extras to make our guests feel at home and ensure they enjoy their stay. More information ⟶ AUMOANA Beach Bach Your small celebrations venue or day use playroom at the beach More information ⟶ The Beach Bach Wheter if you plan a romantic day, a family BBQ at the beach, an intimate wedding or anniversary celebration - this is the place to be! For a minute there I lost myself... AUMOANA Your Personal Service We make your stay unique With a manager’s residence on-site, you’re never far from a friendly helpful “KIWI” face. We are happy to recommend tours, excursions, suggest itineraries, and generally share our local knowledge. Customized Adventures Inquire about customized tours, pick-up service and a private boat tour with your host. We can cook for you delicious local fare - please book ahead of time. Darren, USA      Tripadvisor "Rob and his daughter Luna were the nicest hosts. We met his youngest daughter Willow and their puppy as well. Luna brought us a breakfast plate each evening that was delicious. Fresh eggs, juice, bread and cheeses. Local beer in the refrigerator when we returned from the day’s adventures. Very special people indeed. The views from our unit were incredible. The Tasman Sea to the east and a beautiful pond out our bedroom balcony. Top notch B&B Highly recommend. Great way to end our kiwi journey." Nikki, NZ      Tripadvisor "The Waters" was a perfect getaway retreat for a weekend away. Very private, clean, modern and self contained apartment in a great location to explore beautiful Nelson! The homemade breakfast was delicious with lovely fresh local produce. We definately plan to return one day! Savage      Tripadvisor A fantastic place to stay, a great place to relax. The hosts were great. We saw dolphins in the ocean right outside our room, which was very special. We can only recommend it. Cookie-Zustimmung verwalten The safety of your data is important to us. name: Tandoor Indian Restaurant
homepage_content: The Tandoor Indian Restaurant | Authentic Indian Cuisine in Queen Street, Auckland CBD | Order Online About Us The Tandoor Indian Restaurant nestled in the heart of Auckland's CBD at 5/205 Queen Street, offers an authentic culinary journey through the flavors of India. From the moment you step in, you're enveloped in a warm ambiance, adorned with traditional Indian decor and soothing music that sets the stage for a memorable dining experience. Renowned for its exquisite blend of spices and vibrant dishes, The Tandoor promises to tantalize your taste buds with an extensive menu featuring classic Indian delicacies. Whether you're craving creamy butter chicken, tender tandoori meats, or flavorful vegetarian options like paneer tikka, there's something to delight every palate. The skilled chefs at The Tandoor pride themselves on using only the freshest ingredients, sourced locally whenever possible, to craft dishes that capture the essence of Indian cuisine. Each bite is a burst of aromatic spices and rich flavors, transporting you to the bustling streets of India. The restaurant's attentive staff ensures impeccable service, guiding you through the menu and catering to any dietary preferences or restrictions. Whether you're dining solo, enjoying a romantic evening, or hosting a special event, The Tandoor provides a welcoming setting for all occasions. With its convenient location and reputation for excellence, The Tandoor Indian Restaurant is a must-visit destination for food enthusiasts seeking an authentic taste of India in the heart of Auckland. name: Afghan Darbar Restaurant & Takeaway
homepage_content: Afghan Darbar Restaurant & Takeaway Facebook Twitter Dribbble Instagram +1-800-456-478-23 info@email.com Beginnings in Afghanistan Roots in Afghan Tradition . In the heart of Afghanistan, Wajeeha Akbaryan discovered the love for cooking, inspired by the nation’s vibrant culinary heritage. Blending Persian, Central Asian, and South Asian influences, dishes like Kabuli Pulao became the foundation of her journey. More About Us Crafted with Love, Served with Passion Serving delicious blends & bold experiences . Fresh Ingredients, Bold Flavors Fast & Hot Delivery Customizable for Every Craving Delicious Afghani Foods Fresh Ingredients, Bold Flavors Fast & Hot Delivery Customizable for Every Craving Delicious Afghani Foods Our Journey Discover the story behind our restaurant. Beginnings in Afghanistan Roots in Afghan Tradition In the heart of Afghanistan, Wajeeha Akbaryan discovered the love for cooking, inspired by the nation’s vibrant culinary heritage. Blending Persian, Central Asian, and South Asian influences, dishes like Kabuli Pulao became the foundation of her journey. A Journey of Hope and Perseverance The Refugee Experience Forced to leave their homeland, Wajeeha and her family embarked on a journey of resilience and hope. Facing the challenges of displacement, she found solace in cooking, using it as a way to preserve her culture and bring comfort to her loved ones. This chapter of her life shaped her strength and deepened her passion, laying the groundwork for the dreams she would later realize. Building a New Home New Beginnings in New Zealand Arriving in New Zealand marked a fresh start for her and her son. With determination and a love for cooking, they transformed their passion into a thriving restaurant. Here, they share the flavors of Afghanistan, creating a space where tradition meets community, and every dish tells a story of resilience and new opportunities. A Culinary Haven The Restaurant Today Today, Wajeeha’s restaurant stands as a symbol of hard work and cultural pride. Together with her son, she serves authentic Afghan dishes, blending traditional recipes with a welcoming atmosphere. Each meal reflects their journey, turning the restaurant into a cherished destination for food lovers and a testament to the power of perseverance. Our Story, Your Experience A Culinary Journey That Defines Us Afghan Darbar Palmerston North brings together the unique taste of Afghanistan, Iran and Pakistani Cusine. Admire and feel the warmth of the authentic Afghani atmosphere and design, where you can relax and enjoy the combination of cuisines from all three Countries Welcome To Afghan Darbar Restaurant & Takeaway Our Service Order food online from one of the finest takeaways in town. Here at Afghan Darbar Restaurant & Takeaway in Palmerston North, and are proud to serve the surrounding area. View Our Menu Our Best Here at Afghan Darbar Restaurant & Takeaway, we serve a variety of food such as pizzas, burgers, wraps, biryani and more. View Our Menu Order Online You can find our whole menu on our website, filled with mouth-watering dishes and catering for all kinds of different tastes! name: Angelo's Roast Takeaway - Blockhouse Bay
homepage_content: Angelos Roast Takeaway | Blockhouse Bay | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Angelos Roast Takeaway Australian - Roast - 4.6 278 Blockhouse Bay Rd, Blockhouse Bay, Auckland 0600 × Average Customer Rating 4.6 Good place to come for takeaways but not much to support eating there. Friendly owner, which is always nice. Roast meat was very tasty - generous portion, gravy, vegetables etc If you are eating there you won't get a plate or a knife. Meal will come in plastic container with a wooden fork. There's definitely room for an extra table inside, quite strange no plates or proper cutlery. Wouldn't take much effort to make this a more enjoyable experience for people who want to eat there ... Ray C ~$10/Person We tried the small beef meal, lamb roll, and a fried chicken and potatoes. The food was very yummy although the oil did taste a bit old and the fried food was slightly soggy as it wasn't a busy day. The owners were very friendly :-) Overall still a great place and would return to again if I was in the area Carissa H The owners are very nice and friendly. The portions are pretty generous and the price is reasonable. Their roast taste amazing very well seasoned not too salty or too bland. Highly recommend trying. Big Man Friendly and cheerful couples working hard and dishing out high quality baked pork, lamb and beef western food. Our favourite is the baked pork with crispy pork lards, have been visiting them for pass 3 months. Highly recommend! Aik Bin Wynne Lee I’ve been coming here with my mum since I was a little kid and Angelo’s Roast Blockhouse has never once disappointed, beautifully golden and crispy potatoes, generous portions of the chicken and lamb in the roast meals as well as veges and that beautiful gravy! The rolls (pork) are my absolute favourite! Tonight’s dinner was a large lamb roast meal for hubby, a large chicken roast meal for myself and a small chicken roast meal for my daughter! Hubby said “why would anyone make a roast at home when you can go to this place” I 1000% agree! Talita Bates × × - + ADD 0 ATTENTION × Are you sure you want to place this order for tomorrow? name: Trevinos
homepage_content: Trevinos - Bar and Restaurant Nestled in the heart of Christchurch, filled with mountains of food and lakes of beverages, sits an astounding restaurant with irresistable and fine tasting food, accompanied by an unmatchable atmosphere. Welcome to Trevinos. Home About Us Accommodation Conference Facilities Talk to Us Loyalty Card Reservation Employment Brunch Small Bites, Meso, Breads & Dips, Starters Salads & Siesta Pizzeria & Pasta Mains & House Speciality Desserts Wine List Welcome to Trevinos Restaurant & Bar-Open 7days from 9am to 1am (earlier by arrangement) OPEN EVERYDAY EXCEPT CHRISTMAS DAY! -CHEERS & VINOS @ TREVINOS CHRISTMAS SET MENUS AVALIABLE NOW! Special Occasions & Group Bookings - Trevinos Restaurant & Bar, Riccarton, Christchurch is a perfect venue for special occasions. With a choice of either the restaurant, bar, outdoor garden areas, or our conference/function rooms, we can cater for all your requirements. Gaming lounge and accommodation, Christchurch City Park Motels on site. Try our NEW Menu, Christmas Menu, Winelist, Brunch or Tapas Menu, Set Menus or function catering - Book today. Phone us on (03) 343-5378 Live Music - Friday Nights Trevinos, Riccarton, Christchurch features live music on almost every Friday night of the year. The style is generally contemporary with start times varying according to other events such as rugby on the "Big Screen". Vague As Bros, one of the top live acts in Christchurch is a regular performer at Trevinos and this group should not be missed! Together with Freedom Friday drinks specials for that after work party 5-8pm Live Sports on the BIG SCREEN- Watch all games/Punt in our GAMING room Many and varied sporting events feature on the Big Screen TV situated in the bar. Watch the summer of Cricket here. Winter sees Rugby as no.1 with the mighty Crusaders a crowd favorite and, of course, the All Blacks are guaranteed top support from the patrons too. TAB next door. 17 Gaming machines on site and a TAB over the road Inside & Outside Dining Our inside restaurant seats approx 50 and depending on the situation, some extra dining can be accommodated in the bar area. Summer time sees our outdoor area become a hive of activity Relax around the open fire on those colder days Our bar area features an open gas fire with an Oamaru stone surround . With comfortable lounge seating this is the perfect atmosphere for meeting friends for coffee or a drink. Our outside area features a gas fire, TV and water feature. Seating around tables or bar leaners Conference Facilities for up to 50 People Plus The Conference facility is situated upstairs, away from noise and other distractions. It is popular for both business meetings and social gatherings. Seating can be provided for 50 people but for a social occasion where guests are standing, please contact us to discuss. Projection screen, white boards, internet plus TV are all available. Cnr Riccarton Road & Mona Vale Avenue, Christchurch, New Zealand Phone: 03 343 5378 // Fax: 03 343 6356 // Email: [email protected] // [email protected] © 2007 Trevinos Bar and Restaurant. After 14 years of work in New Zealand as Thai Chef at Thai Restaurant in a lovely small town Te Awamutu. Then we were thinking to start a business for our family. name: Black Cottage Cafe
homepage_content: Black Cottage Cafe – Your cozy corner in Coatesv Close Home Our Story Events & Catering Our Menus Reservations Contact Menu Served with a Modern Twist. From mouthwatering appetizers to decadent desserts, our culinary journey is an exploration of taste, texture, and artistry. Make a Reservation Home About Us Our Menus Events & Catering Contact Facebook Instagram Reservation Facebook Instagram Make a Reservation 09 415 4545 Welcome to Black Cottage Cafe Your Cozy Corner in Coatesville Our Story A Culinary Journey at Black Cottage From the dreams of Sulo and Banu to the fresh inspirations of Rami and Ramnita, Black Cottage Cafe is a legacy of love and culinary excellence. Join us in the heart of Coatesville for a taste of home. Learn More We are the perfect place to come for a special occasion or a casual meal with friends. Gourmet Delights Discover culinary excellence at Black Cottage Cafe, where every dish is a masterpiece, crafted with the freshest local ingredients and a dash of love. Experience dining that delights the senses. View Our Menus Events & Catering Turn your gatherings into memorable events with Black Cottage Cafe's exquisite catering services. From intimate celebrations to grand affairs, we bring the essence of our kitchen to you. Learn More Artisan Coffee Savor the aroma of meticulously brewed AllPress coffee. Our baristas transform every cup into a work of art, inviting you to enjoy moments of tranquility and taste. View Our Menus Experience Black Cottage Dine amidst rustic elegance and modern comfort, where every corner offers a new story and every meal is an invitation to relax and connect. Hear From Our Guests Real Stories, Real Smiles "Great food and great location. This is a local favourite and quite busy most of the weekends. Love the vibe and the outdoor seating. Staff is friendly and helpful. I always go for the big breakfast when ordering." Asiri Dalugoda "Wow!!!! I have just discovered this place, I wish I had known about it sooner..... The pasta was too die for, the fish was too die for, the cakes looked good but was too full. Plus they sell alcohol, so nice place for lunch. Friendly staff. You have to try this place, we'll worth the drive. I'll be back!." Candace Featherstone "This place is an absolute gem, I recommend it to everyone. We have been many times and eaten most meals on the menu with the highlights being the beef Wellington and the Pork noodles. The food is simple but done perfectly every time. The service is always warm, friendly and very attentive. I cannot recommend highly enough. Kid-friendliness: Very kid friendly with a small outdoor playground to keep the littles entertained" Louise Guernsey "Wonderful staff, delicious fresh food. Can't beat the French toast, iced chocolate, or the carrot cake (don't leave without a takeaway of these scrumptiously moist temptations!) Clean and tidy, big covered outdoor area, and even a little outdoor playground for kids." Michelle Page Join Our Community Black Cottage Cafe is more than a cafe; it’s a community. Whether you’re a local or just passing through, you’re always welcome at our table. homepage_content: B&D Restaurant | Mount Eden | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to B&D Restaurant PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to B&D Restaurant Order Online from B&D Restaurant Asian & Chinese Cuisine * 296c Dominion Rd Mount Eden, Auckland 1024 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Tofu Skin with Fresh Chili 尖椒干豆腐 $24.50 Chicken with Fresh Chili 椒香粒粒鸡 $26.50 TOP SELLERS Tofu Skin with Fresh Chili 尖椒干豆腐 $24.50 Chicken with Fresh Chili 椒香粒粒鸡 $26.50 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup Thursday Closed Closed Friday Closed Closed Saturday Closed Closed Sunday Closed Closed Monday Closed Closed Tuesday Closed Closed Wednesday Closed Closed REVIEWS A rest owned by a northern Chinese couple. They are very nice, could not speak mandarin well instead they spoke a dialect. You can still understand them 80%. Food was good, big portion, and most of them are yum. Hi La soup was seasoned with tons of spices and made it undrinkable to me, but other customers seemed fine. It could be personal preference. Price is also reasonable. We will be back for more but not Hu La soup. Hao This Chinese restaurant is underrated. The location is by the shopping centre car-park, so it’s not visibly obvious from the main road. The food (particularly vegetable dishes) is exquisite. I recommend Eggs fried with tomatoes (西红柿炒鸡蛋), it’s a Chinese common dish, but it’s the best that I’ve tasted anywhere. I also recommend eggplant stir fried with beans. Nice atmosphere as well. They also do a typical northern Chinese breakfast in the morning. Johannes Dimyadi Instead of dining at the usual restaurants lining Dominion Rd, recently visited this eatery located in Eden Quarter with a group of friends on a Friday evening. The restaurant is not big, but has a nice ambience, clean and the service was quick and cheerful 😃. Among all the dishes we ordered, our favourites were Chicken with Fresh Chili (粒粒鸡), Lamb with Cumin (孜然羊肉) and in particular Three Brothers (地三鲜, a vegetarian dish with fried potato, eggplant and pepper in a garlicky savory sauce). 地三鲜 is a signature northern Chinese dish & its poetic name is roughly translated to “three treasures from the earth”. It is a very simply, family styled and rusty dish, but ohh man it is soo mouth-wateringly delicious 😋. Di Melody Huang One of the best place for the Chinese breakfast. Their noodles are really good plus good variety options. The price is very reasonable. I will recommend this place for everyone. Vincent H 紐西蘭吃喝玩樂 Vincent in New Zealand Used to have my traditional chinese breakfast here. Took an easy lunch today with my friend. Simply a Northern China family restaurant, demonstrating traditional chinese way of cooking skills and seasonings. Friendly price definitely value for the portion and the money you spend. Whenever I miss my late Dad this is the place to taste a bit of his love. Eric Chou奧克蘭寶哥 PREV NEXT LOCATION × Average Customer Rating 4 A rest owned by a northern Chinese couple. name: Camel Grill
homepage_content: camelgrill Search Search for: camelgrill Exotic Mediterranean tastes… Menu Skip to content About Camel Grill Caravan Catering and Functions Contact us Open Search The birth of our little camel caravan.. Abdalla had been keeping an eye on second hand caravans for a little while, with the idea of creating something for markets and festivals that he could take with him, be able to cook on site and, in doing so, bring his favourite traditional dishes out to the street. Basically, a cafe on wheels. This was the vision! We are now in the fourth week of running the Camel Grill Caravan at a couple of weekend markets: Saturday Underground Market by Frank Kitts Park and Sunday at the farmers market by Waitangi Park, both in Wellington. We have both had some great feedback about how the caravan looks (a couple of private tours!), and it really makes both Abdalla and I think back to the months of hard work. I thought it might be fun to share a bit of our journey… The caravan came to us from Nelson, so after arranging passage on the ferry (Bluebridge were just lovely and easy to deal with) we waited excitedly on the other end to meet it as it drove into Wellington. It was fairly shabby-looking at this point, but Abdalla was keen to get it home and have a look over the frame and jump straight into whatever work was needed. The first big project was fixing the rust in the roof and under the caravan. It was mounted on jacks, wheels removed and Abdalla spend about a week on his back under the caravan sealing and repainting. I remember him coming home covered in paint, scratches and bruises to tell me that he had spent a good twenty minutes pinned under the caravan after one of the jacks was knocked over. He is a pretty resiliant Egyptian and used to the odd work injury in his profession, but really this is something a partner never really wants to hear! The entire roof was eventually replaced as the rust was beyond repair, and once this was done Abdalla started the long process of stripping out the interior. The interesting and exciting part was planning exactly how he wanted the inside of the caravan to function. We both spent a lot of time on TradeMe looking for parts and equipment (hanging in until the end of some fairly tense auctions!) that would eventually be installed. Anyone who has had experience with caravans will know that space is at a premium, and Abdalla had to plan pretty carefully how everything would fit… pretty cozy! Painting the exterior was one of the fun jobs. As an artist, I finally felt like I could really flex my painting muscle to help Abdalla bring the Camel Grill to life. We spent a long weekend priming and then spray painting a desert scene onto all four sides of the caravan. We were both so happy with the final result, even though I had completely lost the feeling in the tip of my index finger from the spray can. And finally from the middle of February until the end of July, after building, painting, wiring, plumbing, many broken drill bits and grinder injuries… and a certainly a few new skills that Abdalla picked up along the way… here we are! We would love you to come past and visit us if you are at the market… and maybe even offer a peek inside if you are interested! Shukran! August 16, 2015 0 Welcome to the Camel Grill Hello! The Camel Grill is a company set up by Abdalla Tammam to share his skills as a chef. We would love to take the chance to welcome you to our website and blog… and into our kitchen. Outside of running the business, we love to share time messing around in our kitchen at home (mainly me watching and playing Sous-Chef as Abdalla comes up with new ideas), and sharing food with family and friends. Abdalla is also available to cater functions, take cooking lesson at home, and visit markets and festivals with the Camel Grill caravan. There is a link in the menu above to contact details if you are interested to find out more! Shukran and enjoy!! July 15, 2015 0 Search for: Recent Posts The birth of our little camel caravan.. homepage_content: Topor Restaurant – Toporsown Are You Over 18? This Website requires you to be 18 years or older to enter. Yes I am No I am not Topor Awards Wellington's favourite Polish restaurant! We can match vodka to compliment your dishes, with an extended list of Polish vodkas, as well as imported Polish, Russian, Czech, Dutch and Italian beers. Check out our features board every week for new Polish and Kiwi specials. We can tailor a menu for your needs if you call ahead with any special requirements! Look forward to seeing you soon. At Topor Bistro we know good food and great wine are best served with a large helping of atmosphere, which is why you won’t soon forget your evening at New Zealand’s only Polish restaurant. We specialise in making your night unforgettable, so come in and find out why Topor Bistro is the first restaurant Wellington calls when they want to a perfect night out.Our chef serves up only the best and freshest modern Polish fusion dishes and our staff makes sure it reaches you in style. name: McDonald's New Lynn
homepage_content: Careers Home Join Our Crew at Maccas® I'm Looking For Positions Near Use your location Use your location Search Scroll to explore. Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Meet Olivia, McDonald's Virtual Recruiting Assistant . Olivia can help you search for a job and answer questions along the way. Once you’ve found a position, Olivia will walk you through the application process too! It takes just a few minutes and if qualified, some restaurants can also schedule your interview at the same time. Start Your Search Freedom to earn and learn Freedom to fit work around your life Freedom to be you pause Our jobs work for you, and that’s our people promise . At Maccas®, we attract people who love to create and serve seriously great food, possess an infectious attitude, provide world-class customer service , and most importantly, like to have fun while they’re working! Whether it is building skills for life or giving you flexibility to fit in with your lifestyle, we create jobs that work for you. Maccas® is always looking for motivated, passionate people who prioritize health and safety as much as we do, so apply now to join the Macca’s family. Working at Macca’s We love nothing more than watching our employees grow. Did you know that a lot of our most successful Managers started their careers as Crew Members? You can do it too, and the best part is you get to earn while you learn! If you've got the appetite to succeed, we’ll give you the opportunity. Join our Crew Crew Member (including McCafe Barista) Crew provide an exceptional customer experience which includes delivering exceptional quality, service and cleanliness (QSC) to all guests. We understand that everyone should be able to work with their strengths, and at Macca’s®, we like to provide you with the opportunity to earn your money the way you want! So whether you like putting a smile on people’s dial, building custom-made burgers, or making a mean cappuccino, we have a role that will work for you! Crew are trained and verified to work in the Front Counter, Customer Areas, Kitchen, Drive-Thru or McCafe areas of the restaurant. Search Crew Member (including McCafe Barista) Jobs Maintenance Person If you like working with your hands and looking after all the internal and external areas of the restaurant, the maintenance role is for you. You need to be organised, have a keen eye for cleanliness as you will be responsible for janitorial duties, cleaning restaurant equipment, minor handyman responsibilities and maintaining the restaurant surrounds. Search Maintenance Jobs Crew Trainer Crew have the opportunity to develop and progress into the Crew Trainer position. The Crew Trainer provides guidance and direction to fellow Crew and utilises all policies and procedures to provide the best quality coaching, to ensure outstanding delivery of QSC, under the supervision of the Shift Supervisor. Search Crew Trainer Jobs Shift Manager The first step in the McDonald’s management journey is to become a Shift Manager. Shift Managers are operations experts and run shifts delivering outstanding QSC at all times. Shift Managers supervise employees to ensure restaurant operations and procedures are adhered to and ensure the delivery of an exceptional and memorable Macca’s® experience. Department Manager In addition to delivering outstanding QSC every shift, Department Managers and Assistant Restaurant Managers have an additional responsibility of leading a team as either a Customer Experience, People Performance or Product Quality Manager. Restaurant Manager The Restaurant Manager is the leader of the restaurant, and is responsible for the overall profitability, sales, people development and operations of the restaurant. The Restaurant Manager works closely with their management team to coordinate the functions and systems that are critical to business success. Working at the golden arches Benefits and Perks Wellbeing Program We promote the ‘5 Ways of Wellbeing’ in our restaurants as we recognize employee safety is a key priority. Discounts at Major Retailers Our MyBenefits program gives all employees product discounts from over 50 retailers. Training Check out the Training tab for more information on how you can learn and earn. Performance Reviews We have a culture of continuous improvement, so feedback is critical and staying in touch with your Manager is key. Flexible Scheduling We create opportunities for all employees to work flexibly in a way that is meaningful and fits into your lifestyle. Rewards and Recognition We appreciate our people and have a range of rewards to showcase employees. Discounted Meals Enjoy a half price Macca’s meal subject to the Crew Meal Policy. Learning and Development You have the opportunity to grow and progress by learning transferable work and life skills. Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Free for all McDonald's employees to access professional and confidential counseling service. We promote the ‘5 Ways of Wellbeing’ in our restaurants as we recognise employee safety is a key priority. Our MyBenefits program gives all employees product discounts from over 50 retailers. Check out the Training tab for more information on how you can learn and earn. We have a culture of continuous improvement, so feedback is critical and staying in touch with your Manager is key. We create opportunities for all employees to work flexibly in a way that is meaningful and fits into your lifestyle. We appreciate our people and have a range of rewards to showcase employees. Enjoy a half price Macca’s meal subject to the Crew Meal Policy. You have the opportunity to grow and progress by learning transferable work and life skills. Free for all McDonald's employees to access professional and confidential counseling service. Your Safety At McDonald’s the safety and wellbeing of our people, customers and the food and drink we serve is our highest priority. Each McDonald’s restaurant follows strict cleaning, sanitation and hygiene procedures that meet or exceed the rigorous requirements outlined in the Food Standards Code. We are committed to protecting the safety of our people and customers through our hygiene and cleanliness standards, social distancing practices and convenience of contact-free service and delivery. Additionally, we have implemented a range of communication methods to keep employees up to date with the latest guidance and advice. You can have confidence that your wellbeing and safety comes first when you join the Macca’s family. Our People Our people are our greatest asset and since we opened our first restaurant, we’ve had the privilege of providing a job full of opportunities to thousands of people. We believe in equipping those who work with us, with technical and soft skills that give them the foundations to forge a career within McDonald’s and beyond. We create opportunities for all employees to work flexibly in a way that is meaningful and fulfilling for them, whilst recognising and valuing our people in an enjoyable, energising environment. Search Jobs Now Our Restaurants There are over 170 restaurants in New Zealand so there are some things that will be different from restaurant to restaurant. Some of our restaurants are owned and operated by local Licensees, whilst others are operated by McDonald’s New Zealand.

name: Anas Indian Kitchen
homepage_content: Ana's Indian Kitchen Entree Mains Contact Us Ana's Indian Kitchen | Papatoetoe Welcome to our restaurant! We specialize in serving a variety of delicious dishes that will satisfy your cravings. To start your meal, we offer a range of mouth-watering appetisers, Combo, Mains, and Biryani. Our signature paranthey, which is a type of Indian flatbread, is a must-try. We have a variety of options, including, paneer parantha, and aloo parantha, all of which are cooked to perfection. For the main course We offer a diverse range of dishes that cater to different tastes and preferences. Whether you're in the mood for something spicy or something milder, vegetarian or non-vegetarian, we have got you covered. Some of our popular mains include chicken tikka masala, lamb rogan josh, and vegetable biryani. Last but not least, we have our chef's specials that are unique to our restaurant. These dishes are carefully curated by our talented chefs and feature a combination of exotic spices and flavors. Some of our chef's specials include tandoori salmon, prawn masala, and mushroom risotto. We hope you enjoy your dining experience with us and leave with a satisfied palate. homepage_content: Verdura Dunedin | Order for Mediterranean food and browse menu online - Order Meal About Us Middleterrean:-Savor the Fusion: Where the Middle East Meets Mediterranean At Verdura, we invite you to embark on a culinary journey where two worlds collide in flavour! Our innovative fusion of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean cuisines redefines dining, promising an unforgettable experience for your taste buds. Indulge in our signature dishes, meticulously crafted with care and passion, blending the best flavours from Iran, Kuwait, Greece, Turkey, Cyprus, and the Levant. From mouthwatering kebabs to sumptuous mezes, our menu offers a tantalizing selection that will delight even the most discerning palate. In the heart of Dunedin Central, Verdura provides the perfect ambience for gatherings with family and friends. Enjoy the finest and freshest New Zealand ingredients, paired with delicious cocktails and mocktails, as you relax in our spacious and inviting Middle Eastern-inspired interiors. Step into Verdura and experience our 'Middleterrean' promise firsthand, where every bite takes you on a journey to the vibrant streets of the Middle East. Elevate your dining experience to new heights and savor the essence of Middleterranean cuisine with us. Join us at Verdura and discover the harmonious fusion of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean flavours. Your culinary adventure awaits!
