name: Hongs Kitchen
homepage_content: Hongs Kitchen (Massey) | Massey | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Hongs Kitchen (Massey) PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Hongs Kitchen (Massey) Order Online from Hongs Kitchen (Massey) Asian & Chinese Cuisine * Westgate Shopping Centre Shop 7 Corner Fernhill Drive &, Fred Taylor Drive Massey, Auckland 0614 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Crispy Roasted Duck 明炉烧鸭 $31.80 Crispy Roasted Pork 脆皮烧肉 $29.50 TOP SELLERS Crispy Roasted Duck 明炉烧鸭 $31.80 Crispy Roasted Pork 脆皮烧肉 $29.50 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup Thursday Closed 11am to 9:30pm Friday Closed 11am to 9:30pm Saturday Closed 11am to 9:30pm Sunday Closed 11am to 9:30pm Monday Closed 11am to 9:30pm Tuesday Closed 11am to 9:30pm Wednesday Closed 11am to 9:30pm REVIEWS Great food, great friendly service, highly recommend. Had the crispy pork and the spicy sizzling chicken. The crispy pork was juicy and crispy, perfect. The spicy sizzling chicken was well balanced, tender and tasty. We met Hong (his kitchen), he will tailor the food to your spiciness. You also get a free/complementary pot of green tea. Try Hong’s Kitchen, you will not be disappointed. B R Great food and exceptional service. The crispy pork was tender and crispy. The sizzling spicy chicken was really delicious, it could have been spicier and also too much onion in it. The taste was delicious though. This restaurant in on the expensive side but the portions were really generous. We would definitely go back again to try the rest of the menu. The service was really really good 👌 E R Friends brought us here while we were staying with them nearby, and wow it was great! The Peking Duck is so good, and such a big serve for the price!! And we got some of the crispy pork belly as well, only a "small" serve and it was till really big...between 4 of us we couldn't eat it all and took some home! Such a reasonable price for the size of the serves, I would come here again happily! Genevieve Martin Lunch menu starts from $22 per dish. A little pricey but understandable as they serve complimentary Chinese tea and soup and the portions were huge! One dish can actually feed two people but we wanted to try both the roast duck and roast pork. Roast duck was delicious and duck oil coated the rice, making every bite a delight. Roast pork was tender yet had a wonderful crunchy skin. Admittedly, towards the end, it got a bit cloying as it was quite rich but the Chinese tea helped in refreshing our palates. Unexpectedly the restaurant is bigger on the inside and looks like any typical Chinese restaurant. Service was fast (don't blink) - received our food within 15 minutes. Staff were pretty welcoming upon our entry into the restaurant and assisted promptly when we needed anything but otherwise left us to our meal, which we appreciated. They also sell various ingredients at the cashier - chilli oil, peanuts, salted fish, duck wings, duck feet etc. May need a translation tool though. A whole roast duck for takeaway is $50 and they very kindly entertained my request to have the bones separated. Would happily recommend and return. Lena Leong Been coming here for the last 5 years with my family, amazing Chinese food and staff. We always get the roast duck, wat dan beef and vege on rice noodle (滑蛋牛河), yanzhou fried rice, and garlic bok choy. They also serve you tea and a complimentary soup depending on availability and number of people at your table. Every single time the food was great, every time the owner recognized us and chatted happily. It's more on the expensive side, but that's what parents are for. (haha) Addressing some of the 1 star reviews, I see where most of them are coming from. The restaurant staff seeming "rude" or "impolite" are really just not used to smiling all the time. This may come off as bad service but it's really a matter of cultural differences. Many of the reviews were left over a year ago, sometimes even 5-10 years ago; I assure you that the restaurant, probably having read through all the reviews, has improved drastically. The owners are more than happy to discuss refunds or remake the food if something isn't to your liking. Curry Masala Indian Takeaway Located at 144 Chapel Road, Flat Bush, Auckland 2019, Curry Masala Indian Takeaway brings the vibrant flavors of India straight to your plate. Known for its authentic and diverse menu, this local gem offers a wide variety of dishes that cater to every palate, whether you crave something mild and aromatic or bold and spicy. From tender butter chicken and creamy korma to the fiery vindaloo and rich biryanis, every dish is expertly crafted using traditional Indian spices and fresh ingredients. At Curry Masala, each meal is prepared with care to ensure an unforgettable culinary experience. They offer convenient takeaway options, perfect for those on the go or anyone looking to enjoy restaurant-quality Indian cuisine from the comfort of their home. The generous portions and affordable prices make it an excellent choice for families and individuals alike. With friendly service and a focus on quality, Curry Masala Indian Takeaway has become a favorite in the Flat Bush community. Whether you're in the mood for a hearty curry, flavorful naan bread, or delicious vegetarian options, this takeaway delivers a true taste of India, making every meal an enjoyable experience. name: Han restaurant
homepage_content: Best Korean Food Restaurant in Auckland City | Asian Fusion Restaurant | Han [email protected] 09-377 0977 HOME ABOUT MENU BEVERAGE GALLERY RESERVATIONS VOUCHERS CONTACT Shape Created with Sketch. HAN Restaurant will be closed for holidays from the 1st until the 20th of January. We wish you all a happy New Year and we will see you back on the 21st of January when we reopen with our normal operating hours. The team @HAN Han Recommended Restaurant Guru 2019 MODERN KOREAN CUISINE Best Korean Restaurant In Auckland Central If you ask local people about their favourite Korean restaurants in Auckland central, Han Modern Korean regularly comes out top of the list. There is good reason for this too, as we are regarded as being not only the best Korean restaurant in Auckland City, but also one of the best restaurants. What can you expect when you come to Han Modern Korean? You can expect a unique Asian Fusion dining experience with new as well as traditional dishes prepared by our expert chef and his hard-working team. All our dishes are made with locally sourced ingredients in addition to some specialist Korean items that can’t be found locally. Also, you will find our menu changes with the season. This keeps the dining experience fresh, plus it ensures we use the best quality, in-season ingredients in the dishes on our menu. If you love Korean food, or you want to try something different, you will love what we have to offer at Han Modern Korean. You will also love the modern Korean dining experience and the relaxed and comfortable dining environment too. Plus, we cater for all dietary requirements including allergies, dietary preferences, gluten free diets, etc. So, book your table for lunch or dinner today. Top Asian Fusion Restaurant in Auckland Han Modern Korean is a leading Asian fusion restaurant in Auckland. Not only do we serve the best Korean food in Auckland, we also have dishes on our menu that combine traditional Korean flavours with French cooking techniques. This produces Korean food with a western twist. It’s an experience you won’t forget, but you will want to come back for more. Book your next visit to Han Modern Korean today. Explore Tastes of Korean Food with Western Flavours Asian Fusion restaurants are popular in Auckland and in many other cities around the world. At Han Modern Korean, we are proud of our reputation as being one of the best Asian Fusion restaurants in Auckland City. Even if you are familiar with Korean food, you will experience something new when you dine with us. Expect a fusion of Korean ingredients and unique flavours with both Korean and French/European cooking techniques. There is something for everyone on our menu too, whether you prefer food options that are more traditional, or you want to be adventurous. Why not book your table today? We’d love to have you dine with us. Copyright © 2020 - dashboard POWERED BY ROCKETSPARK Shape Created with Sketch. HOME ABOUT MENU BEVERAGE GALLERY RESERVATIONS VOUCHERS CONTACT Loading...

Aroha Shepherd A good place to eat. The food is overall good and just as good as some of the other food places around that area. The chicken and roast pork is deliciously good. name: K C Cafe & Takeaway
homepage_content: KC Cafe And Takeaway | Te Aro | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ KC Cafe And Takeaway Asian - Chinese - 4.5 39a Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011 × Average Customer Rating 4.5 The stir-fried beef ho fun was incredibly fresh and flavorful — definitely a highlight of the meal. The fried chicken wings were a bit on the salty side for my taste, but still crispy and well-cooked. Overall, a very enjoyable dining experience. Highly recommended! 👍 Wu Simon KC has been around for a very long time and rarely closes. Their food is always consistent and they serve up till quite late in the night. Menu is extensive and you’ll often end up wanting to replace your initial choice as there’s too many to choose from! My favourite is the black pepper pork chop and deep fried squid (which you need to eat while it’s hot). The place is often packed so be ready to do takeaways or hang around till one is available. Toilets are at the back however do be careful as the floor might be a tad slippery. Eugene T This place is an institution. Huge menu but doesn't compromise on quality. Had a short wait for a table at 9pm on a weeknight but its always worth the wait. If there are better spring rolls in Wellington I haven’t had them. Luke Dienes Delicous chinese foods. They can cook 160 different dishes with only 2 chefs. Caters many customers. Many takeaways also. Their dishes are not so expensive. Joselyn Lim I can see why this place is a well-loved institution! Ordered our BBQ pork and rice and mi goreng and the food came out lightning-fast and tasted fantastic. Great value too. The amount of menu items is incredible - they really should make a t-shirt with the menu on it as a souvenir R Tran (River) × × - + ADD 0 ATTENTION × Are you sure you want to place this order for tomorrow? name: Thai Street Food
homepage_content: Krungthep Thai Street Food Skip to content Good food start here Celebrating 10 years of serving up authentic Thai flavors & warm hospitality Order Now Reservation AUTHENTIC THAI STREET FOOD FROM BANGKOK TO NEW ZEALAND Krungthep Thai Street Food was starting in March 2015 The idea of starting a small authentic Thai street food by one of the partner who born and rised up in Krung Thep where he can eat a varieties and tasty Thai food every day, so why not we just start our own kitchen then we can cook and enjoy the food we normally eat every day in Thailand. ABOUT US NEWS & SPECIAL Party, Special evening? Christchurch, Auckland or Ashburton? Our kitchens now offer catering services and group bookings for your special occasions. Find your nearest branch and get in touch with us to plan your event. Happy Hour Alert! Enjoy 10% OFF on drinks with a meal purchase at our Colombo branch: Monday to Thursday: 5 pm – close Sunday: 5 pm – close Don’t miss out! Visit us today!” Tuesday Special K’ Rd. Gather ‘Round! Our trendy restaurant in central Auckland is the perfect spot for any gathering, big or small! Join us every Tuesday for a special treat. Book your table by call us 09 3796902 Summer Delight! Indulge in our refreshing summer treat at Ashburton Branch! Freshly baked orange cake paired with your choice of ice cream. Visit us today and soak up the sweetness of summer! Create your special moments with friends and family Order Now Reservation Karangahape Road, Auckland 2015 This is where our adventure began - with a Thai (born and bred in Bangkok) and Kiwi couple. We started small, delivering top service, friendly hospitality and exceptional food in fascinating K Road. We rapidly became a well-known in the area for providing quality and reasonably priced authentic Thai food. Our chef Patty provides diners and takeaways her original recipes and we have enjoyed immense local support for 10 years now. ABOUT US Scroll to Top

name: Kilbirnie Fish & Chips
homepage_content: Kilbirnie Fish & Chips | Kilbirnie | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Kilbirnie Fish & Chips PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Kilbirnie Fish & Chips Order Online from Kilbirnie Fish & Chips Fish & Chips * 41 Coutts St Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Chips $6.50 Fish (Blue Warehou) $6.40 TOP SELLERS Chips $6.50 Fish (Blue Warehou) $6.40 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup Thursday Closed 11am to 9pm Friday Closed 11am to 5pm Saturday Closed 11am to 9pm Sunday Closed 11am to 9pm Monday Closed Closed Tuesday Closed 11am to 9pm Wednesday Closed 11am to 9pm REVIEWS The guy working at the time was the nicest person ever, first he gave us a discount as we only had 30 dollars then proceeded to ask if we would like 4 free drinks and then after we had gotten our order we checked and he had given us a free donut! after saying that they were out of them!! love this place and will be forever the best fish and chip shop in Wellington Reilly Grealish-Bridge First time being here, reminds us of old school Fish n Chips. Really big fish, spring roll we think was handmade, everything we had was delicious. Next time we back in Welly, we will visit! Rippleeffectnz Headed out to Kilbirnie tonight to try the offerings from the Kilbirnie Fish & Chips shop. Meal: Fish & Chips and a Hotdog. Total: :$16.50 Fish (Warehou) was thick and tasty. Though generally fibrous, it flaked in chunks as expected. The batter felt a little underdone beneath but the crunch was solid with a golden brown hue. Delicious! Chips. As mentioned before these Chinese takeaways have a knack for dishing up a delicious chip! Large crinkle cut (my fav) chips with that boarder line crunch and pillowy centre. Portion size was very good. I love a good hotdog in batter. The classic saveloy deep fried in a decent batter. This one ticked the box! Mark Panapa Nice fish and chips. Big serving of crispy chips. Batter on fish is abit thick. A fish, chips with chicken salt is $10. Elroy Okada Generally bigger fish than many other shops with homemade chunky chips. This adds to the experience of what fish and chip shops used to be. name: Mama San Nelson
homepage_content: Thai and Vietnamese Restaurant Nelson - Mama San Thai & Vietnamese Cuisine An instant favourite in the Top of the South Open 7 days for Dine in and Takeaway from 5.00pm to 8.30pm at 112 Collingwood Street . Phone us on 03 545 6226 A menu from the street We were inspired by authentic street vendors from Thailand and Vietnam - this is food that is prepared fast and fresh, designed to satisfy immediately with the unmistakeable flavour mix of hot, sour, sweet and salty. Our Street Vendor menu offers so many dishes at great prices it can be hard to stop. Chaing Mai Pork Belly, Shanghai Dumpling With Panang Curry Sauce, Mongolian Fish Rotiâ¦the list goes on. For more substantial plates our Glamorous range includes Vietnamese Pancake Banh Xeo, Kungpao Chicken, Cambodian Peppercorn Prawns (prawns, lemongrass, fresh basil, garlic, green pepper, baby corn and bamboo shoots) along with classics like Nasi Goreng and our perennial favourite- the Indonesian Beef Rendang. The Casual, Stylish Ambience Mama San has been designed with contemporary comfort in mind - plenty of room for dining, with tons of colour and textures from the East. A Great Spot for Groups Mama San welcomes groups. Our menu is designed to satisfy even the most demanding palates (kids and adults alike). We do recommend booking online at least a day before - our restaurant is very popular with locals and visitors. Takeaway and Online Ordering You can order any item from our main menu for takeaway- either for pick up or delivery. We recommend allowing at least 30mins for your order to be finished as we cook fresh! Our Growing Family Weâve just keep growing! Visit us in any of these locations for fresh South East Asian flavours, always with a little twist of their own; Thai (Nelson, Christchurch, Dunedin), Mama San (Christchurch,Nelson, Invercargill), Commi (Christchurch), Le Xom Indochina Vietnamese Street Cuisine (Christchurch), Spirithouse (Dunedin, Wellington), Hoi An House(Christchurch), Buddha Stix (Dunedin, Wellington), Hutong Asian Street Food(Dunedin). name: Indian 2nite
homepage_content: Indian2nite Indian Restaurant Palmerston North | Palmerston North Indian Restaurant and Takeaway Entree Mains Book Now Contact Us Indian2nite Indian Restaurant Dinein & Takeaway Palmerston North Indian2nite is an authentic north Indian restaurant in Palmerston North located in George Street with fantastic dine in or takeaway menu options. Fancy Indian tonight? When it comes to this particular eatery, we always know the answer.Serving up a roaring selection of Indian classics and authentic eats, Indian2Nite is out to impress. Immense tiger portraits patrol the walls, placing you in the heart of India's vast wilderness whilst an orange glow pervades the entire establishment with familiar warmth. Perfect for a special occasion or just a chilled supper, tonight's plans are sorted. The menu itself is extensive with something for every craving. Seafood fanatics are treated to the likes of butter prawn, fish masala and seafood masala whilst meat-lovers can indulge in any of their aromatic chicken, lamb or beef curries. Go West with the Punjabi chicken, opt for the royal treatment with the lamb saagwala or head south for the beef madras. Vegetarians are treated to nourishing daals, creamy paneer concoctions and the hearty Malai kofta which will undoubtedly put you in a cosy food coma. Pair your choice with the Indian2Nite special naan; it's stuffed with fruits and nuts for that irresistible crunch and squidge. A truly unique bread, you definitely won't find it elsewhere. We can't wait for tonight's plans. We offer home delivery and takeaway service Order Takeaway Online Order Online Now BOOK A TABLE Contact Phone: 06-353 7400 Address: 22 George Street, Palmerston North 4410 Opening Hours Monday : 4:30â9:30pm Monday - Sunday : 11:00amâ2pm, 5:00â10:00pm Order Online Now

You order from a menu by selecting what you want to order and hand over the form to the wait staff. The food came out fairly quickly and the portions are quite big compared to other places. Overall, not bad William Lin I visited Mandarin Palace Seafood Restaurant recently and tried only their dim sum, and I must say it was delicious. The variety was impressive, with all the dim sum staples like har gow, siu mai, BBQ pork buns, and cheung fun freshly prepared and served steaming hot. Service was efficient, and the food came out quite quickly even though it was fairly busy. Prices were reasonable for the quality and portion sizes. Overall, it was a satisfying dim sum experience. I can’t comment on the seafood/main dishes yet, but I’ll definitely return to try more. Caryna Chan Haven't been back 20 years. Mandarin Palace still the same. Food is amazing delicious. Good yumcha. Come in and spend a memorable day with family and friends at Murrayfield Beautiful views and great homemade cafe food During your visit or function you are able to get quality homecooked food at the rural Scenic Cafe. name: Kohinoor Indian Restaurant Henderson
homepage_content: Kohinoor Indian Restaurant Henderson | Indian Restaurant & Takeaway West Auckland | Order Online for Home Delivery and Takeaway Curry Combo $15 Sun to Thur(Veg and Chicken) Takeaway Only Call Us on (09) 838 3991 Kohinoor Indian Restaurant Henderson | Dine-In & Takeaway West Auckland It is our pleasure to welcome you at Kohinoor Indian restaurant t in Henderson. While you have given us opportunity to serve Traditional Indian Cuisine, we would make sure that you enjoy the delicious food along with the high quality of service. We have chosen the name Kohinoor for our restaurant as it is named after a symbolic diamond which has travelled from India to England, as has the famous Butter chicken from Delhi to London. And from there on it has grown to become one of the most popular Indian Curry. Well at Kohinoor Indian Restaurant we try our best to give you a choice of popular Indian dishes as well as traditional ones. Please talk to our staff if you need information about any dish you are keen on. Indian Cuisine is a blend of different regions of the country. While North Indians Prefer eat to mild to medium curries, South Indian like their curries HOT. At Kohinoor our Chefs make sure that you get your desired taste as we can cook all our Mains to suit your taste. FOOD ALLERGY NOTICE: Please be advised that food prepared here may contain these ingredients- Milk, Eggs, Wheat, Soybean, Peanuts, Tree nuts, Fish & Shellfish OUR MENU BOOK A TABLE Contact Phone: 09-838 3991 Address: 1/264 Swanson Rd, Henderson, Auckland 0610 Opening Hours Monday - Friday: 11:30amâ2:30pm,5:00pmâ10:00pm Saturday - Sunday: 5:00pmâ10:00pm Â

We went to a couple of restaurants that were pricey and we ended up in the area where Moto is. We haven’t eaten here yet, so we decided to give it a try 👍 We sat at this slightly private area, ordered beef yakiniku, salmon sashimi, and dynamite roll and everything was SO GOOD 🤩 even the side salads were 👌 Food was served quick as well which is fab because we were so hungry and ate everything in minutes 😆 Highly recommended and will definitely be back! 💕 Flavour & Footprints Amazing ambience, extremely friendly staff, and delicious food! Highly recommend their meal sets! Aki 1/ A very enjoyable dinner for two. Highly recommended. 2/ Return visit, steady patronage for a Friday night, another enjoyable dinner for two, picture tells it all. cee doubleyou Truly delicious coffee! Also really friendly staff and a nice buzzing atmosphere. It was clear many of the customers were regulars which so testament to the quality and service. homepage_content: Mr Zhous Dumplings (New Lynn) | New Lynn | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Mr Zhous Dumplings (New Lynn) PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Mr Zhous Dumplings (New Lynn) Order Online from Mr Zhous Dumplings (New Lynn) Asian & Chinese Cuisine * 3130 Great North Rd New Lynn, Auckland 0600 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Pork Mince, Chives & Prawn Dumplings 三鲜肉 $12.70 Pork Mince & Chives Dumplings 猪肉韭菜馅 $11.60 TOP SELLERS Pork Mince, Chives & Prawn Dumplings 三鲜肉 $12.70 Pork Mince & Chives Dumplings 猪肉韭菜馅 $11.60 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup Thursday Closed 11:30am to 10pm Friday Closed 11:30am to 10pm Saturday Closed 11:30am to 10pm Sunday Closed 11:30am to 10pm Monday Closed 5pm to 11pm Tuesday Closed 11:30am to 10pm Wednesday Closed 11:30am to 10pm REVIEWS This is my absolute favourite Chinese restaurant in Auckland. ( Kinda say my top 1)💖 I always come here with my sisters, and the food is always amazing. Whether you’re vegetarian or a meat lover, there’s something for everyone. I usually order the same dishes because I love them so much. fried vegetarian dumplings, sliced cucumber salad with tofu, and vegetarian noodles in soup is one of my favourite ever.🤤 Believe me the staff are super friendly, I like it.💖The chef is such a kind person he even makes the Dragon 🐉 one, which is incredible😻.I appreciate it🫶🏼everything tastes so good honestly. I really appreciate their hard work. If I could give more than 5 stars, I definitely would. You won’t be disappointed if you try this place. I’ll keep coming back with my sister’s for sure! Lots of love. ✨💖🫶🏼 Munira Yusufi We were around the area and wanted to get some dumpling but ended up getting mapo tofu and eggplant dish. They serve generous amounts of white rice and dumplings are abit too dry but with sauce it’s good. Peter Zhang Have eaten in and had delivery for many many years. Still love the place the food and the atmosphere. Easily some of the best OG Dumplings and the Lemon Chicken is always a household fave. Thanks team the whole family had smiles when it arrived last night! James Melton This restaurant is an absolute hidden gem for real. ✨⭐️From the incredible dumplings 🥟 and noodles 🍜 to the refreshing cucumber salad, 🥗 every dish is a delight. The tea is perfect and refreshing And The food is consistently amazing, and the staff, along with the chef, are some of the kindest most welcoming people you’ll ever meet.🫶💌 As someone who doesn’t eat meat, I truly appreciate the wide variety of vegetarian options available^^ and they’re so delicious that we always end up ordering the same thing lol. Whether you’re vegetarian or not, there’s something for everyone here.😻 Though this place isn’t in the spotlight, it’s truly the best of the best an exceptional spot for a meal and a wonderful dining experience. I would 100% recommend it to everyone. You’ll love the food, the atmosphere, and the people^^ All I wish for is for them to maintain a clean and hygienic environment, not just for their customers but for their own well being too.^^ Eva Aukdov PREV NEXT LOCATION × Average Customer Rating 4.1 This is my absolute favourite Chinese restaurant in Auckland. homepage_content: Mr Lobster Private Kitchen | Henderson | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Mr Lobster Private Kitchen PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Mr Lobster Private Kitchen Order Online from Mr Lobster Private Kitchen Asian & Chinese Cuisine * 301 Lincoln Rd Henderson, Auckland 0612 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS Steam Prawn Dumplings 龙虾皇虾皇饺 $18.80 Tomyum Steam Prawn Dumplings 泰式小笼包 $13.80 TOP SELLERS Steam Prawn Dumplings 龙虾皇虾皇饺 $18.80 Tomyum Steam Prawn Dumplings 泰式小笼包 $13.80 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup LUNCH DINNER Thursday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Friday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Saturday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Sunday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Monday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Tuesday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm Wednesday 10:30am to 2:30pm 5pm to 7:30pm REVIEWS Recently had dinner at this Chinese restaurant. The highlight of the meal was the roast duck. The meat was incredibly tender, and the skin was perfectly crispy, just the right balance of flavor and texture. The staff were attentive, and made sure we had everything we needed throughout the meal. We didn't have to wait long for our food, and everything came out piping hot and fresh. M R Always busy here. But we were able to get a table without waiting long. They are very efficient and courteous. The food is well prepared, presented, delicious and generous. Price is a bit on the high side but again generous servings. Ordering is a breeze with the QR code system and you know what you are paying for. Just make sure tea charging is for the right number of people. I have to say again they are very efficient! ENKI'S FUN TECHNO STUFF (EnkiTrillionaire) We visited Mr Lobster’s Private Kitchen a few weeks ago with a group of family and friends (there were nine of us). We made a booking in advance and were seated at a large table with a lazy Susan, which made sharing easy. We ordered a range of dishes from the menu—everything sounded amazing, and each dish had its own unique flavour. The standout for us was definitely the Peking duck. The crispy skin, juicy meat, and the combination with the wrap and veggies were just perfect. We also really enjoyed the green beans, roast pork, spicy chicken, and BBQ fried noodles—they were all packed with flavour. The only downside was the slow service. It seemed like dishes were being made and served one table at a time, which is understandable, but with so many other groups there, it meant we waited over 30–40 minutes before the food started arriving. A bit longer than we’re used to, even at busy places. That said, once the food came, it was worth the wait—just something to keep in mind if you're heading there during peak hours. Sang Hyun Kim Probably the best yum cha spot in Auckland! The food quality here is definitely a step above other well-known places. We came for a Saturday brunch with my family and my wife's family, and the place was already busy right from opening at 11am. Every table was full by lunchtime, so I was glad we had made a booking! Ordering was super easy using their QR code system, which showed clear photos of each dish. It was really helpful for choosing what we wanted. We ordered quite a variety, including their popular black truffle dumplings, steamed prawn dumplings, Mr. Lobster deep-fried prawn paste in shredded pastry, deep-fried spicy beans for salad, and a lobster congee to share, along with a few more dishes (not all pictured). Dish highlights: - Black Truffle Dumplings: Absolutely my favourite! There are two versions, and both were rich, fragrant, and full of truffle aroma - a must-try. - Steamed Prawn Dumplings: Fresh, juicy, and perfectly cooked - classic done right. - Deep-Fried Prawn Pastry (Mr. Lobster): Super crispy on the outside and beautifully tender inside. Loved every bite. - Spicy Beans for Salad: Crispy, flavourful, and surprisingly addictive. - Lobster Congee: Smooth, comforting, and generous with lobster - perfect for sharing. Even though the restaurant was packed, the staff were friendly, quick, and attentive. They took the time to answer our questions and made sure we had everything we needed. I have been here a few times now and have never been disappointed. They do yum cha only in lunch time, so it was important to us meeting in lunch time. The only downside is that prices are higher than other yum cha places, but the quality and flavour kinda justify it. Highly recommended, and make sure to book ahead. Michael Kang We have been several times for yum cha and once for dinner. The staff are very friendly and speak English. For yum cha you order on an app which has pictures and is in English and Chinese. They do have a physical menu but encourage to order on the app. There is no trolley service. Food is very tasty and a great variety. Pictures only show the few items we had. Highly recommend yum cha. You must book. The carpark can get busy but u can register your car with the restaurant to avoid getting towed or a ticket. Dinner is also very good with great service. Cost: $21 The fish was of a good size and coated nicely with a crunchy batter for most of it. Some spots the batter was soft. The flesh was a little rubbery to the bite, so didn’t give off those ‘fresh feels’. The chips were okay and better off in a chip butty, soft and pillowy right through. Corn fritter was ‘gluggy’ due to a batter mix and not the mash potato that’s the way forward! Disappointing really. The sausage was well, exactly as it looked lol. In terms of value, I gotta say it’s not there. Yes for portion size, but a hard No on quality and taste. Mark Panapa A little family run shop with decent prices and large portions. Given the economy these days, the place is definitely a bang for your buck location. Good chinese food and freshly made fish and chips; would highly recommend to anyone looking for an affordably but delicious meal (the kind family that runs the place is just a bonus - seems they just started running the place recently but super nice folks taking over the business)! name: India Garden Cromwell
homepage_content: India Garden Cromwell | Authentic Indian Takeaway & Dine-In Restaurant in Cromwell Welcome To India Garden Restaurant 61c The Mall, Cromwell 9310, New Zealand order Online Welcome To India Garden Restaurant 61c The Mall, Cromwell 9310, New Zealand Order Online Welcome To India Garden Restaurant 61c The Mall, Cromwell 9310, New Zealand Order Online Entrees Mains Book A Table About India Garden | Cromwell India Garden, situated at 61c The Mall in Cromwell, New Zealand, is a family-owned restaurant celebrated for its authentic Indian and Nepalese cuisine. Since its establishment in 2003, the restaurant has been dedicated to delivering a genuine dining experience, emphasizing traditional flavors and culinary techniques. The menu boasts a diverse selection of dishes, including popular items like chicken bhuna, biryani, and vegetable samosas, all prepared with fresh ingredients to ensure quality and taste. Patrons frequently praise the generous portions and the vibrant presentation of the meals, which enhance the overall dining experience. India Garden offers a welcoming ambiance, complemented by friendly and attentive staff, many of whom are of Nepali origin, adding to the restaurant's unique charm. The establishment is fully licensed and also allows BYO, making it a versatile choice for various occasions, from casual dinners to special celebrations. Overall, India Garden stands out as a notable destination in Cromwell for those seeking an authentic and satisfying Indian dining experience, with a menu and atmosphere that reflect the rich culinary traditions of India and Nepal. This charming restaurant is renowned for its authentic Indian cuisine, blending rich, traditional flavors with modern culinary techniques. The menu features a diverse array of dishes, from classic favorites like butter chicken and lamb rogan josh to vegetarian delights such as paneer tikka masala and aloo gobi. Each dish is meticulously prepared using fresh, high-quality ingredients and aromatic spices, ensuring an unforgettable gastronomic journey. The ambiance at Indian Palate Rotorua is warm and inviting, with elegant decor that reflects the rich cultural heritage of India. Whether you're looking for a cozy dinner for two or a celebratory meal with family and friends, the restaurant provides a welcoming atmosphere that caters to all occasions. The friendly and attentive staff are dedicated to providing exceptional service, enhancing your dining experience with their genuine hospitality. Conveniently situated on Fenton Street, Indian Palate Rotorua is a must-visit for both locals and tourists seeking an authentic taste of India in the heart of New Zealand. Whether dining in or opting for takeaway, this restaurant promises a culinary adventure that delights the senses. name: Nami Japanese Restaurant
homepage_content: Nami Japanese Restaurant | Hamilton | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Nami Japanese Restaurant PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Nami Japanese Restaurant Order Online from Nami Japanese Restaurant Japanese Cuisine * 20 Hood St Hamilton 3204 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS 47 Teriyaki Chicken Roll Teriyaki Chicken, avocado $21.50 33 Donburi Selection of Teriyaki Chicken/Teriyaki Salmon/ Spicy Chicken/ Spicy Pork/ Sweet Beef $29.00 TOP SELLERS 47 Teriyaki Chicken Roll Teriyaki Chicken, avocado $21.50 33 Donburi Selection of Teriyaki Chicken/Teriyaki Salmon/ Spicy Chicken/ Spicy Pork/ Sweet Beef $29.00 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup LUNCH DINNER Thursday 12pm to 1:30pm 6pm to 8:30pm Friday 12pm to 1:30pm 6pm to 8:30pm Saturday 12pm to 1:30pm 6pm to 8:30pm Sunday Closed Closed Monday 12pm to 1:30pm 6pm to 8:30pm Tuesday 12pm to 1:30pm 6pm to 8:30pm Wednesday 12pm to 1:30pm 6pm to 8:30pm REVIEWS Best Japanese and sushi in Hamilton, has been my fav and regular for 5+ years and service and quality is always outstanding. Nigiri is always fresh, sushi rolls are always the same top quality, tempura light and crunchy and karaage or teriyaki always superb. Even the rice is fluffy. Highly recommended. Dean Evans I had the pleasure of dining at Nami Japanese Restaurant recently, and it was truly an unforgettable experience. From the moment we stepped in, we were warmly welcomed by the staff, whose kindness and attentiveness made us feel right at home. The food was absolutely outstanding — each dish was beautifully presented and full of fresh, authentic flavour. You can tell that a lot of care goes into the preparation, and the ingredients were of the highest quality. Whether it was the sashimi, the grilled items, or the side dishes, everything tasted incredibly fresh and well-balanced. The service was equally impressive. The staff were friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive without being intrusive. They took the time to explain the menu and offered great recommendations based on our preferences. It’s rare to find such genuine hospitality these days, and it made our time there even more enjoyable. The atmosphere of the restaurant is elegant yet relaxed. The interior design blends modern touches with traditional Japanese elements, creating a peaceful and inviting space. It’s perfect for both casual meals and special occasions. Overall, I cannot recommend Nami highly enough. If you’re looking for a place where excellent food meets top-notch service and a beautiful setting, this is it. I will definitely be returning with friends and family. 오요한 Proprietor is very friendly, although the young man waiting tables definitely didn't want to be there and never bothered to check on us after giving us our food. We tried to order ramen but they were all out, which was odd since it was literally an hour into their first service of the week (Tuesday). Because of this we asked for more time to check the menu and the waiter then took it upon himself to put the single order through for gyōza which we'd mentioned before finding out they were out of ramen, so this came out long before we'd even had a chance to order other appetisers or mains. The wait for the rest of the food was staggered but not too long overall. Wakame salad was perfectly seasoned. The tuna tataki sashimi was not bad but seemed to be from frozen going off the pinkish colour and texture. Soft shell crab was tasty but on the small side for $28. The donburi unagi was very good. All in all not an amazing experience, so I will probably try other local options for Japanese before I return. Jimmy I absolutely love dining at Nami! The food is always fresh and incredibly delicious. The service is beautiful, and Eugene, the owner, is so generous and welcoming. I always leave with a smile. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for an authentic Japanese dining experience! Melissa Gilbertson First visit in this Japanese restaurant in the lunch time. We arrived early and few customers were already inside. This is one of the few authentic Japanese cuisine restaurants in town. As you enter, it seems like you are in Japan, great decorations, long bar featuring traditional customs. Food came quickly, we ordered some chicken karage for our chidren, my wife ordered salmon with salad and me lamen. All tasted fantastically nice, soft rice and well seasoned. Owners are Japanese, that explains much of the quality and precision. Looking for another good experience in the future. Mauricio Kimura PREV NEXT LOCATION × Average Customer Rating 4.5 Best Japanese and sushi in Hamilton, has been my fav and regular for 5+ years and service and quality is always outstanding. The interior is tastefully decorated with a blend of modern and traditional elements, featuring comfortable seating arrangements and ambient lighting that creates a relaxed dining environment. name: Petit Bocal
homepage_content: PetBiLocal – My Blog Skip to content Home 26 Sep The Timeless Appeal of Shoes: More Than Just Footwear admin Business No Comments Shoes are far more than something we slip on our feet each morning. They tell stories about who we are, where we’re going, and how we choose to present ourselves to the world. From the earliest leather sandals worn thousands of years ago to today’s designer sneakers that double as status symbols, shoes have always played a vital role in culture, style, and self-expression. The Function and Evolution of Shoes At their core, shoes serve a practical purpose: to protect our feet from the ground, weather, and injury. But over the centuries, they’ve evolved into symbols of identity and markers of social status. In ancient Egypt, the wealthy wore elaborate sandals, while commoners often went barefoot. In medieval Europe, pointed shoes signified nobility. By the 20th century, shoes were a booming industry, blending fashion and function to keep up with rapidly changing lifestyles. Today, shoes are designed with incredible versatility. There are high-performance athletic sneakers engineered with advanced cushioning, sturdy boots crafted to withstand rugged terrains, and elegant heels designed to turn heads at formal events. The choices are endless, and for many people, picking the right pair is both an art and a personal statement. Shoes as an Expression of Style Few fashion items have as much power to transform an outfit as shoes. A simple change from sneakers to loafers, or flats to stilettos, can completely shift the tone of what you’re wearing. Sneakers : Once reserved for sports, sneakers are now a global fashion staple. They’ve crossed cultural lines, pairing as easily with jeans as with dresses or suits. Boots : From rugged hiking boots to sleek ankle boots, this category is versatile enough to work across seasons and styles. Sandals : The ultimate in warm-weather footwear, sandals balance comfort and breathability with casual flair. Heels : Love them or hate them, high heels remain iconic for their ability to elongate the legs and add sophistication to an outfit. Flats : Timeless and practical, flats offer everyday comfort without sacrificing polish. This adaptability makes shoes one of the most expressive accessories in anyone’s wardrobe. The Psychology of Shoes Interestingly, shoes can also reveal quite a bit about personality. Psychologists have noted that the type of shoes someone wears often correlates with aspects of their character or lifestyle. Well-kept, polished shoes : Suggest conscientiousness and attention to detail. Colorful, bold footwear : Often associated with openness and creativity. Worn-out, practical shoes : Reflect practicality and comfort-driven priorities. In many ways, the shoes we choose act as silent introductions before we’ve said a word. Comfort Meets Technology Modern footwear isn’t just about aesthetics. Comfort and performance are now just as important as style. Sports brands invest millions into research and development, creating shoes with shock absorption, breathable fabrics, and ergonomic designs that support long-term foot health. The rise of technology has also introduced smart shoes — footwear with built-in sensors that can track steps, monitor posture, and even connect with apps for fitness tracking. These innovations show just how far shoes have come from their humble beginnings as simple coverings. The Sustainability Shift In recent years, sustainability has become a central topic in fashion, and footwear is no exception. The production of shoes often requires significant resources, from leather tanning to synthetic materials. Many companies are now rethinking their processes, focusing on eco-friendly materials and ethical production methods. Brands are experimenting with recycled plastics, plant-based leathers, and biodegradable fabrics. Consumers, too, are becoming more mindful, looking for shoes that don’t just look good but also align with their values. This shift is not only reshaping the footwear industry but also encouraging shoppers to consider longevity over fast fashion — investing in shoes that last, rather than chasing disposable trends. Collecting Shoes: A Cultural Phenomenon For some, shoes are more than functional or fashionable — they’re collectibles. Sneaker culture, in particular, has exploded worldwide. Limited-edition releases from brands like Nike or Adidas often sell out in minutes, with resellers flipping them at multiples of the retail price. High-fashion brands also contribute to this culture with exclusive drops, collaborations, and statement designs. In many ways, shoes have become cultural currency, representing not just style but also belonging to a community of enthusiasts. The Role of Shoes in Everyday Life While celebrity collaborations and high-fashion designs grab headlines, most people value shoes for how they fit into their everyday lives. The right shoes can make commutes more bearable, workouts more effective, and social occasions more enjoyable. They can also provide confidence — there’s something powerful about stepping out in footwear that feels just right for the occasion. For parents, children’s shoes are a constant consideration as kids grow quickly and need supportive, durable pairs. For professionals, quality dress shoes or heels can play a role in how they are perceived in the workplace. For travelers, lightweight and versatile shoes can mean the difference between an easy trip and sore feet. Buying Shoes in the Digital Age The way we shop for shoes has also transformed. Online platforms have revolutionized accessibility, giving shoppers the ability to browse thousands of styles without leaving home. Detailed product images, size guides, and customer reviews have made it easier than ever to buy confidently online. Retailers like Styletread in Australia have thrived by offering a wide selection of brands, fast delivery, and flexible return options, showing just how much convenience matters to today’s shoppers. The rise of e-commerce has made finding the perfect pair of shoes a process that can take minutes, not hours spent at the mall. Why Shoes Will Always Matter At the end of the day, shoes are far more than objects we wear out of necessity. They are companions on life’s journey, quietly supporting us through milestones both big and small. The pair you wore to your first job interview, the sneakers that carried you through a marathon, or the heels you danced in at a wedding — shoes become part of our personal stories. Fashion trends will continue to evolve, technology will keep advancing, and sustainability will drive new innovations. Yet the essence of shoes — as protectors, statement-makers, and storytellers — will always remain. Final Thoughts Shoes are one of the few items in our lives that balance function and fashion so seamlessly. They carry the weight of our daily lives while offering endless opportunities for self-expression. Whether chosen for comfort, style, or symbolism, shoes remain a universal constant across cultures and generations. As we move into a future shaped by technology and sustainability, our footwear will continue to adapt while retaining its timeless significance. And for shoppers who want choice, convenience, and a touch of style, modern retailers make the process easier than ever — proof that the humble shoe still has plenty of steps left in its journey. 24 Apr The State of Insurance in Australia: Challenges, Trends, and Future Outlook admin Business No Comments Insurance plays a crucial role in Australia’s economy, providing financial protection to individuals, businesses, and communities against unforeseen risks. From home and car insurance to life and health coverage, the industry is a cornerstone of financial security. However, the sector faces significant challenges, including rising premiums, climate change impacts, regulatory changes, and technological disruptions. This article explores the current state of insurance in Australia, key trends shaping the industry, and what the future may hold. The Current Landscape of Insurance in Australia 1. Market Overview Australia’s insurance industry is one of the most developed in the Asia-Pacific region, with a market size exceeding $60 billion annually. The sector is dominated by major players such as: IAG (Insurance Australia Group) – Owners of brands like NRMA, CGU, and RACV. Suncorp – Includes AAMI, GIO, and Apia. QBE – A global insurer with a strong Australian presence. Allianz and Zurich – Major international insurers operating in Australia. The industry is divided into several key segments: General Insurance (home, car, travel) Life Insurance (income protection, death cover) Health Insurance (private health coverage) Specialty Insurance (cyber, business interruption) 2. Rising Premiums and Affordability Concerns One of the biggest challenges facing Australian consumers is the rising cost of insurance premiums. Several factors contribute to this trend: Increased Natural Disasters – Bushfires, floods, and cyclones have led to higher claims, forcing insurers to raise premiums. Inflation and Supply Chain Issues – Rising costs of repairs and replacements impact claims payouts. Reinsurance Costs – Australian insurers rely on global reinsurance markets, which have become more expensive due to global climate risks. A 2023 report by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) found that home insurance premiums rose by an average of 12% in the past year, with some high-risk areas seeing increases of over 50%. 3. Climate Change and Its Impact Australia is one of the most climate-vulnerable developed nations, with insurers paying out billions in claims due to extreme weather events. Key concerns include: Bushfire Risks – The 2019-2020 Black Summer fires cost insurers over $2.3 billion. Flooding – The 2022 Eastern Australia floods resulted in $5.6 billion in insured losses, making them the costliest disaster in Australian history. Cyclone Exposure – Northern Australia faces frequent cyclones, leading to higher premiums in regions like Queensland. Insurers are now reassessing risk models, with some refusing to cover high-risk properties or imposing steep excesses. The government has introduced schemes like Cyclone Reinsurance Pools to help stabilize premiums in disaster-prone areas. 4. Regulatory Changes and Consumer Protections The Australian insurance market is heavily regulated to ensure fairness and solvency. Recent regulatory developments include: The Financial Accountability Regime (FAR) – Strengthens accountability for insurers and executives. The Design and Distribution Obligations (DDO) – Requires insurers to ensure products meet consumer needs. The General Insurance Code of Practice – Sets standards for claims handling and transparency. Additionally, the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) monitors pricing practices, particularly in home and car insurance, to prevent unfair pricing. Emerging Trends in the Insurance Sector 1. Digital Transformation and InsurTech Technology is reshaping how insurance is sold and managed in Australia. Key innovations include: AI and Machine Learning – Used for risk assessment, fraud detection, and personalized pricing. Telematics in Car Insurance – Usage-based policies (e.g., pay-as-you-drive) are growing in popularity. Digital Claims Processing – AI-driven chatbots and automated claims systems speed up payouts. Australian InsurTech startups like Cover Genius, Huddle Insurance, and Honey Insurance are disrupting traditional models with digital-first solutions. 2. Cyber Insurance Boom With the rise of cyberattacks, businesses are increasingly seeking cyber insurance. The market is expected to grow by 20% annually, driven by: Increased ransomware attacks. Regulatory requirements for data protection. SME demand for coverage against digital risks. 3. Shift Towards Parametric Insurance Unlike traditional insurance (which pays based on assessed losses), parametric insurance pays out when predefined triggers (e.g., flood levels) are met. This model is gaining traction for agriculture and disaster coverage, offering faster payouts. 4. Health Insurance Challenges Australia’s private health insurance sector is under pressure due to: Rising costs leading to younger people dropping coverage. Government reforms to make policies more affordable. Increased demand for mental health coverage post-pandemic. The Future of Insurance in Australia 1. Greater Focus on Prevention Insurers are investing in predictive analytics and IoT devices (e.g., water leak sensors, fire alarms) to prevent losses rather than just paying claims. 2. Sustainable and ESG-Linked Insurance Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) factors are becoming critical. Insurers are: Offering discounts for eco-friendly homes. Divesting from fossil fuel-related underwriting. Supporting climate resilience projects. 3. Potential for More Government Intervention As premiums rise, the government may step in with: Subsidies for high-risk areas. Mandatory coverage requirements (e.g., flood insurance). National disaster insurance schemes. To save on your premium with Everyday Insurance, use an Everyday insurance coupon to get a discount on your policy. 4. Customer-Centric Innovations Future trends include: On-demand insurance (e.g., temporary coverage for gadgets or travel). Personalized pricing based on real-time data. Blockchain for transparent claims processing. Conclusion The Australian insurance industry is at a crossroads, balancing rising risks with innovation. While climate change and affordability remain major challenges, digital transformation and new insurance models offer hope for a more resilient future. Consumers should stay informed, compare policies, and consider risk mitigation strategies to navigate this evolving landscape. As the market adapts, collaboration between insurers, regulators, and consumers will be key to ensuring that insurance remains accessible and effective in protecting Australians against an uncertain future. 20 Dec Discover Glassons: A Leading Fashion Destination admin Business No Comments Glassons , a well-known name in the fashion world, has become synonymous with trendy, affordable clothing and accessories. Originating in New Zealand, the brand has expanded its reach to Australia and beyond, cementing its reputation as a go-to retailer for contemporary fashion. Known for its vibrant collections, Glassons caters to the needs of young, fashion-forward individuals seeking a mix of style, comfort, and value. A Brief History of Glassons Glassons was founded in 1908 and has since grown to become a major player in the Australasian fashion market. Its success lies in its ability to keep up with ever-changing fashion trends while maintaining affordability. The brand offers a wide range of products, including women’s clothing, activewear, swimwear, and accessories, ensuring there’s something for everyone. The brand’s commitment to inclusivity is also evident in its size range, catering to diverse body types and styles. Whether you’re looking for the perfect summer dress, a chic blazer for work, or casual weekend wear, Glassons has options that suit all occasions. Sustainability at Glassons In recent years, Glassons has taken steps toward becoming a more sustainable brand. They’ve introduced initiatives like recycled fabrics, eco-friendly packaging, and transparency in their supply chain. This move aligns with the growing demand from consumers for brands to prioritize sustainability and ethical practices. Glassons also engages with its customer base through its active social media presence, offering styling tips, showcasing new arrivals, and fostering a sense of community among fashion lovers. Their physical stores, combined with an easy-to-navigate online shopping platform, make it convenient for customers to access their latest collections. Ways to Save Money While Shopping at Glassons While Glassons is already known for its affordable pricing, savvy shoppers can find additional ways to maximize their savings. Here are some tips to help you shop smart: 1. Sign Up for the Glassons Newsletter Joining the Glassons mailing list is an excellent way to stay updated on their latest promotions and new arrivals. Subscribers often receive exclusive discounts, early access to sales, and special offers, making it a valuable resource for regular shoppers. 2. Shop During Seasonal Sales Glassons frequently hosts sales during key seasons, including end-of-season clearances and holiday events. These sales offer significant discounts on popular items, allowing you to snag your favorite pieces at a fraction of the original price. 3. Use Promo Codes and Coupons Look for a Glassons discount code available online. Websites like NZGG regularly feature deals for Glassons, offering additional savings on your purchase. Keep an eye out for free shipping codes, percentage discounts, or buy-one-get-one-free offers. 4. Check the Sale Section Glassons’ website and stores have dedicated sale sections featuring discounted items. You can often find hidden gems from previous collections at reduced prices. 5. Take Advantage of Free Shipping Thresholds Glassons frequently offers free shipping on orders over a certain amount. If you’re close to the threshold, consider adding a small item to your cart to qualify for free delivery, effectively saving on shipping costs. 6. Join Glassons Rewards Programs Some stores have loyalty or rewards programs that allow you to earn points with every purchase. While Glassons doesn’t currently have a specific rewards program, keeping an eye out for any future initiatives could help you save even more. Glassons continues to be a favorite among fashion enthusiasts for its trendy offerings and commitment to affordability. By using these tips, you can enjoy the latest styles without breaking the bank. Happy shopping! 04 May Hallenstein’s growth continues admin Business No Comments Founded in New Zealand in 1870, Hallensteins is known for its distinctive and high-quality men’s fashion. The company has continued to evolve over the years and adapt to the changing market conditions and consumer preferences. In order to cater to different consumer groups, Hallensteins has expanded its product range. Besides its core business of making trousers, shirts, and suits, the company has also introduced various casual wear items, such as t-shirts and jeans. These products have helped the company appeal to a younger crowd, as they are more likely to be wearing casual clothes on a regular basis. Hallensteins has made significant progress in its online presence, as it has invested heavily in an e-commerce platform that enables customers to shop for its products online and get a wider range of options than can be purchased in-store. The company has also used various digital channels to build its brand and connect with its customers. In the past few years, Hallensteins has faced various challenges in the retail industry. One of these was the emergence of the COVID-19 pandemic, which affected the company’s sales. To address these issues, the company shifted its focus from traditional retail to e-commerce. It also invested in new technology to improve its online shopping experience. You can get great deals when you shop at Hallensteins when you use a Hallensteins promo code . With a strong brand and loyal following, Hallensteins can continue to grow and compete in the future. The company’s focus on customer service and innovation will help it maintain its competitive edge. As the world begins to emerge from the pandemic, the company may also be able to expand its physical presence and reach out to new customers through its brick-and mortar outlets. 23 Dec Kogan acquires BROSA Furniture admin Business No Comments Online retailer Kogan has purchased the assets of furniture retailer Brosa for about $1.5 million. Brosa had reportedly posted annual sales of over $50 million before it went into administration last week. In addition to its stock and intellectual property, which it will now own, Kogan will also provide support to Brosa’s customers. Founded in 2014, Brosa was able to build a following among high-end consumers. It offers a wide range of home goods, including three-seater white couch and vintage rugs. It was backed by venture capital firms which helped fund the marketing and brand building of Brosa. The valuation of Brosa increased by 49 percent in the past few months due to its solid trading performance. Due to the pandemic, the demand for home goods retailers started to decline. As a result, Brosa was placed in administration. Brosa is in a relatively mature online furniture market that includes similar reatilers such as LivingStyles . You can save at Livingstyles with a LivingStyles coupon . In its filings with the Australian Securities Exchange, online retailer Kogan noted that Brosa was valued at about $60 million. It had also experienced strong revenue growth during the previous financial year. The administrator of Brosa said that the company received over 30 expressions of interest. After considering the various bids, it was decided that the online retailer would purchase the business. It’s a small acquisition for the Kogan, which has a market capitalization of around $350 million. During the September quarter, its gross sales were $202.3 million, which was 38.8 percent lower than the previous year. The acquisition of Brosa was relatively low-risk for both parties. It also allows Kogan to expand their online furniture offerings. 17 Oct Retailers failing to reach their sales goals admin Business No Comments Most retailers failed to meet their sales targets during the first quarter of the year, and more than a third were uncertain if their businesses would survive the next 12 months. The latest Retail Radar report shows that almost half of New Zealand retailers failed to meet their sales targets in Q3. The retail sector was hit by the resurgence of Covid-19 and lockdown in Auckland, which caused sales to fall in August and September. A survey conducted by PricewaterhouseCoopers revealed that almost half of retailers expected sales to fall in the run-up to Christmas. Many of them were also not sure if they would be able to survive another year. Due to government lockdowns and changes in the alert level, many retailers have experienced a significant impact on their operations. Many businesses are complaining about a change in rules that limit what they can sell on level 4. This is leaving them hurting and unable to offer their usual services. Retailers were facing various issues such as a lack of stock and the ability to make rent payments, said Michael Jacobson, head of retail at PricewaterhouseCoopers. Almost half of retailers expect to raise their prices in the next quarter. Retailers wanted the Government to pay them a financial payment for their rent, according to a survey conducted by PricewaterhouseCoopers. According to Retail Radar, the number of retailers who are satisfied with the government’s handling of Covid-19 has plummeted. Almost 70 per cent of retailers were dissatisfied or very dissatisfied with the government’s response to the Covid-19 report, according to a survey conducted by PricewaterhouseCoopers. Retail NZ asked for measures to help retailers in the next few months, such as establishing a clear date for the Auckland road map, issuing saliva testing for Covid-19 and relieving rent relief. The motion also called for a halt to measures that would increase costs, such as the minimum wage and a moratorium on further increases. Stores like Glassons have continued to perform well with strong sales during Covid. If you’re looking to save on the Glassons Sale , use a Glassons coupon with your purchase. 05 Apr Coronavirus induced closures hit retail admin Business No Comments Coronavirus has caused a lot of store closure around the country, some by force and some voluntarily. Places that had a higher risk of transferring the Corona Virus including restaurants, gyms and pubs were forced to shut down. Other stores have chosen to voluntarily shut down due a complete drop in the traffic to these stores. Those employees of these chains that have temporarily shut down versus going out of business have had to look for other means of an income such as the newstart allowance. Two major chains that have recently closed all it’s retail stores are Adairs and Kathmandu . Adairs announced that it would shut all it’s bricks and mortar stores for six weeks to ensure the safety of their customers and staff. Adairs’ New Zealand stores have already closed due to the level 4 restrictions. Kathmandu has also closed all its Australian and New Zealand stores which number 170. They also own Rip Curl stores of which they have closed all 100 of them. They have over 2000 staff in Australia and all will be told that they will be stood down without pay for 4 weeks. They will however be able to use their leave entitlements over this time. Shareholders will also be affected by the virus with a suspension of dividends. If you want to continue shopping at Adairs , visit their online store which is still open. Use an Adairs promo code with your purchase to get a great deal. 05 Nov The top things to see or do in New Zealand’s South Island admin Travel No Comments New Zealand is known as one of the most beautiful countries in the world and there is an amazing amount of sites to see all around the country. The South Island however has the most beautiful scenery in the country and the world. It is a huge place to explore so here are some of the top things to see in New Zealand. The first is Abel Tasman National Park in Nelson. Abel Tasman National Park has a huge variety of sheltered bays and this environment is perfectly suited for water activities such as sailing and kayaking. These activites done at a slow pace will allow you take in the beautiful surrounds of the bays. You will see marine life such as dolphins and seals nine out of ten times you’re there. If water is not your thing then you walk the trails along the coastline and experience the beauty of the area from the land. Another beautiful place to visit is Central Otago . Central Otago is hope to a huge variety of landscapes and scenery including snow capped mountains, rivers, hills and is also a thriving wine region known for it’s Pinot Noir. Mt Aspiring National Park in Wanaka is another breathtaking place to visit in the South Island. The location is the place to go with high mountains that have flowing rivers of clear and icey water. Lakes are a beautiful and turqois colour. Activites such as water sports and scenic flights are available for those that really want to take in the beauty of the area. For a great selection of Hotels in these areas visit Hotels.com with a Hotels.com coupon . name: Ngai Tahu Seafood Products
homepage_content: Home » Ngāi Tahu Seafood Ngāi Tahu Seafood is a wholly owned subsidiary of Ngāi Tahu Holdings Corporation. Ngāi Tahu Holdings Corporation is the commercial arm of Te Rūnanga o Ngāi Tahu , the tribal authority of Ngāi Tahu - the largest iwi (tribe) in Te Waipounamu (the South Island) of Aotearoa New Zealand. The focus of Ngāi Tahu Seafood is on intergenerational investment, with profits from the business contributing to social and cultural programmes and economic empowerment for the over 80,000 registered members of Ngāi Tahu. Ensuring future generations are provided for aligns with the Ngāi Tahu tribal vision: Mō tātou, ā, mō kā uri ā muri ake nei. For us and our children after us. Our Products Ngāi Tahu Seafood supplies the highest quality seafood to international and domestic markets, under the TAHU brand. Key species are kōura (rock lobster), pāua (abalone), tio (Bluff oysters), rāwaru (blue cod), and kōura rangi (scampi). VIEW OUR PRODUCTS Ngāi Tahu Seafood continues the deep connection that Ngāi Tahu have had with the sea (moana) since our ancestors first voyaged to Aotearoa New Zealand in waka unua (double hulled canoes) more than 600 years ago. “For many generations our people sustained a healthy living from land, bush, waterways and sea. They treasured and preserved what this vast area had to offer. Their environmentalism was second to none.” Rangimarie Te Maiharoa, Te Rūnanga o Waihao. Our profound respect for the marine environment with a focus on sustainability and responsible behaviour, guides our practice in today’s commercial environment. Read more

Mt Albert Dumpling House Mt Albert Dumpling House, nestled at 887 New North Road in Mount Albert, Auckland, is a culinary gem that transports diners to the heart of Chinese flavors. This quaint establishment is a haven for dumpling enthusiasts, offering a delectable array of meticulously crafted dumplings that tantalize the taste buds with every bite. The cozy ambiance welcomes patrons to an authentic dining experience, where the aroma of freshly steamed and pan-fried dumplings permeates the air. From classic pork and chive dumplings to innovative vegetarian options, the menu showcases a diverse selection to cater to various preferences. What sets Mt Albert Dumpling House apart is its commitment to using high-quality, locally sourced ingredients, ensuring a fusion of freshness and traditional Chinese culinary techniques. The skilled chefs masterfully fold and pleat each dumpling, creating delicate parcels of flavor that are both visually appealing and irresistibly delicious. Whether you're a dumpling connoisseur or a newcomer to Chinese cuisine, Mt Albert Dumpling House offers a welcoming space to savor the artistry of dumpling making. With its central location, friendly staff, and an enticing menu, this dumpling haven is a must-visit for those seeking an authentic taste of China in the heart of Auckland. Also the sir that gave me my udon was super polite and warn me to be careful which I find very sweet in the way he said it to me. So definitely will be back often. homepage_content: Shanghai Kitchen | Petone | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Shanghai Kitchen PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Shanghai Kitchen Order Online from Shanghai Kitchen Asian & Chinese Cuisine * 85 Jackson St Petone, Lower Hutt 5012 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS A2 Pan Fried Pork Dumplings (6 Pcs) 鲜肉锅贴 Crisp-fried wheaten pastry filled with minced pork served with zhengjiang vinegar $16.80 P2 Sweet And Sour Pork 糖醋溜里脊 Deep-fried batter coated pork strips with sweet soy sauce and Zhenjiang vinegar topped with sesame $29.70 TOP SELLERS A2 Pan Fried Pork Dumplings (6 Pcs) 鲜肉锅贴 Crisp-fried wheaten pastry filled with minced pork served with zhengjiang vinegar $16.80 P2 Sweet And Sour Pork 糖醋溜里脊 Deep-fried batter coated pork strips with sweet soy sauce and Zhenjiang vinegar topped with sesame $29.70 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup LUNCH DINNER Thursday 11:30am to 1:30pm 5:30pm to 8:30pm Friday 11:30am to 1:30pm 5:30pm to 8:30pm Saturday 11:30am to 1:30pm 5:30pm to 8:30pm Sunday Closed Closed Monday Closed Closed Tuesday Closed Closed Wednesday 11:30am to 1:30pm 5:30pm to 8:30pm REVIEWS We’re from Palmy and used to visit Wellington quite often. Back then, we went to Shanghai Kitchen a few times and always enjoyed it. It’s been at least 6–7 years since our last visit, but this time we were in Wellington for the Monster Truck show and decided to take our son there for the very first time. He absolutely loved everything—from the noodles to the xiao long bao to the braised wheat gluten. We’ll definitely be back again! Shane chu The vibe is chilling when I was there since I arrived begining of Thier start working hour. Thier Pu er tea I enjoy it taste so good . Chrysanthemum tea was perfect taste as it for children .Thier dim sum taste good but it quite sad that the skin was too soft that easily broke that lead the juice came off most of the time.seaweed soup dumpling amount was perfect per person ratio.Sausage bun is what I like the most due to the juiciness. The pan fried dumplings was good as it's not too crunchy the skin if you stuff one piece inside the mouth which will not hurt you that much like gyoza Catherine Zeitouni Best and authentic Southeastern Chinese food! Must try the Shanghai style teamed pork bun!!! We also ordered the pork and bamboo root soup, which was very light and fresh. The Chinese pickles with fish fillet tasted great, not too much decoration but it's savoury when you try the pickled cabbages. Also we had the green soya bean with pickles, which was the best companion for rice. Fried pork ribs were crispy and yummy, worth the price. Last, when we left, we had Shanghai style fried fish cold dish as takeaway. But I could not resist the tempt and tried one piece, which brought me back home. Definitely recommend it!!! Hanajan As a Shanghainese myself, I gotta say this restaurant offers the most authentic Shanghai local food in Lower Hutt, if not in Wellington. The fish fillet and the fried rice are amazing. Love them all! Thank you. Cheers~ Ying Min 颖敏 Ren Loved our visit. The 6 of us shared 5 dishes and enjoyed everyone. The two children were treated kindly by the staff. The atmosphere was homely and very pleasant. Will be returning. Robyn Dawber PREV NEXT LOCATION × Average Customer Rating 4.2 We’re from Palmy and used to visit Wellington quite often. name: Regal Chinese Restaurant
homepage_content: Regal Chinese Rest - Te Aro | Te Aro | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Regal Chinese Rest - Te Aro Asian - Chinese - 4.1 7 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011 × Average Customer Rating 4.1 Very great Cantonese restaurant, surprisingly good. We ordered four dishes. Jingdu sour sweet pork rib is the best sour sweet fried chicken that I’ve ever tasted. Very crispy skin and very tender meat inside, perfect seasoning. A little sour and sweet. Perfect price and portion. And they also give one bite of free desert. And Chenpi red beans. Tooo sweet.🥰🥰🥰🥰100% recommend. Yarong Duan You won’t go wrong with Regals if you’re after authentic chinese cuisine or a fantastic spread of yum cha. They have a great variety to choose from their menu and are often packed, so do book in advance. Parking is ample around the streets however one inconvenience is the lack of an elevator, which might not be accessible for the elderly etc. I’ve also added some videos from chinese new year where they often have the lion dance performance which is entertaining for all. Eugene T Great restaurant for banquet meals. Also discounts for members. Roast Duck is excellent. Glenny Y Food is fantastic. There's a load to choose from especially the Yum Cha menu 11am to 2.30. I ordered way too much food but it was all fantastic and I got a takeaway container for left overs. Grant Newdick Lots of Cantonese people were here for yum cha, so my expectations were high. While the atmosphere was good, the dishes were mostly not. The har gao was fishy, mixed with bamboo and seemed off. The xiu mai was all tough pork. The xiao long bao was all meat and no soup. Taro pan fried cakes were super dry, and chinese donut rice rolls were flattened with too much soy sauce. The chicken feet were delicious though, the only standout dish. The pan fried chive cakes were alao good. The trolley service was also a bit pushy with some of the orders (like the drink cart and desserts) while having to request core dim sum dishes like har gow was a bit odd. Keith Van × × - + ADD 0 ATTENTION × Are you sure you want to place this order for tomorrow? homepage_content: Shanxi Noodles | Hillcrest | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Shanxi Noodles Asian - Chinese - 4.6 17 Edinburgh Rd, Hillcrest, Hamilton 3216 × Average Customer Rating 4.6 This is one of the must eat noodle place in hamilton. Everytime when i visit or go pass hamilton i will come and have it. steve yee Homely atmosphere in this small space. Freshest noodles and tofu with authentic Chinese cooking. Worthwhile and a favourite go-to in Hamilton ApitiWhanau After visiting Hamilton Garden on the way back to Auckland our team feel hungry, randomly google a noodle shop and gave it a try. Being an Asian I can tell you this is better than most of noodle shops in Auckland LOL. The shop owner is very nice and offered me extra noodle for free but I shouldn’t be greedy lol Henry Choi Loved the meal. We had a vegetarian noodle soup, mapo tofu and noodle stir fry. We were treated with smiles and respect. It was worth the stop. M. Shomade Hidden pearl next to uni, delicious pork noodles, with tasteful sauce and soft pasta. Owners working all day long, also selling handmade tofu. Place is small and cozy, looks you are eating in their dining room. Dozens of combinations of noodles and ingredients chosen on the spot. Arrived in the lunch time and was quiet and clean, some old ladies were there, giving a good impression of the quality and reputation. name: Smoke Collective Barbecue
homepage_content: Cambridge Restaurant | Smoke Collective Barbecue New announcement. Learn more ORDER NOW Welcome to Smoke Collective Barbecue Tastiest Barbecued Meat In Town Cambridge restaurant Serving Low'n Slow Barbecue since 2017- Your Go-To for Cozy Barbecue! Nestled in the industrial precinct of Cambridge, we bring you a slice of barbecue heaven, blending the art of Low'n Slow Barbecue with a dash of Kiwi flair. Our Cambridge restaurant is a place to relax and connect, our place invites you to celebrate the little moments, whether it's over a burger and beer or one of our popular sharing meat platter with friends. Our doors are open for all. From the hot smoked peppered beef brisket, sweet spiced rubbed smoked pork belly, beef & cheese kransky sausage, fried chicken, and our meaty, cheesy dirty fries, we have your cravings sorted. We invite you to dine in our Cambridge restaurant, order online for takeout, or contact us for your private catering event. We look forward to seeing you soon. The Christmas Party Season is here! Work-do, family party, or a festive night with friends? Let us handle the Christmas party catering — or host it here with us! name: South Taranaki Club Inc
homepage_content: Home - South Taranaki Club Skip to content Welcome To South Taranaki Club - The Place To Be! Restaurant About Us Adjuncts Members Draw Join the Fun at South Taranaki’s Leading Social Club The Club is located in modern new premises in Caledonia Street, Hawera which will take the club well into the future. Entertainment is provided most Friday & or Saturday nights. Every Thursday & Friday nights are the member draw nights with “Happy Hour” every Friday night 6pm to 7pm. You must be present to win the members draw & present your current membership card to claim. With a growing membership of just over 2400, the South Taranaki Club offers some of the best social and indoor sports facilities in Hawera. The Club’s facilities also comprise of a restaurant, “Caledonia” which has a seating capacity of 90+ dining area, a ‘casino room’ with 18 modern gaming machines with newly released games, an outdoor social area with TV monitors and more… Our indoor sports facilities include four full size snooker tables, three pool tables, table tennis, darts and indoor bowls. Other sporting & social adjuncts include outdoor bowls, golf, fishing, tourers & over 60’s. VTNZ STC Member Discount STC Members receive a discount at any VTNZ Station, refer to VTNZ Disc Flyer or see www.vtnz.co.nz/clubsnz for full details. STC Courtesy Van The STC operate a Courtesy Coach service for members & guests. The Courtesy Coach operates Thursday evening from 4.00pm onwards & Friday & Saturday evenings from 5.00pm onwards, other times as required. To arrange a pick up from a residential address or motel, please call the driver on 027 2784014. This service will operate depending on the demand for the service.
