Thankyou, food was delicious I’ll definitely be back 🥰 hays pitman I had a best GF fish and chips from here last week & my partner had the Supreme burger, chips, 2 fish & a sausage. Absolutely delicious. Nice and clean family owned business. Will be back to try more from the Gluten Free Menu. Karen Hibberd My son and I come every week because it has the best hotdogs my son inhales them. Great chips. Service is always efficient and friendly. Love that they have interesting tabletop brain games to play while you wait too. Nikki Aranui Had takeout here twice last week. Best Chinese takeaway we have found in Christchurch yet, by far!!!! Massive containers filled to the brim with food. You can choose it with or without rice and it is only a few dollars more without the rice. We had lemon chicken, sweet and sour pork, chicken fried rice and wontons. It was ample for six people including a teenage boy who has hollow legs! It was amazingly tasty and just delicious. Also what I noticed was not a lot of sauce, but enough to cover each piece of sweet and sour pork or chicken. It wasn’t drenched in it which you find other places. I really liked that. The batter was crispy and hot. The wontons are not the typical shape - they were different but crispy and delicious!!! A lot of meat in them unlike others that are just the wonton wrappers and less than a teaspoon of meat. This had ALOT of meat!! This will now be our go to Chinese and fish and chips shop!!! Thanks Supreme. We will be back!!!! Ellie P PREV NEXT LOCATION × Average Customer Rating 4.3 Last minute order! name: Star Seafood Restaurant
homepage_content: Star Seafood Restaurant | Huntington Park | ORDER ONLINE | Takeaway | TuckerFox NZ Welcome to Star Seafood Restaurant PRE ORDER ONLINE Welcome to Star Seafood Restaurant Order Online from Star Seafood Restaurant Chinese Cuisine * 451 Ti Rakau Dr Huntington Park, Auckland 2013 * Online Menu * Takeaway * Secure Online Payments * TOP SELLERS 干蒸烧卖 Steam Pork Dim Sims $10.70 蝦餃皇 Prawn Dumplings $12.20 TOP SELLERS 干蒸烧卖 Steam Pork Dim Sims $10.70 蝦餃皇 Prawn Dumplings $12.20 Menus PRE ORDER ONLINE Online Operating Hours Pickup LUNCH DINNER Thursday 9am to 2pm 5:30pm to 8pm Friday 9am to 2pm 5:30pm to 8pm Saturday 9am to 2pm 5:30pm to 8pm Sunday 9am to 2pm 5:30pm to 8pm Monday 9am to 2pm 5:30pm to 8pm Tuesday 9am to 2pm 5:30pm to 8pm Wednesday Closed Closed REVIEWS Went for yum Cha. Pretty yum! Shumai juicy and lots of prawn. Squid tentacles crispy and flavourful. Waiters speak some English but didn’t seem to want to bring us some stuff we ordered for takeaway? Also no yumcha trolley, they come out on platters. Would go back, pretty equivalent to lobster palace and the other yum Cha place on chapel road. $110 for 3 of us. Rachel They are open quite early for Yum Cha, so it is best to go earlier than at 12pm. Usually there is a bit of a wait, as the restaurant is not big. Most tables are suitable for 4 people, with a few that can sit more. They bring out the food on trays, instead of trolleys and the selection is limited to your more traditional dishes. Still very tasty, but no special dishes William Lin A pretty nice yumcha place with reasonable prices. We went on a public holiday, it was busy but no wait time, we were seated immediately. Everything was good, nothing incredible but was overall tasty. The highlight would be the steamed yellow cake rolls, not too sweet, very fluffy with a little bit of saltiness from the filling in the centre. The bathroom was not very well maintained though. It wasn't disgusting, but only half of the toilets and basins were working, the others just had tape around them. Was about $130 for four adults, which I found ok, considering it was a public holiday. Good place to eat with friends. Just don't all go to the bathroom at once. JJ F Good place for lunch. Very delicious yumcha. need to go early because of too many people. WV HOMES The Chinese cuisine here is really good. All the dishes we had were top quality and 100% tasty. Service was very good with the waitresses being very attentive and polite. Raymond Goh PREV NEXT LOCATION × Average Customer Rating 3.8 Went for yum Cha. Pretty yum! Shumai juicy and lots of prawn. name: The Sands Brewery Bar & Kitchen
homepage_content: Home - The Sands Brewery Bar and Kitchen Home Events Menus Wine List Gallery Contact Us Reservations View our menus The Sands Brewery Bar and Kitchen The Sands Brewery Bar & Kitchen is a Monteiths themed brewery bar specifically designed for good times, great beer and awesome hospitality! Located directly opposite Nelson’s famous Tahuna beach on Rocks road in the Sands Apartments building with the sunniest court yard in town and plenty of parking. Food is available all day. Start the day with a fabulous breakfast from 7am, stick with us and roll into lunch until 5.00 pm, followed by dinner menu items designed to satisfy everyone’s appetite. Just wanting coffee by the beach? Serving Halo Coffee have in or takeaway. What can we offer you to drink? Traditional Monteith’s Beers on tap such as Original, Golden, Radler, Pilsner, Black, Mid strength & of course the very popular Apple Cider. Unique to the Montetihs Brewery Bars is the Monteiths Brewer Series craft range. Currently we have American Pale Ale & the Southern Pale Ale. Ever popular Heineken & Heineken Light are also on Tap along with assorted bottled brewer series beers & ciders. Local Wines from around the Nelson/Tasman region. We are open 7 days (with no surcharge on public holidays). Bookings are welcome but not essential. To make a reservation Click here . Our friendly staff will only be too pleased to make your day/evening experience a great & memorable one. Also we have courtesy van operating 7 days a week so call us and book your ride. Book your next mid winter christmas function with us now!! set menu to suit So come on down & enjoy Nelson's newest pub by the beach. We are open christmas day! Menus View our range of menus with food to suit every taste. View Menus Wine List View our extensive selection of wines from New Zealand and overseas. View Wine List Events There is always something happening at your local at the beach. Find Out More Phone: Email: All Rights Reserved - The Sands Brewery Bar and Kitchen Web Design by Activate Design

name: Tamarind of Gisborne
homepage_content: Tamarind Indian restaurant and bar ,Gisborne Tehapara Newzealnd top of page WELCOME Welcome visitors to your site with a short, engaging introduction. Double click to edit and add your own text. Start Now Tamarind of Gisborne offers a one-of-a-kind dining experience, showcasing fresh, locally-sourced ingredients and the best of New Zealand cuisine. Whether you're planning a romantic dinner or a fun night out with friends, Tamarind is the perfect place to enjoy the vibrant flavors of Gisborne. Tamarind of Gisborne was founded by food lovers Pooja and CJ Singh, driven by their passion for creating and enjoying exceptional meals. This passion led to the establishment of a restaurant where the community can come together to enjoy unique cuisine and a warm atmosphere. Inspired by discovering at a wine and food festival how well Indian food pairs with certain wines, the idea took shape. We proudly feature vibrant local wines and the popular beer Gisborne Gold, created by my late friend Geoff. Supporting local suppliers is key to us, from tender lamb to fresh seafood provided by local fisheries. We’re grateful to our suppliers for consistently delivering the ingredients needed for our recipes. Freshness and creativity are at the heart of what we do. With a diverse menu and unmatched service, we offer a culinary experience like no other. Call us today to book your reservation! Experience the finest culinary events at Tamarind Gisborne. Enjoy delicious food and drinks while socializing with friends. Contact us for details! Receive a 10% discount on online orders. Enjoy 10% to 20% off with UberEATS and Delivereasy. Monday-Wednesday Dine-in and Takeaways Deal: $21 for all mains Don't miss out! Log In bottom of page

They are open later than most so you can still get a good selection after 3pm. The sushi is very western style and not particularly tasty but it is affordable and the seating is nice. The selection is really good and the service is also good. It’s a decent spot to stop for a quick feed. Syd Eats My kids absolutely love this place! We’ve been coming here for over 10 years and still can’t get enough. It’s become one of our weekly go-to spots. The food is consistently fresh and delicious, and the prices are way better than most sushi bento places in Auckland. Easily one of the best-value Japanese cuisine spots in the area. Super friendly and service too, honestly, couldn’t ask for more! Michael Yummy yummy yummy sushi, this place always satisfies when I order from this restaurant. The fried chicken sushi pieces are the tastiest I’ve ever had. This place is going to make me very fat ahehehehehe. b h Wide range of delicious individual pick n mix sushi as well as bigger meals from menu that come fresh and fast. Restaurant is impeccably clean, owner is very nice and friendly, always greeting with a big smile, and it's awesome to have him and Sushi Zen in Lynfield. I slightly do wish it opens on Sundays but totally appreciate they deserve the rest Dean Stewart PREV NEXT LOCATION × Average Customer Rating 4.3 Not the best sushi - but average for the ‘lunch stop in’ NZ style. They offer a wide variety of options, including fish, meat, and vegetarian rolls. On top of that, the prices are reasonable and offer great value for money. Hands down the best sushi shop I have been to in New Zealand. Hannah Gin Self serve sushi restaurant. Decently priced, free wasabi and ginger at the cashier. The sushi was too sweet for my taste, but it's Americanized sushi so the sweetness is normal. Seating is fairly limited but you have the option of taking the food away in a plastic container. Everything is disposable except for the plates. Bamboo Panda Yummy great sushi good options and prices Amy Henry Fantastic selection of sushi, both hot and cold. Labelled well and presented beautifully. Self service was great and staff were friendly and welcoming. Lovely place to eat. Clean and tidy shop. Definitely will be back when we pass through Taupo again. Abbe Rose Johnson I'm not a sushi lover at all, but my lunch at this place changed my mind. name: Raviz Indian Cuisine
homepage_content: Raviz Indian Eatery Restaurant Auckland City | Home Delivery & Food Takeaway | Best Indian Restaurant Auckland About Raviz Indian Eatery Hobson Street Raviz Indian Eatery, located at 61 Hobson Street in Auckland's central business district, has been a cornerstone of authentic Indian dining in New Zealand since its establishment in 2000. Founded by Ravie Singh, the restaurant aims to provide patrons with a genuine taste of India's rich culinary heritage. The menu at Raviz is extensive, offering a variety of traditional dishes that cater to diverse palates. Signature items include the Chicken Tikka Raviz, various biryani selections, and an array of tandoori specialties. Vegetarian options such as Karahi Paneer and Navratan Korma are also available, ensuring that all guests find something to their liking. To complement the flavorful curries, a selection of naan breads, including garlic and Peshwari naan, is offered. The restaurant's ambiance is enhanced by traditional Indian music and vibrant dÃ©cor, creating an inviting atmosphere that transports diners to India. Whether you're dining in, opting for takeaway, or utilizing their meal delivery service, Raviz ensures a memorable experience with attentive and friendly staff. For those seeking an authentic Indian culinary journey in Auckland, Raviz Indian Eatery on Hobson Street stands as a testament to traditional flavors and warm hospitality. WHAT WE'RE OFFERING At Raviz Indian Eatery â Hobson Street, we offer authentic Indian dishes, including rich curries, sizzling tandoori, aromatic biryanis, and fresh naan. Enjoy dine-in, takeaway, or delivery for a flavorful experience. ENTREES Start your meal with our delicious Indian entrÃ©es, featuring crispy, spiced, and flavor-packed delights. MAINS Delicious, authentic Indian mains, from rich curries to sizzling tandoori dishes, crafted with tradition. RESERVATION Reserve your table at Raviz Indian Eatery Hobson Street for an authentic Indian dining experience today! Sub Continental Cuisine Authentic Subcontinental flavors with rich spices, aromatic curries, and tandoori delights for a true taste experience. ORDER ONLINE Indo - Chinese A flavorful fusion of Indian spices and Chinese techniques, creating bold, aromatic, and savory dishes. ORDER ONLINE Desserts Indulge in rich Indian desserts like Gulab Jamun and Mango Kulfi, bursting with authentic flavors. ORDER ONLINE This is where you go in Auckland for indian food that will blow you mind, tender delicious. Clean spotless, excellent service. Iâm a chef my mates a chef we are both highly impressed and we are hard bitten fussy old blokes. This is Professional recommendation not just a Joe blow. ORAC ENSOR First time ordering here. Food was great & staff were friendly, I highly recommend if you're in the CBD. Not too sure why there's so many negative reviews? if you're after good quality Indian Cuisine then give them a go, l couldn't fault the service or the food....it was great. Dan M Good place in the CBD to have Indian food. Initially thought it was a Pakistani restaurant due to the name, so I was avoiding this restaurant because I was looking for Indian style food. But then I tried one time and found the name is based on managing director Ravie. The food was authentic Indian and tasty. name: Shubh Takeaways
homepage_content: Home - SHUBH Skip to content View Menu The Shubh Tiffin Fresh Punjabi Curries, Made Daily At Shubh, we prepare 20-25 varieties of fresh Punjabi curries every single day, cooked each morning using authentic recipes passed down through generations. Perfect for your homestyle dinners, weekly meal prep, or a quick wholesome lunch, every curry is carefully packed in boxes, ready for you to pick and choose from our counter – that’s what we call The Shubh Tiffin. Mix and match your favourites with our range of rotis and parathas, or pair them with our comforting rice dishes for a complete, nourishing meal that feels just like home. The Shubh Tiffin is all about fresh, healthy, and flavourful food – made daily with love and care. WELCOME TO SHUBH Heritage on a plate, crafted with love since 2010 ABOUT US SHUBH offers fresh Punjabi Indian food that tastes authentic with original spices used in recipes that date back many years ago, that tastes exactly how it is supposed to be back in the motherland. Our motto is quality over quantity with fresh produce. We pride on carefully selected fresh veggies from our Punjabi farmers. Enjoy the blend of our hand-roasted spices Shubh specializes in the unique flavours of Vegetarian Punjabi cuisine. Come and taste the all time favorites of our delicious cuisine! UNVEIL OUR STORY WHERE FAMILY FAITH FLAVORS MEET STARTERS & STREET EATS Begin your journey with the vibrant flavors of Punjabi street food — from crisp pakoras and spiced chaats to tangy chutneys that awaken the senses. Each bite carries the joy of roadside favorites, lovingly recreated for the table. EXPLORE OUR MENU Curries & Classics Our curries celebrate tradition, blending hand-roasted spices with fresh vegetables and paneer to create dishes rich in comfort and culture. From homely dals to festive gravies, each bowl is a reflection of heritage and heart. EXPLORE OUR MENU Fresh Breads & Rice Our curries celebrate tradition, blending hand-roasted spices with fresh vegetables and paneer to create dishes rich in comfort and culture. From homely dals to festive gravies, each bowl is a reflection of heritage and heart. EXPLORE OUR MENU Sweets & Desserts End on a sweet note with traditional Punjabi desserts. From syrup-soaked gulab jamun to festive ladoos and creamy kheer, these timeless indulgences bring nostalgia and celebration to every meal. EXPLORE OUR MENU CUSTOMER APPRECIATIONS Cizhyi “ My partner and I have been going to this place to get takeout for years and we love it! The food is amazing, portions very generous and affordable, the staff are always super friendly, and it’s definitely the most value for money takeout you can get pretty much anywhere! The takeout is cold so you have to heat it yourself, but its 1000% worth it. “ balakrishna p “ Great value for money! The food was delicious and the prices were surprisingly reasonable. I particularly appreciated the attentive and friendly service from Mr.Deepak , making our meal even more enjoyable.. Budget friendly food outlet.. “ Ray Eagle “ Super Yummy, My first visit today, takeaways only, so I took away 2 semosas, and 1 fried paneer square, all were delicious, many freshly made curries to choose from, all Vegetarian, all Home made fresh daily 😊 “ HOURS & LOCATION EVERY DAY 10AM – 9PM 520 – 524 SANDRIGHAM ROAD, SANDRIGHAM, AUCKLAND

homepage_content: The Good Oil Cafe | Dunedin cafe, best cafes in Dunedin Selling premium coffee and delicious quality food, backed up by quality service, in two Dunedin locations Open 7 days 7:30 am to 4:00 pm 314 George St - (03) 479 9900 Nichol's Garden Centre, 51 Teviot St - (03) 455 8785 Selling premium coffee and delicious quality food, backed up by quality service, in two Dunedin locations Home Services Contact Home (03) 479 9900 Home Services Contact Tasty food, great coffee, friendly service IT'S ALL ON THE MENU AT THE GOOD OIL CAFÉ The great tasting food prepared using fresh ingredients, wide selection of hot and cold drinks and decadent teatime treats including gooey caramel slices, luscious brownies and gluten-free friands have made The Good Oil Cafe the place to go in Dunedin. Luckily there are now two handy locations where you can try all our goodies for yourself - George St and Nichol's. Visit today to discover why our cinnamon swirls have achieved cult-like status. Excellent service, exceptional coffee. The Good Oil is simply the best Dunedin café Established in 2003, The Good Oil Cafe has been providing customers with delicious food and exceptional coffee for more than a decade. The Good Oil Cafe philosophy is founded upon fresh, seasonal ingredients and the best coffee served the way you love it. Places to eat in Dunedin don’t come better than this. You can choose from a mouth-watering all-day menu of à la carte and cabinet food to tempt and satisfy your appetite with friendly staff looking forward to welcoming you as a regular coffee and lunch customer. The Good Oil Cafe really is one of the best cafés in Dunedin . If you want to check something about our menu or are interested in our private catering services , contact The Good Oil Cafe today . Learn More... Two handy locations - George St and Nichol’s Garden Centre Sometimes when you can’t get enough of one thing, you must have two and so The Good Oil Cafe , as one of the favoured cafés in Dunedin , serves customers from two convenient locations - at 314 George Street and in Nichol's Garden Centre in Timaru Street. Both locations are open for breakfast from 7.30am but make sure you arrive early to avoid the morning coffee rush. Both our locations are also popular spots for a cafe lunch in Dunedin , with local workers, residents and visitors alike. You’ll no longer have to wonder where to eat in Dunedin again - just pop into The Good Oil Cafe for a healthy but tasty breakfast or lunch or a morning or afternoon tea treat. Our team also offer fuss-free catering services so get in touch with The Good Oil Café today to discuss your requirements. Learn More... name: The Dragon Express Restaurant
homepage_content: Welcome to Dragon Express Christchurch Book a Table 03 348 1805 Peking Duck Specialist Home History About Cliff Menus Main Menu Lunch Menu Wine List Gallery Contact Welcome to the Dragon Express Restaurant Best Chinese Restaurant in Christchurch, New Zealand Peking duck bureaucracy: Is it time to bid farewell to the Chinese take on roast duck? Chefs specialising in Chinese-style roast duck are grappling with a dilemma: ditch traditional culinary techniques, or risk prosecution for breaching food safety rules. The rules, set by the Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI), âfailed to take traditional Chinese culinary techniques into accountâ, Christchurch chef Cliff Yeung said. Full article ... Dragon Express is a Chinese, dine-in, fully licensed restaurant where Chefs prepare food of the highest quality, to Hong Kong standards of finest dining. I would recommend you come to Dragon Express just to meet the chef and owner, Cliff. He is such a character and always manages to make us laugh and to make his customers feel welcome and at ease with his sense of humour and passion for food. Come to Dragon Express today to enjoy the experience of carefully prepared, beautifully served, Chinese food. Cliff would like to welcome everyone to try this traditional Chinese dining experience, while assuring you that there is no need to be wary of how to eat or to behave, simply come to Dragon Express Restaurant and immerse yourself in the experience. For your peace of mind we have included information on Chinese Dining, and you are welcome to follow these links for more information on: Table manners - Chinese Style Plate, Cup, Chopsticks – the tools of dining and their intended usage Décor –the ancient artwork that graces our restaurant walls At Dragon Express we strongly believe that Chinese dining should be an experience to be enjoyed, and each carefully prepared dish to be discovered and savoured for its uniqueness. This passion led Cliff back to Hong Kong in the early 80’s to complete Chef training, so that he could bring those methods back to his home in New Zealand to be shared and enjoyed by all. Want to book a table? Call 03 348 1805 and speak to one of the Dragon Express team members The Dragon Express Restaurant | 88 Riccarton Rd - Riccarton - Christchurch | 03 348 1805

Dinein and Takeaways About Shiraz About Shiraz Indian Restaurant The very first Shiraz Indian restaurant was opened in 1996 in Whangarei. The current owner, Jaswant Singh Minhas, is originally from the Punjab region of India, and a chef by trade.He started working at Shiraz when he arrived in New Zealand, juggling shifts alongside his business management studies. He bought that Shiraz Indian restaurant in 1998. At that time it was opposite Forum North, a site that was later turned into a carpark. Read More Free Entree Promotion Terms and Conditions 1. name: Try It Out Restaurant
homepage_content: Casual Dining - Vietnamese | Tryitout.nz | Auckland top of page OTAHUHU & EAST TAMAKI WE ARE BACK !! 7 DAYS A WEEK HOLIDAY HOURS 25/12 X-MAS DAY - CLOSED EVERY OTHER DAYS OPEN NORMAL HOURS BUN BO HUE Bún bò Huế is a hidden Vietnamese gem. It's a rich and spicy soup with deep layers of flavor. This Central Vietnamese soup is paired with tender slices of beef and pork, then topped with lots of fresh herbs FRIED RICE Stir seasoning liquid and add to fried rice, tossing to coat evenly. Serve fried rice sprinkled with cilantro or mint and dry-roasted peanuts PHO Pho (Phở) originated in the early 20th century in northern Vietnam. It is a Vietnamese soup consisting of broth, bánh phở (rice noodles), simple herbs and vegetables, and meat Menus Our Story Begins In The East Cuisine in this country of 70,000,000 people differs strikingly between the north, south and central regions, but two key features stand out. First, rice plays an essential role in the nation’s diet as it does throughout southeast Asia. But this is also a noodle-crazy population, regularly downing them for breakfast, lunch and dinner, in homes, restaurants and at roadside stands. Noodles are eaten wet and dry, in soup or beside soup, and are made in different shapes and thicknesses of wheat, rice and mung beans. Secondly, no meal is complete without fresh vegetables and herbs. A key portion of every meal, north, south and central, is a platter containing cucumbers, bean threads, slices of hot pepper, and sprigs of basil, coriander, mint and a number of related herbs found principally in southeast Asian markets. About "When you drink the water, remember the spring" Wisdom Contact Reservation bottom of page

name: Taj Spice Indian Restaurant & Takeaway
homepage_content: Taj Spice Indian Restaurant in Hastings | Takeaway & Home Delivery - Order Meal Entree From Tandoori Temptations to Curry Classics, Dive into Delicious Entrees! Mains Savor the Finest Flavors: Our Main Courses Promise a Gastronomic Adventure Book A Table Ensure Your Place at the Feast: Reserve Your Table for a Culinary Celebration! Contact Us Your Feedback Drives Us Forward: Contact Us to Share Your Experience Taj Spice Indian Restaurant Taj Spice Indian Restaurant offers an exquisite culinary journey through the vibrant flavors of India, right in the heart of St Leonards, Hastings. Nestled in a quaint corner along Heretaunga Street West, this restaurant beckons patrons with its inviting ambiance and the promise of authentic Indian cuisine crafted with passion and expertise. As you step into Taj Spice, you're greeted by the warm aroma of spices and the welcoming ambiance that sets the stage for an unforgettable dining experience. The interior decor combines modern elegance with traditional Indian elements, creating a comfortable and inviting space for diners to relax and indulge in the rich tapestry of Indian flavors. The menu at Taj Spice is a testament to the diverse culinary heritage of India, featuring a tantalizing array of dishes meticulously prepared to delight the senses. From aromatic curries to sizzling tandoori specialties, each dish is a masterpiece, bursting with the freshest ingredients and authentic spices sourced from the finest suppliers. At Taj Spice, hospitality is as important as the food itself, with attentive staff dedicated to ensuring a memorable dining experience for every guest. Whether you're enjoying a romantic dinner for two, a family celebration, or a casual meal with friends, you'll find yourself enveloped in the warmth and hospitality that defines Indian culture. Whether you're a connoisseur of Indian cuisine or embarking on your first foray into its flavors, Taj Spice Indian Restaurant invites you to embark on a culinary adventure that will transport your taste buds to the vibrant streets of India, right here in Hastings, New Zealand. View our full menu Order Takeaway Online Order Online Now Contact Phone: 06-876 6063 Address: 936 Heretaunga Street West, St Leonards, Hastings 4120, New Zealand Opening Hours Sunday To Monday: 4:30am - 10:00pm Tuesday To Saturday: 11:00am - 10:00pm Order Online Now

And son loved his foot (only ate plain inari) We found this was the most expensive sushi train we have been to and pricing didn’t really match the quality of food. Staff were lovely and very accommodating. Easy to get to, with a little side street parking option just a couple of shops away. Mel A This is quality sushi. The dishes are fresh and the price reasonable. The train itself goes very quickly so you have to be a little nimble to grab your dish without making a mess. Good variety and made-to-order items available too. G Mac It wasn't quite pleasant for me as it was my first time I don't know the drinks were self-service while the hostess was quite frustrated on me. Food are so so for me compared with Kazu as my taste bud prefers to have balance on the sushi between the rice and main ingredients . Best part they have your own DIY California roll with a chunk of rice in it. Most of the sushi sizes are quite big with chunk of rice which makes it a little bit pricey compared to Kazu due to the size.but what I like most there is fresh n big size of sashimi. Catherine Zeitouni I am usually not a big fan of sushi but this was awesome. It was my first time going to a restaurant with a sushi train. Everything looked so delicious! They charge by the plate so you basically just grab whatever you like the look of off the train and eat it. They the bill gets totalled up at the end by the number and colour of plates you ate. I was actually surprised at the cost. It wasn't the cheapest around but it definitely wasn't expensive. I felt it was money well spent for the freshness and quality of the sushi. Plus I had so much fun! I ate alot tofu sushi and some karaage chicken. The chicken was to die for! Highly recommend that! And the tofu is a great alternative for those with dietary needs like vegetarian or vegan. There were also other options i noticed; avocado sushi, deep fried tofu and beans. The restaurant is also family friendly. Kids love the sushi train! I saw quite a number of kids and even a new born in the restaurant. The staff are very accommodating and gave fantastic service. They also had a bathroom which was very clean and free lemon water. If you are wanting to park really close, try find a spot on Allen Street. It seems like all the parking in the city is paid. But it only cost us $5 for an hour. Braydon Murphy Not been for years, and recently decided to go back. Great decision too. Food quality is still top notch and added to the friendly staff its a winning combination. name: The Corner Stone Cafe
homepage_content: The Corner Stone Cafe - The Corner Stone Cafe The Corner Stone Cafe The perfect place to stop and enjoy a delicious meal, quick snack, coffee or a refreshing drink. Opening Hours: Mon – Sun 7:30 am to 3:00 pm Closed Public Holidays 07 867 3375 Menu About Us Located on the Corner of State Highway 2 and State Highway 25. Half way between Auckland and Tauranga. The Corner Stone Restaurant and Cafe is the perfect place to stop and enjoy a delicious meal, quick snack, coffee or a refreshing drink. Take a walk around the area on the walking track, an easy 10-minute stroll. 07 867 3375 What People Say Best Cafe In Mangatarata The Corner Stone Cafe is an absolute treat for travellers and families. Beautiful picturesque scenes, excellent food and great coffee. The Corner Stone is the perfect choice for a relaxing early morning breakfast. The tasty breakfast menu includes a traditional big breakfast, French Toast, Eggs, Pancakes, and our delicious Bagels. Lunchtime brings more filling meals where your selection includes; Burgers, Toasted Sandwiches, Chicken Focaccia, Corn Fritters, S teak Sandwiches with blue cheese, and Prawn & Avocado Salad. Breakfast & Lunch In Mangatarata The Corner Stone Cafe is a 15-minute drive from the Maramarua Golf Club, 13 Minute from the beautiful Ngatea Water Gardens and only 24 Minutes from Thames. The Corner Stone Cafe is perfect for families with kids, not only for the delicious kid’s menu but also for the playground, sure to keep your little ones entertained while you enjoy your perfect meal. name: Winner Winner Courtenay Place
homepage_content: Winner Winner | Fried Chicken Dinner Back Menu Digital table ordering Catering Scroll Winner Winner was born and proudly raised in Hamilton East by a team of passionate foodies working in the hospitality industry. Now in Hamilton East & Wellington's Courtenay Place . Built to fill a gap for an easy option for healthy, fast, fresh dinners or lunches that were inclusive to all food preferences and didn't scrimp on good vibes. The wholesome, eclectic, comfort food filled menu came together naturally to create the ultimate, option-filled all-day eatery where everyone was welcome.

The food is always amazing. You have to try the Deep Fried Rice Chicken, the chicken was incredibly moist and tender. Service is great. My only minor note is they don't give free water, which is a bit of a shame, but the food quality keeps this a 5-star spot. Ann Vu From the outside it doesn’t really stand out, but the food is honestly so good and the service is super quick. I tried the beef satay, Hainanese chicken with rice, and combination fried noodle. The beef satay is quite sweet, so maybe skip it if you’re not into sweet dishes. The chicken rice was my fave, a must-try! The spicy sauce that comes with it is sooooo tasty. The noodles were really good too, first time trying and I was impressed. They also have fresh lime juice. Just a heads up, the food smell does stick, so your clothes might carry the scent after, but honestly worth it. We love the banh mi, we always ask for extra chilli in it 🌶 delicious... the noodle 🍜 pho is always nice and huge portion, the best 👌, also iced caramel with bubble that popped up in our mouth, so yum... 😋 Sendy Fatraria I recently had a fantastic dining experience at this restaurant! The Shrimp Pad Thai, dumplings, and summer rolls were all incredibly delicious, with fresh flavors and perfectly cooked ingredients. The food was not only tasty but also beautifully presented. The owner, a lovely lady boss, was especially warm and friendly, making us feel very welcome. The entire staff was attentive, ensuring that we had everything we needed throughout the meal. I strongly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and excellent service. It’s definitely worth a visit! Carol Tiong Food was delicious I ordered for Vietnamese style chicken curry I loved it service was great a.g surendaran Huge portions and very very tasty! Highly recommend the soups, but everything is very good. Service was quick and friendly, a favourite place to eat in Petone. E P ×

I'm not saying they are not delicious but thet simply are not good enough for me to return. My expectations to Xiang series dishes are yummy enough making me nonstop eating rice. Eric Chou奧克蘭寶哥 Wife been to this place numerous times and whom recommended hence we went together. I cannot understand why all the teapots look so filthy and dirty but the owners still using them? With its warm ambiance and attentive service, this establishment offers an authentic dining experience that tantalizes the senses. From the moment guests step inside, they are greeted by the tantalizing aroma of spices and the welcoming atmosphere. The restaurant's decor blends traditional elements with modern touches, creating an inviting space for patrons to savor their meal. At The Flaming Tandoor, the menu boasts an array of dishes inspired by the diverse culinary traditions of India. From fragrant biryanis to sizzling tandoori specialties, each dish is crafted with care using fresh, locally sourced ingredients and traditional cooking techniques. Signature dishes include succulent chicken tikka, flavorful lamb curry, and creamy butter chicken, all prepared to perfection and bursting with authentic flavors. Vegetarian options abound, with dishes like paneer tikka and vegetable korma offering a delightful array of choices for non-meat eaters. Complementing the exquisite cuisine is an extensive selection of wines, beers, and cocktails, carefully curated to enhance the dining experience. Whether enjoying a romantic dinner for two or gathering with friends and family, The Flaming Tandoor promises a memorable culinary adventure that celebrates the rich tapestry of Indian cuisine. I have also had their Chinese meals in the past and they are always beautiful with fresh vegetables and very generous portions. Lynda Wightman I absolutely need my Chinese takeaways time to time in my life and we just moved to Tawa from Wellington city we had no idea where to go etc. one of my closest friends originally from Tawa recommended this place and we went there once then I think we go here at least once a week now. Price can’t be better, very reasonable and the taste + quality of food is great too. I’ve never seen the actual sweet and sour pork that has more meat than carrots…. name: Zest Cafe
homepage_content: Zest Cafes Welcome To Zest Cafe Order Online Welcome To Zest Cafe Order Online WELCOME TO ZEST CAFE Zest Cafe Restaurant is a cozy and vibrant eatery nestled in the heart of Peel Street at 22 Peel Street, Gisborne 4010, New Zealand, Renowned for its warm ambiance and exceptional hospitality, Zest Cafe offers a delightful escape for food enthusiasts and coffee lovers alike. The menu is a harmonious blend of modern and traditional flavors, catering to a diverse range of palates. Whether you're in the mood for a hearty breakfast, a light lunch, or a decadent dessert, Zest has something for everyone. Signature dishes include their perfectly poached eggs served with artisanal bread, fresh salads bursting with flavor, and a selection of locally inspired mains. The cafe also prides itself on its specialty coffee, brewed to perfection by skilled baristas using high-quality beans. The interiors of Zest Cafe Restaurant are thoughtfully designed, featuring contemporary decor that creates a welcoming and relaxed atmosphere. Large windows allow natural light to flood the space, making it an ideal spot for a leisurely brunch or a casual catch-up with friends.
